review_title: Awesome machine with terrible UEFI options
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2019
review_text: This is a Christmas gift for my child and I've been playing around with it for a couple of weeks to get everything the way I want (changing terrible Windows 10 default settings, installing parental control software, cleaning up start menu, removing bloatware, etc).  I consider myself an "advanced basic" user as I don't work in tech but I've built a couple of rigs and usually upgrade and replace components in my own PCs.  Anyhow, bought this with the intention of making the following changes (so my review is based on the laptop in this configuration): swap S-mode for regular Windows 10 (free and easy but irreversible), install an additional 4 gigs of RAM for a total of 8 installed, tweak settings as mentioned before.Almost everything about this machine is amazing, and for the price I don't believe a better deal can be had.  It puts my husband's budget laptop to shame.  The SSD is quiet and smooth, the monitor display is beautiful, it can stream and handle basic tasks without any lag at all, and the ports are totally sufficient.  The keys feel excellent (plus backlighting!), the brushed aluminum case top looks very stylish, and the speakers are totally sufficient for a laptop (if you want great sound quality use headphones).  The AMD Ryzen processors are very good and this will typically outperform the slightly higher priced model with the Intel i3.  Windows 10 is Windows 10, but it's better than S-mode.  The hard drive capacity is quite small and if this were for me as a primary computer I'd want more storage space, but if this is for a child or not your primary computer it might not even be noticed.I was, and still am, super impressed, but one glaring deficiency of this laptop is the motherboard control, specifically in how it lets you see/access/change UEFI firmware settings.  Thought it was an ASUS for some reason but I'm unsure of manufacturer as it's not specified in UEFI and there's just a Chinese name on the mobo (it's not listed in windows device specs either; I'll probably have to download Speccy or some such).  Apparently it's common for laptops to have a limited UEFI/BIOS compared to PCs, but the items you can change here are basically nil.  You can disable fast boot and see/do a few things like that, but forget memory or graphics settings.  If I'd known this, I'd probably still have bought it, but I'd have planned my RAM purchase more carefully and factored in the higher cost of upgrading the machine.Windows sets aside memory for some things like paging (virtual memory, but changing this had no effect on usable RAM), other OS tasks, and for sharing with the onboard graphics card, and that combined with some default mobo settings means your installed RAM will not always be your usable RAM, as is easily seen in system settings (assuming your RAM stick is working, compatible, and installed correctly).  For instance, on this laptop I now have 5.94 gigs usable out of 8 gigs installed.  UEFI correctly shows the 8192 mb installed but won't let me tweak memory remapping or virtually anything at all, and as I've tried everything outside BIOS setting tweaking to increase the usable RAM without success, I'm basically out of luck, having paid for a good 4 gig stick to get a 2 gig upgrade.  Anyhoo, if I'd known this in advance I'd have planned to get two 8 gig sticks and may still do so at some point in the future, but it's highly irritating that this mobo will not allow settings changes to fully utilize your hardware.  I'm not trying to overclock, ffs.Hopefully this helps anyone who's looking at this laptop with plans to upgrade the memory (and possibly the HD).  All in all, I would still highly recommend it for so many reasons, just know you may be spending a bit more on RAM than you'd planned.  If you don't want to upgrade, the 4 gigs installed is totally fine for light usage and all the basic tasks.  It's a beautiful little "budget" laptop.

review_title: Won't be wrong at this price
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2019
review_text: A few months after the purchase....It is still running good and I bought 5 more for my colleagues, so I bought all together 8 machines.  My of my colleagues need more memory while some need less.  So what I do is, for those who need more, I took the 4GB RAM out from their machine and put it in the machine of the colleague who needs less.  So 1 machine got 2x4G running in dual channel with identical RAM and install a new 2x8G for the original machine.  To be honest, difference for 4 to 8 is high, but little difference from 8 to 16.  So those in a tight budget can save your money._____________________This laptop is great.  For this price, there is nothing to complain.I use this for basic computer needs at home.  What I will do with is just Office, surfing, youtube, netflix.  This computer handles it really well, all very smoothly.What I like most is the screen.  It is IPS.  At this price point (310 for me), most laptops are bundled with TN display, which be honestly is a deal breaker.  The screen here is gorgeous.  I do not see much difference to my gaming laptop which cost me thrice.  Sound is good, keyboard design average.  I don't like the small num pad.  Some people complained on the backlight, but I don't need this function.  But the num lock indicator, however, is important but wasn't there.On the spec, there is just 4G of RAM.  You can, however, upgrade it easily.  There are 10 screws at of back.  Open it and you can add another slot of RAM and another HDD.  My recommendation, upgrade to 8 or 16G and add another SDD drive immediately after the setup is done as 128G storage will not be enough.  For gaming, I am yet to test it, but at 310, don't expect anything.Ar..  the Windows S issue, google Windows S Switch and you will know how to change it back to Windows 10 Home.  It is just a few clicks and a few minutes.  Everyone can do it.After all, a great computer.  My family members ordered 2 when they see mine.  Highly recommend.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2019
review_text: What at first sight caught my attention was the design of this laptop, minimalist to put it in some way, having it in my hands because I am not disappointed at all, the build quality is good for a laptop of this price (I acquired it  for $ 309.99 dollars), the touchpad is of a considerable size because it allows you to navigate freely and the gestures, are quite intuitive, the bad thing that you notice is that you click manually (if you prefer since it is better to do it through the configuration of two fingers  ) The touchpad is perceived loose, cleaning it shows as if it moved to the sides.  The keyboard is magnificent, the position of the keys is just what you need, the noise it makes when you type it is not annoying, it has lighting which helps you a lot when using it in low light, it is programmed to turn off if you do not use it  which is good if you are watching a movie, reading or watching videos on YouTube.  The screen is very good, to be honest I was very surprised, its quality is quite clear the colors are not appreciated false or over saturated, the image quality it offers is something that will fascinate you outdoors because you have to look for a good angle of that  shape will not be affected, the brightness is decent if you want to lower it to a minimum and when you choose to upload it to the maximum you will appreciate the clear images without perceiving that feeling of discomfort.  In terms of performance I can not add much, of course the programs I use because I do not consider them something that requires too much resources from the processor, it is worth mentioning that I chose the laptop with an AMD Ryzen 3 3200U Dual-Core Processor 2.6GHz.  I consider it a laptop for normal day-to-day use, to perform tasks in Excel, to do documents, to browse the web, are things that make them very easily the solid state disk (128 SSD) allows you to open programs with  very easily, even with the basic specifications you will have a very good performance and speed, I have installed Autocad 3D which is the program that I normally have installed on my MacBook Pro and it turns out that it runs without any complications.  Windows 10 version S is installed at the factory.The audio is quite good for the price of the laptop, the music is clear but do not expect to have a serious and powerful sound I will only tell you that it is good, what I disliked was the fact when I put the laptop on my legs or on the surface  From my bed the audio is compromised. The battery life I would put about 5 hours with a medium intensive use.Summing up if what you are looking for is a PC that has a good performance and speed for basic day-to-day use in current standards, because this is your option, if you are looking for something more professional then you will have to look at more options that offer you higher  specifications, at least I use it for personal use and I am very happy with its performance, I have not installed any games so I can not give you a review about its behavior in games.Switching out of S mode in windows 10On your PC running Windows 10 in S mode, open Settings  > Update & Security  > Activation.In the Switch to Windows 10 Home or Switch to Windows 10 Pro section, select Go to the Store. (If you also see an "Upgrade your edition of Windows" section, be careful not to click the "Go to the Store" link that appears there.)On the Switch out of S mode (or similar) page that appears in the Microsoft Store, select the Get button. After you see a confirmation message on the page, you'll be able to install apps from outside of the Microsoft Store.

review_title: HEAVIER THAN EXPECTED. wanted basic lap top for simple games, web news & email
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2020
review_text: I don't use the internet for work anymore, I'm retired.  But I wanted a backlit keyboard (woo hoo) without paying $1,000 and decent memory to play simple computer games.  This cost about $100 more than I wanted to spend too.My $250 -- approx 9 month old Dell is JUNK. The key letters wore off at about month 5, and after the 1st update, it lacked memory for the 2nd Windows UPDATE.  The Dell website did NOT disclose that it was OUTDATED MODEL.So I came to Amazon, because I could look at the top 40 selling list and see what other people, based on their knowledge and research, were purchasing.  THAT IS HOW I SELECTED THIS LAP TOP.Out of the box -- plug it in, plugged into my ethernet cable1st challenge -- turn off Microsoft S Setting so I could install programs NOT in MS store2nd challenge -- junk programs that I did NOT ask for -- remove xbox and MS Office, etc.3rd irritation -- stickers on the panel near touch screen & keypad left STICKY STUFF right where my wrist rests.  I imagine rubbing alcohol may damage the paint so it may take me MONTHS to remove this sticker mess residue. MAJOR IRRITATIONSet up -- out of box set up, plugged into ethernet -- took roughly 10 to 20 minutes -- but I'm not a techie and I needed to find my Windows account information and passwords to add my Google Mail.  So if you have existing MS Account get that from your settings on MS Edge / Explorer before you begin. Ditto for Apple account etc.Speed -- wow so much nicer than the comparable priced OUT of date Dell that I've had the past yearKeyboard -- love the back light ( BIG ^5) AND it is farther apart on keys but I'm adjusting.  I thought I'd not like the 10 key on end but I don't notice it.Updates -- so far no major Windows Updates have been neededFirst impression, I am very pleased. It will take a few weeks to get all the settings like my old computer and get all the account passwords transferred to this computer. I thought when I logged onto my Google Account that it would do that -- maybe I've missed that step.INTERNET SUGGESTION FOR SET UP -- Be sure to give your computer a UNIQUE DEVICE NAME on your internet service provider as you set that up.  My technical support advised me yesterday that was potentially one of my problems that I was having FYI.NOTE - WHY CABLE VERSUS WIRELESS -- I used ethernet cable so did not do wireless at ALL on the set up.  There are 20 modems with 5G within reach of this laptop -- it weakens the signal for me to use wireless inside my apartment per Sparklight technical support.UPDATE July 5th -- I keep loosing the SOUND -- I've reset the settings 3 times already to restore the SOUND -- this is why Microsoft should not be a monopoly (Update#3 so far, now the sound is here all the time YEAH ME)UPDATE Dec -- the ethernet  / folding socket has a "spring" to expand it for the cord, right? so... it is annoying as the dickens to be in the middle of being on line and the CORD COMES UNCLICKED so EASILY!! I am replacing my cord and upgrading it -- but just FYI that feature seems to be a defective design flaw. (left side view, next to the power socket)

Video is flawless and the browser is great! It holds a decent charge for at least 8 hours and the fan is so quiet, I literally didn't notice it. It's easy to navigate and use and basic user friendly. review_title: Wonderful Laptop That Won't Break the Bank
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2019
review_text: I rarely review products but figured this may be helpful to some. For starters, some background context: I am in my mid-20s and have long since finished uni. I am not a gamer. I primarily use my laptop(s)/tablets for streaming shows/movies; occasionally working from home; and crafting/design editing. I used to go through every iteration of a MacBook but, while nice, soon found myself not really utilizing all of its features & could no longer justify its price-point (especially since I do still have an iPhone).This laptop is a STEAL for ~$300. I did my research and honestly, like a majority of the other reviews here said, the Acer Aspire 5 blows every other product in its price bracket out of the water. That said, I went into this fully knowing I wanted an inexpensive laptop and that, because of that constraint, whatever I ended up purchasing would most likely have some limitations. If you purchased this and are disappointed about the specs in correlation to it being ~$300.... I really don't know what to tell you other than that you definitely were looking in the wrong place.I solely bought this computer because I recently got a CRICUT Explore Air 2 and needed something compatible with it (Chromebooks won't work and my MacBook is so old it can barely handle the newest OS); however, I already know now that this is going to become my main laptop and I will get a lot of use from it outside of just crafting.THE IMPORTANT STUFF:1.) This is a solidly-built laptop. Very sturdy, very lightweight. Perfect for on-the-go. It IS aluminum though the whole way around, so I recommend buying a case or sleeve to avoid scratching.2.) The screen resolution and sound quality is surprising very good, crisp, and clean - while I think perhaps it could be a tad bit brighter, that's just me being nit-picky. I would still recommend using external speakers if you want to retain the quality of sound at its loudest setting, especially if what you listen to is bass-heavy.3.) Turning off Windows S-Mode was absolutely painless - it's literally just going to the website that's taped on the outside of the box and clicking one or two buttons.4.) Like other reviewers recommended, I did purchase another 8GB of RAM and installed it myself (I googled YouTube videos on how to do this for this specific laptop model; there are plenty of them, just take it slow and you'll be fine). I opted to leave IN the 4GB stick that was already there, thus giving myself a total of 12GB RAM. The difference in speed is HUGE and, like I said, I'm not using this for *too* much other than everyday use. Spend that little bit of extra money if you can, I promise it's worth it! I can't speak to anything as to whether it would hold-up with gaming, but definitely for a solid several hours of streaming content, crafting, and/or having multiple tabs & apps open simultaneously.5.) The track-pad is VERY sensitive. Not so much so that I would take off a star, but enough to notice. I recommend purchasing a wireless mouse if you plan on doing more intricate work to eliminate any annoyance or mistakes. I bought one (a Logitech one, $10) and so far it's definitely made designing and editing much easier.It's been awhile since I've had a PC but it's nice to know that a lot of its shortcomings (such as memory space & speed) can easily be fixed and modified to your preference. Again, at the end of the day, this is NOT a heavyweight laptop, both literally and figuratively speaking, but that's okay because it's not meant to be! Overall, I would highly recommend this computer to anyone who is looking for an everyday laptop that is both budget-friendly without sacrificing too much of its quality.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2024
review_text: The Acer Aspire 3 A315-24P-R7VH Slim Laptop has been an excellent companion for my college work. Powered by the AMD Ryzen 3 7320U processor, it handles all my academic tasks with ease, from writing essays to conducting research online. The 15.6" Full HD IPS display provides crisp visuals and vibrant colors, making studying and multimedia consumption a pleasure. Its slim and lightweight design makes it convenient to carry around campus, and the long battery life ensures I can work without interruptions throughout the day. Overall, the Acer Aspire 3 A315-24P-R7VH Slim Laptop offers reliable performance and affordability, making it a great choice for college students.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2023
review_text: purchased the Acer Aspire 5 Slim laptop, and overall, I'm thrilled with my purchase. The affordable price point was a major selling point, and the laptop has exceeded my expectations in many ways.**Pros:**1. **Affordable Price:** One of the standout features of this laptop is its budget-friendly price. It's a fantastic option for those looking for solid performance without breaking the bank.2. **Sleek Design:** The slim and sleek design of the Acer Aspire 5 is aesthetically pleasing, making it a stylish choice for both work and leisure.3. **Decent Performance:** For everyday tasks and light productivity, this laptop performs admirably. I've been able to multitask, browse the internet, and use various applications without any noticeable lag.4. **Good Battery Life:** The battery life has been impressive, providing ample usage time on a single charge. This makes it convenient for on-the-go use.**Cons:**1. **Limited RAM:** The laptop's 4GB RAM may be a limiting factor for those who require more memory for demanding tasks. Upgrading the RAM would have been a welcome option, but unfortunately, it's not possible.2. **Non-Upgradable GPU:** Another drawback is the inability to upgrade the GPU. While it handles basic graphics tasks well, it might not meet the needs of users with more demanding graphical requirements.In conclusion, the Acer Aspire 5 Slim offers excellent value for its price. It's a reliable option for everyday use, but if you have more intensive computing needs, the limitations in RAM and GPU should be taken into consideration. Despite these drawbacks, I'm overall satisfied with my purchase and would recommend it to others looking for a budget-friendly laptop.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
review_text: If your looking for a lightwieght decent computer at a 300 price point this is it. Did my homework before purchasing both on amazon and tech sites. This model is advertised as having a backlit keyboard ...it does not which iKnew going in. Keyboard is easy to use. The display is decent have my charter spectrum app for tv and i do light gaming casino games ect.which it handles very well. If your a heavy gamer would recommend a gaming computer instead. The processor is lightining fast which is a plus everything loads very quickly. When using the ac charger make sure you push it all way in the port. You also have the ability for usb c charging if you choose that method. A usb c is not included however if your like most you probably have one in a drawer like we have. The battery life is okay depending on what your doing however almost all laptops tout longer battery life yet fall short.Set up mine using the 11s mode and tranferred my files and passwords over which was a breeze. Got rid of the bloatware and set up my privacy for no ad sharing ect. Set up was quick and easy. You can also opt out of windows 11s mode which is easy to do. Conclusion if your looking for a budget laptop without breaking the bank this is a pretty decent reliable name brand choice.

review_title: Basic use, 4 GB ram is not enough, makes a good Linux VPN share laptop.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2023
review_text: I bought two of these laptops in the summer of 2020 for $299 and $310. The first thing I did was pull the stock memory and storage. I added 16 GB ram and put in 1 tb drives. I installed  Xubuntu Linux, later installed Debian Linux “bookworm” Release. with no driver issues. I added a USB 1 GB Ethernet adapter/hub combo to the 1 USB 3.1 port. This Laptop has a good screen and I like its lighted keyboard. Its Ryzen 3 3200U processor isn't fast, but its fast enough for my needs. I only use this laptop as a VPN internet share laptop for my work at home 2nd local area network. I could use an VPN router for this, but would get much slower internet speeds.  Using the laptop as an VPN share device I always get good internet speeds.  The second laptop I have as a backup, if the Linux OS gets a bad update and fails. It has happened 3 or 4 times where I had to use the backup laptop.  Minimal downtime that way. Always good to have a backup.The only thing I don't like about the laptop is that every so often I will get a blinking battery warning light. When that happens I unplug the ac power to the laptop and let the battery run down to 15%, then plug in the ac power to the laptop and good to go. No more warning light. I pull the bottom cover off once a year to clean the laptop and make sure the battery isn't showing signs of swelling. So far so good.  If that happened I would probably just pull the battery and run the laptop without a battery.  These laptops have been a good value for what I use them for. The laptop performs well running Linux, I would not be running windows on the laptop. I think its processor might be to slow for that. In its stock configuration 4 GB of ram would be a bad day for windows.

review_title: A great value laptop with some tradeoffs, but well worth the price.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2020
review_text: Not going to go into the specs on this, but I'm going to say that I REALLY like this computer!Pros:1.  Full size keyboard with a number pad (I need this since I do a lot of work with Excel).2.  Backlit keyboard (I sometimes work in poorly lit areas and this works wonders).3.  Bluetooth (great for routing sound through my soundbar should I decide to do that in the future).4.  Not a touchscreen!  While some prefer them, I am going from a touchscreen laptop to a non-touchscreen laptop.  (I found it annoying that stray hairs or other things would cling to the screen and then I couldn't clean the screen off without opening 15 different things on my old one.  So, I was happy to find a laptop that didn't have that feature, which I do not miss at all.)5.  Long battery life (6+ hours--this is going to be great for car trips when the travel restrictions end).6.  Processor and memory are able to make instantaneous calculations on a 25 MB Excel sheet (which is unusually large).7.  Very lightweight (this is going to be fun when I go through airports again as I'm the Dad carrying two car seats along with the backpack of tech).8.  Not made in China!  If you're trying to boycott Chinese goods like I am because of Xi Jinping's lackluster response to COVID-19, rest assured that Acer is based out of Taiwan.Cons:1.  Windows 10 S-mode restricts you from third party programs like Google Chrome or Mozilla Firefox.  If you want them, you have to permanently take your computer out of S-mode.2.  The processor fan is a bit louder than most others.  This sort of thing doesn't bother me, but it does bother my wife, who also has an Acer Aspire 5.3.  The processor fan also has a tendency to run while the laptop is closed.  I'm not sure why it needs to run while it's supposed to be idle, but oh well.  This is another thing that doesn't bother me, but it seems a bit odd.4.  The battery is not a removable module like other laptops' batteries.  If this is going to be a very long term solution like my last laptop (bought in 2013), I know I'm going to need to find a way to put in a new battery safely and without damaging the unit.5.  The speakers are a bit weak.  I discovered this one day when I lost my phone and needed to use it for distance learning school videos for my third grader.  I had it on full blast in a quiet room and it was difficult to understand at times.  (It was inspiration enough for me to get a nearby friend to call my phone so I could find it was kicked underneath the couch.)  If good quality speakers are important to you, this unit isn't for you.  For me, it doesn't matter because I can live without the Windows 10 sound effects and I don't use it for entertainment.

review_text: I got this Chromebook because it was under $200 and there was a $20 off coupon for it so I splurged and bought it immediately. review_title: A great buy, boots up fast
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2023
review_text: This chromebook is a value all it's own. It boots up fast, with no issues. It works for everyday computing. The graphics are crisp and sharp, not hard on the eyes. The screen is 14 inches and is easy to read. The Chrome app is awesome, it works flawlessly and is easy to navigate. I was surprised that I was able to restore all of my bookmarks from a computer that died recently. That was a plus that I didn't expect, thought I would have to redo them from scratch. It is a lightweight laptop, easy to carry around. It doesn't have a cd-rom drive, but you really don't need it since it streams shows and videos. The battery lasts all day, it doesn't lose power in a matter of hours, like other computers batteries. I  charged it, then unplugged it overnight, and it still had 18 hours of charge left this morning. This laptop is a choice that I am happy with, I recommend it to those who like Google Chrome OS.

review_title: For the money you can't beat it.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2024
review_text: I've had this for a week now, and I'm going to try to do my best to give a thorough review.Pros:- It came in great, impeccable condition, really, with the right charger and everything.- Awesome battery life- Comfortable keyboard- Easy to navigate (I used to have a decent windows HP but it got destroyed due to a water accident, so I wanted something cheap that works, primarily for creative writing. I have limited experience with Chromebooks, but this has been super easy to learn)- Even though this Chrombook comes on it's last update (see Cons), there are still plenty of helpful add-ons to be downloaded from the Play Store. For example, the voice recorder I downloaded (and internal mic of the chromebook) produces better sound quality than my moderately expensive HP- I like the sleek, all black design- It doesn't run hot or loudCons:- Wifi detection can be pretty weak, so make sure you have access to a strong wifi connection- Headphone jack seems to be a little worn out, so sometimes depending on how I move the chord, the sound quality in my headphones changes (this is probably a problem that is exclusive to my chromebook)- It is a tad slower overall than middle to high end laptops, but not unbearable- Since Chrome is on it's last update, you can't download crucial extensions like Adblock.Overall, for 62 dollars or something after taxes, this is an amazing laptop. Frankly, I love it, and all the cons are not deal breakers at all. I guess it also comes down to the quality of the individual Chromebook that is shipped to you, as I suspect some are in better condition than others, but if Amazon's inspection process has improved, then I would think that the odds of getting a dud are less and less.Bottom line: If you want a laptop that's good and cheap, this is perfect for browsing, watching videos, writing. It's a tad slower than your higher end laptops, but oh well. It's fantastic, really.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2023
review_text: I was in my last semester of college and my Apple MacBook that I had for YEARS finally broke, and Apple told me they were unable to fix it.I needed something just to last me my last semester (at least 4 months) that was inexpensive, but would be adequate enough to do all of my homework and college assignments on. If you’re looking for an inexpensive computer to do basic work on for a short amount of time, this is a wonderful option.The only negatives were 1. The computer was quite small 2. I ran into many problems connecting it to the internet. It allowed me to connect to my home internet and school internet, but wouldn’t let me connect to internet at Starbucks or at my boyfriends college when I went away. I tried to see if maybe there was a limit on the number of connections you could have, but that wasn’t the problem. It just was picky with the places it wanted to connect to. 3. The computer ran slow. It wasn’t so bad to the point where it was challenging to do work, but just enough that I was annoyed every now and then.Other than those few negatives, this computer was adequate for everything I needed in my last semester and I highly recommend if you are in a similar situation.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2024
review_text: I needed a cheap laptop quickly for a few projects I'm working on and this one has exceeded my expectations. For the price I wasn't expecting it to look and behave like a new one. It is the perfect size to work on without being too wide or bulky. It fits in what my mom calls my "movie going purse" (if you know , you know 😁). I ordered it late in the day, so I expected it to ship the next day but to my utter joy I received a message a couple hours later saying it shipped and would arrive by 10pm the next day. I was pretty excited that I would get it a full day before I expected. Once again though, my expectations were exceeded in the most wonderful way when I woke up to the notification that my package had been delivered. There was obvious care taken in the packaging to ensure that nothing could harm this refurbished beauty. I have to give props to the delivery peoples as well because the box it shipped in was even in pristine condition which tells me that from start to finish everyone involved in the handling of my purchase treated it like I imagine they would would their own. Anytime I need anything else I know who to look for!

review_text: This refurbished Dell Chromebook was purchased to replace a small Chromebook that just wore out after 11 years.  I'd purchased a new Acer Chromebook which is fine but big... It appears that all functions work as they should to include the external drive ports.  The only thing that seems off is the sound which is very soft and hard to hear at the maximum setting.  I will be looking into this to see if I can increase it.  I would recommend a purchase from this vendor without hesitation.  One caution... the machine was not power washed so previous owner name and email address appeared at start up.  Easily erased to reset machine back to factory settings and all user info and local files removed.  Once reset reconnecting to make it 'my own' took just a couple of minutes.  At this price I am very pleased indeed.

review_text: I bought this for our daughter for Christmas. I thought I found an amazing deal that's where I thought wrong. It came super fast and it was a good price thats why it get 2 star. Finger prints and dust all over including the screen also had permanent marker numbers on the back the school left behind. I took 3 wipes to it to clean it. Our daughter opened it plugged it in to charge it worked fine she unplugged it and it automatically died. The previous owner of the chromebook had left it plugged in for to long and fried the battery. No external battery so I couldn't order a new one.It's sad that the post claims to be refurbished when it seems to be bought in bulk from school auctions cobled together and shipped out without inspecting the workings of the product. review_title: Using this for DJing and portable EDM production
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2024
review_text: I use Serato with a dedicated Pioneer controller and Ableton for producing as well as a copy of FL Studio because it's still useful and it does everything I've needed it to do. There were a couple delayed track loads but nothing so bad that it ruined the mix. The setup was easy peasy and easy enough to get by the Microsoft account required nonsense.The graphics seem good altho the colors get pretty washed out when on the higher brightness settings. That said, I'm not a gamer so I can't confidently comment on the graphics card's power.The quality of the device is about par for the course for it's price range. I wouldn't be throwing it out of any helicopters but if it just sits on a desk or a stand and transported in a computer bag it'll be ok.The computer is larger than I thought it would be which is usually a good thing and is such in my situation. I've noticed 0 heat issues so far, even around the USB-C port. I've put a few hours of bare legs as a computer stand when producing use without any uncomfortable heat or sweating.It's worth the money for my needs and I would recommend it for any DJ use as well as light to moderate music production use but for the best performance it'd be best to stick to 1 CPU sucking software per machine.

The only indication it was on, was the fan was running EXTREMELY hard. I gave it some time, and eventually decided to hard boot it. I left it off for an hour or so, went to turn it back on, and it was just a black screen, fan ramping up, and no response to the mouse, keyboard, etc. An hour later, and it's still unresponsive and running the fan super hard. I am awaiting a response from the seller, but am guessing I'm screwed until a replacement comes. Poor show HP, you let me down big time on this one.

review_text: I purchased this laptop with the 64GB hard drive for everyday web browsing, small Microsoft Office projects,  and light streaming such as Netflix and Paramount as I haven’t had a PC in more than a few years and have been using my iPhone for everything and it’s nice to have a full keyboard to type and rest your wrists on.Straight out of the box this laptop was extremely slow which I expected taking the price into consideration — I was able to get everything set up in a reasonable amount of time and once I was finished with the initial set up I removed any unnecessary apps on it with one of the preinstalled apps I uninstalled being McFee Security which helped tremendously. (I feel with most budget computers you can run Windows Defender at  minimum and get away with that without having the constant scans of third party security systems that slows the PC down in general.)The computer was shipped in the original box and arrived on time and in excellent/like new condition. It did need to be charged before I was able to begin the setup process. The keyboard feels nice. Display/Screen is nice. Multiple USB ports, external card slots.All in all, I am satisfied with my purchase and it meets my needs for the moment and if I decide it no longer does I am able to send it back for a refund.Great buy for the light laptop user!

review_title: Easier To Utilize for Multiple Functions Than I Thought However
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
review_text: I admit that my loving husband purchased this Lenovo IdealPad 1 14 Laptop computer to show his support towards my long term navy career ambitions. Some of the professional requirements that relate to my navy reserve goals  require a computer equipped with a working cac card reader that will enable me to access certain online navy related sites for professional courses and other military related online training requirements. The good news: I was able to at least test drive going to at least the front page of  certain navy related sites easier than I thought it would be. Additionally, I was able to get into establishing a new hotmail account, signing into one of my gmail accounts and easily signing into the amazon account (that is connected to the review I am writing this on). The caveats: patience is necessary with this type of computer because I had noticed already logging on to some of the websites required some time.  Additionally, both my husband and I realized that I am obviously going to have to both eventually browse around and inquire both online and offline for help towards permanently installing the software necessary to access a multiple number of the required online navy sites with the cac card reader I already bought (for training and other requirements mandatory  for my navy reserve career). Aside from those caveats, I truly feel lucky that my sweet husband surprised me with this laptop gift and I obviously intend to utilize this computer for multiple months to come.

review_text: So a while back I bought this computer for my little sister for school and gaming and a few days ago she handed it back to me. I was confused at first of why, well here is why. Whenever she would try to use the computer microphone in games, it won’t pick her voice up at all. When it was time to play games online or even games she downloaded from the store, they become very choppy and hard to even control, the amount of time she has to sit through a loading screen would take up to 12 minutes, just for it to crash. Next is videos, the quality of the camera is….bad. Very bad. And not to mention when she is trying to watch movies or videos on the computer, they became very very lagged out. Now this girl only has 2 games installed, amazing Wi-Fi connection and still has a lot of memory left. But this computer just can’t get the job done for nothing when it comes to entertainment, schooling or even work. She said that most of this was already happening when she first turned it on and the buffering is insufferable. I wish I wouldn’t had waited until her birthday to even gift this to her but I had trusted the reviews. Wrong move to do I guess. Now I’m stuck with the computer and I might just have to sell it since I missed the return deadline. Kind of upset about the purchase.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
review_text: I stumbled across this laptop while searching amazon. First, I was surprised at the price. I read the details and because there was a good return policy I decided to buy it. Second, when it arrived I thought it was brand new. Not a scratch or blemish on it. Third, I had a HP Z1 desktop at work with a solid state boot drive and I had forgotten how quickly this drive boots up. Very fast. Fourth, I work mainly in the Microsoft universe and I logged in and Windows 11 installed everything from my desktop to my laptop (I did have to download the apps to my laptop, but they appeared showing what I already had.). Updates were also fast and painless. Fifth, the build of the laptop is very solid and the display is beautiful. It is also very light and slim. Keyboard and trackpad also have a very good feel.The SSD is only 256GB and it doesn't come with a DVD drive. No big deal. Thanks to HP for not having a ton of bloatware. I would recommend this laptop to anyone looking for a budget laptop that performs well and get the job done.

review_title: Laptop itself is nice enough, Windows isn’t
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
review_text: This thing looks decent enough but it runs ridiculously slow. I had to remove McAfee for it to even run/load anything, and even now it’s really slow. It takes forever to get a tab to load. I can be sitting right next to my router and it will say I have one signal bar, sometimes randomly cutting to no signal. I think I need to go through my files piece by piece to try to decide why it’s so freaking slow, bc it’s not an old computer. I tried playing a game on it and the frame rate was abysmal and stuttery on a game that wasn’t using very many resources. (Pathetic for a laptop that has a self-proclaimed gaming mode.) I’m disappointed because I wanted to use this to write stories, manage my business, and play a few games, but I can barely build my website even sitting right next to my internet. I’ve tried turning off the WiFi of every device in the house and it still doesn’t catch the signal very well. I can’t use it in my room at all, even though my iPad has full bars in my room.When it does eventually get full signal, it works smoothly. I really wish that it came with more built in storage because the amount of it taken up by Windows files cuts it down to a quarter of its advertised storage. If you want something to play games on, I would take the time to invest in an *actual* gaming computer. Yeah, it will put you out a lot of money, but considering how much grief I’ve gone through to even get this thing set up, you’ll thank yourself in the long run if you just invest in a better machine. It doesn’t come with Microsoft Office or any word processor other than the notepad, so I had to download a different one. Basically everything that used to be nice about Windows computers has been locked behind a paywall. I’ve been using this for months and I can honestly say that I miss my old MacBook Pro, and if it wasn’t eight years old, I’d just go back to that.TL;DR—machine itself is nice, the mouse buttons are pleasant and the keys feel good. Windows OS is a bear to work with and I barely get a signal from my router 60% of the time. It’s bogged down by Windows files making it slow, and you have to uninstall the new safety mode to even do anything. If you were to uninstall Windows and use a different OS, it would be a very pleasant machine to work with in terms of ergonomics and functional feel. The graphics are pretty when they load, but I had to crank them all the way down to even get it to move (even then, having it be a crawl).Overall, I would only recommend this computer to someone that is a Windows acolyte. Or maybe someone that uses Linux for everything anyway. I miss my old laptop and wish I could get another one of those instead. :/

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2024
review_text: This was on sale when I bought it on the 18th of May. About $200 or so below it's current listing. There was also another coupon.  40 GB of RAM plus 2TB of storage space AND Ryzen 5 GPU?! YES PLEASE! I cannot believe how light weight this laptop is. It's super sleek and stylish.  Keyboard is super comfortable and intuitive directionally for your fingers. This is my first time using Windows 11 since I use Windows 10 on my tower rig for Steam gaming and video streaming. The person complaining about the color is wrong. if you dont like the color, easily go into display settings and change the blue light filter to on for warmer tones. that simple. i love warmer tones so this is the first spot i head to when i crack open a new pc. about to download Speccy and a few other must have tools and then run it at full blast gaming. shipping was obviously super fast since it is the 22nd of May and I received it yesterday. love the high def. you will not be disappointed with this laptop.

review_title: you get what you pay for
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2024
review_text: fast, but limited by browser javascript overloading the ram cache. this is unavoidable b/c as a software developer, the idiots that make web pages these days overload them with so much garbage they dont run properly. this has nothing to do with the quality of this laptop.now that i'm done venting, let's get to why this machine is great.1. boot time is blazingly fast (<8s to windows screen)2. nice and roomy storage (got 1tb) which is one of the main factors of me buying over mac. (VERY tough choice - but i have an old macbook air for now)3. i needed this machine for development, and like the nice tie in to windows onedrive, really gives me an easy way to manage my file repository.4. keyboard is good but i like beveled keys better (no backlight)5. overall great machine for the money, if you want all the bells and whistles you will be spending > 7-800 clams.  my reccomendation is that if you don't care about touchscreeen, get a macbook air 2024 for $850.6. nice screen size, i don't care about the image quality b/c i'm coding on this thing. its a great price b/c if it breaks, is stolen, etc, i can buy a new one. i would cry sweet tears if the macbook broke.note: this is NOT a gaming machine. if you want to game, get a console, its the best way to go. if you are a pc gamer you need to spend north of 1k to get anything decent.overall, one of the best in its class for barebones with good power. if you want bells and whistles, fingerprint reader, backlit keyboard, touchscreen, etc, you'll have to spend more. i went for raw power and storage, with good screensize. it was a very tough choice over mac but i came up as a developer with windows and i'm going back. i like the mac shell but powershell cuts the mustard now.for $500 with windows pro, this is a great developer machine. very happy with it so far.giving it a 4/5.no comment on battery life yet... probably ok.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2024
review_text: This laptop is nothing special.  But for what it is, It does exactly what I need.  It's not delicate; it can be repeatedly moved to and used in various classrooms. plugging and unplugging components.  It's a reliable workhorse.  No baby-ing needed.  (I'll save the video editing for my XPS - which is waay too finicky (and pricy) to be hauled around).  Be forewarned, though.  The Levono V15 product description is misleading.  The only USB C port is also the only power source.  So, if you're planning on dedicating the USB C to higher-speed processes, think again.  While this laptop's battery life is impressive (so far) for a Windows OS, you will have to charge it at some point, and the C port will not be available for other uses.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2023
review_text: I bought the 16gb RAM, 1 TB storage model. Mine came with a barrel plug charger, some of the reviews I'm reading are for ones that came with Type-C charging.First with the pros. It's pretty much exactly what I needed in a laptop. It's light. It is well built, it feels very well made and solid. It's quiet and doesn't get too hot. The processor is pretty decent, that's why I bought this particular laptop actually. It's very responsive and not laggy at all.Now the cons. This thing earns its price tag. It has some decent internals but man did they ever cheap out in other areas. The web cam is pure junk, the one I bought on Amazon for $12 like five years ago looks better than the web cam on this laptop. The speakers are terrible, tiny trash. Luckily this thing has a headphone jack. The biggest con about this laptop though is the display. It's a freakin' TN panel! The colors are very washed out and the viewing angles are poor. When I'm typing on this computer at my desk, I find myself hunching over and getting very close to the screen because it's hard to make out. I can never seem to adjust it right, I need to really get in there to see it. Looking at the screen for too long will give me a headache. Luckily, this laptop has an HDMI port on the side, so I would recommend that anyone who buys this should invest in a monitor and a laptop dock for their home use. The display is just good enough for me to use when I'm out and about or sitting in class.I guess that some versions of this laptop have IPS panels. Unfortunately, Amazon doesn't bother telling you that information. Therefore my second recommendation is to just buy this off of Lenovo's website or some other website that provides that information, not Amazon.

review_title: Initial reaction: Not impress and considering returning tbh
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2023
review_text: Looks nice. Feels nice. Keyboards nice. Only 2 usb ports, not a problem but feels like a downgrade in my experience. For some reason, the charger provider is a usb-c, I don't know why they didn't offer a typical AC charger but I'm no expert either so maybe there's a reason. The WORSE PART of this is that when I started this up, the screen is BADLY WASHED OUT. I'm trying to figure out a way to get rid of this weird affect it has on the screen. Maybe the drivers aren't fully updated, maybe I need to tinker around the display settings, I have no idea yet. My Acer laptop is much cheaper yet has a screen that looks way better from the very beginning.Update: I'm starting to think the problem is the screen itself, the colors are changing if I change the display settings but the white foggy cast on the screen is making the colors look really gray. The pixels are also easily visible if you change the angle of the laptop screen so if you look at it from a certain angle you can't see any of the colors at all. Overall, this appears to be a solid laptop for work and games, but the display is surprisingly horrible. If you're an artist, 100% don't waste your time pondering about this product.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2023
review_text: First things first. If the screen is of utmost importance to you, do not buy this machine. The 1080p is crisp enough but the color is not accurate out of the box. I'm not going to bother calibrating but the viewing angles are not great either so there's a good chance you'll have difficulty with content creation. It's best at full brightness, which also annihilates battery life.I'm not a gamer either to know whether the machine is fast enough for those tasks.What I can say is for a budget laptop with that's quick with lots of ram and storage, this is a good business machine. Unfortunately one way they kept the price down is having no keyboard backlight and minimal ports. You can get all that from the description and photos.I have a higher end laptop for production. It has an OLED 4k screen and it's even faster but I also paid more than 2x the price for it. I bought this one for one specific software related to diagnostics and repair on heavy duty trucks and it's more than enough for that.I actually find it more pleasant to use generally since it's a bit lighter. The chiclet keyboard is also pretty good.

review_title: Fast pc that feels like a Chromebook but with the functionality of Windows 11
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2023
review_text: I bought this laptop for writing and taking online classes primarily, and it's just perfect.  Keyboard is nice to use.  Screen is bright and crisp.  Laptop is lightweight.This is NOT a laptop for gaming, video editing, demanding graphics work, and you're probably going to get frustrated if you are a busy, multi-tasker with multiple software and dozens of browser tabs open at the same time.That being said, for basic computing needs (word processing, watching Netflix, web browsing, blogging, writing a novel, taking classes, etc...), this laptop is near perfect and budget-friendly.Couple Notes: - The processor is 1.1 ghz, not 2.8 as listed in description, but really, you wouldn't be doing anything on this that should ever require that much processor speed. - Memory is upgradeable, which is nice, but I've found that 4gb is fine for what I'm using it for right now. - Laptop looks stylish, but lacks that "high-end" feel - but it's a $200 laptop.  Still, I like it and keyboard feels good for typing at length. - Screen is sharp.  Colors are decent.  Not the best screen out there, of course, but certainly not bad at all.  Not a touch screen...slight bummer but not a big deal to me. - Sound coming from speakers is nice and loud.  No, not premium sound, but sufficient to watch movies/video classes and hear it just fine.  I'm happy with it, but no audiophile.  Use headphones or a Bluetooth speaker if you want better sound. - Performance has been fast and I've been satisfied. - Easy to switch from Windows S to full Windows Home, which is my preference and why I opted for this over a Chromebook. - 81gb of available storage space after OS and apps take up a bit of the 128 gb drive.  To me, that's totally fine since I'm not saving anything on this - it all goes in the cloud. - I don't think the battery will actually last 9 hours with normal settings, but I get a solid 5 or so hours out of it between charges.RE: Slowness/Lagginess:A couple negative reviews mentioned this and when it happened to me, I thought that maybe there WAS something off about this computer.Turns out when I logged into my Microsoft account, it started syncing my existing desktop computer with this laptop, and with only 4gb of memory and slower processor, it just bogged it right down for about 20 minutes or so as it synced apps, desktop icons, etc....  Once everything synced up, it was fine and has been ever since.So if you experience slow, laggy performance when you first get this, and you've logged into your Microsoft account, set it down and let it sync for 20 minutes or so, or better yet, adjust the sync settings to be more selective.All in all, it's a great, inexpensive laptop that is super lightweight, super portable, looks nice, performs great, and is perfect for basic computing, an older child/teen, college courses, etc...

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2024
review_text: I have tablets and a Big Screen desl Windows Computer and two small computers.  One small computer is tied into my piano for online piano lesson. The other a nice but small chrome computer than I never use. I dislike chrome.I missed my 15 inch computer that bit the dust years ago and I suddenly decided to get the cheapest brand name computer.  At 200 dollars and a bit of change I found the Acer computer.  Being a computer nerd I saw that it had what I needed and should be fast enough.It is hard reading reviews today half will say it is perfect and the other half will say it is junk.I am bet this Acer computer by looking at the specs it will be perfect for my needs. Its a well known brand large computer at a very small price.Getting started was a easy, the diplay was bright and nice to read and the setup was easy and fast.It ask a bunch of questions and I said no to most of them. The sound is terrible but with a bluetooth speakers or headphones it is perfect.If you are reviewing this computer giving a review as if you were receiveing a 500 dollar computer really dose not help anyone.  This is a great computer for its price range and it seems to have what I need.Keeping Windows in the S mode is a no brainer for this laptop.  You will have to suffer minor convenices of using a Microsoft Browsers and using only the software from the Microsoft Store.  Not a big deal.  If you need to run other software, break down and buy a bigger computer.However with the types of bad stuff out there this is a safer method and you do not the bloated stuff that takes away huge amounts of memory with installing Windows.  Remember you can not go back to mode s easily if you change your mind.The bottom line this is a deal at 200 dollars

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2024
review_text: Great inexpensive laptop.  8 E-cores seems to multitask fine.  I was able to install and run some Virtual Machines with no issue or slowdown.  The laptop is capable of playing some older Steam games. I only tested Half-Life so far and it runs smooth.  The specs are great for the price.The only minor issue I had was setting up Windows 11 only to install Ubuntu 24.04 over it.  The hotkey for choosing a boot device is disabled in the BIOS by default.

review_title: Two things I don't like about this laptop
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2024
review_text: My laptop crashed and in a panic I bought this one. It's fine for a backup, you can't beat the price for a backup. But when my original fixed laptop comes back, I'll be reverting to it. I'll keep this as a backup. What I don't like - it's very slow. I only use it for internet research and writing papers for my MA program. All my files are in the cloud. It takes several seconds for it to respond to a command, such as opening a new application or a new document or a new tab. And it's not my internet. I do stream Netflix and it's fine. Occasionally I see a little lag or an indication it's not quite keeping up, but it works. It's when I perform an action that it takes so long to respond. And the second thing is - I can't wake it up!!! If I close the laptop at night, in the morning it takes at least two minutes to wake it up. I press enter, mouse click, Ctrl, nothing works. I start to panic thinking it's crashed, but then finally it starts telling me I have to put in my PIN. So to avoid this issue, if I'm going to leave it for more than an hour, I close everything and completely power down. I've posted the question about whether I can add more memory but I've only gotten unhelpful sarcastic answers (people need to get a life), and the information I've found online and in and other reviews here is conflicting.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2023
review_text: I love this computer!  Here's why...  I wanted a portable computer that I could use for getting information from the web and for typing documents.  I saw this computer and figured that for the price I couldn't go wrong.  I was more right than I imagined.First thing was to get rid of that Windowa S.  Installed Linux Mint 21.2 and my favorite (and ONLY) office suite Softmaker Office 2024.  For typing/editing documents this system is incredible.  It is as light as a Chromebook, runs forever (8+ hours) on a full charge, has a very sharp display (I have bad vision so this was important), decent sound (great with bluetooth headset :)) and a good enough keyboard that I can type at a reasonable speed.  With Microsoft Edge (yeah, I love the Edge browser) and the Brave browser I have no problem finding the information I need.  All-in-all this computer is ideal for what I needed to do.  I have already shown it to a couple of people with the same needs as me.  One of the best purchases I have made in a long time!!!One thing that I did do was get a tiny 64 GB USB drive and make it my primary working storage.  That way I wear out a throwaway device instead of my eMMC which probably isn't replaceable.Finally, small reality check.  This IS NOT a computer for playing games.  Not even simple ones.  Hearts or solitaire or Minesweeper should be okay, but graphics games are just going to be a non-starter.  I got mine for research and writing and for that it is perfect.  But, its just not a gaming machine.And, considering how inexpensive it is, for me it just doesn't get any better.BTW, I own several other computers (mostly Acer) with Linux, Windows and ChromeOS.  I am writing this review ON the computer I am reviewing.  This is the computer I use most of the time, and the one that goes with me.

review_title: If you want to get out of S mode….
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2024
review_text: The laptop itself is great. It’s lightweight, decent battery, fast enough for daily normal useBUT…It comes with Windows 11 in S mode. Microsoft made the questionable decision to restrict what apps you may download to only ones supported in their App Store (ex. Google chrome is blocked so they all but force you to use THEIR browser). There is a way to bypass this but it is ridiculously hard. I spent two days following Microsoft’s instructions (which never worked) as well as any hints I could find online. What finally worked was doing a reset of the computer. After the reset I went directly to the settings and I was FINALLY able to disable S mode. If that hadn’t worked I was going to do a factory reset and send this laptop back. This will be the last Windows computer I will purchase. When I buy a computer I SHOULD be able to easily download any apps I want. If I had known the Windows in S mode is so hard to disable I would have never purchased this laptop.Again the laptop itself is fine. You will need a lot of patience to get to the point where you can set it up the way YOU want it versus what Microsoft pushes on you.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2024
review_text: This is actually a good deal. The processor is snappy enough and the SSD is upgradeable. I have three gripes: the RAM is not upgradable and the fans tend to be a bit noisy. Finally, Windows 11S requires internet and a Microsoft Account to set it up. The various tricks that allow you to bypass the MA account do not work with S Mode.

review_title: Cheapest Windows Laptop with USB-C DisplayPort
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2024
review_text: If it were up to me, I'd never use a Windows machine. But it's not up to me—a job I took requires a particular version of VMWare Horizon Client and doesn't support web VMWare, so I held my nose and placed the order.Long story short, through no fault of Acer's, this machine in 2024 requires a factory reset after its initial setup just to turn off S Mode so you can install 3rd party software. Once you've jumped through Redmond's hoops (Bring us a shrubbery! Ni!), This little machine functions reasonably well under the weight of too many stupid useless pre-installed apps and all the stock MS nagware, un-refusable Xbox Live offers, and info-widgets nobody wants or needs.If you absolutely must have a Windows laptop (to keep a job) and you have the patience to spend 7 hours setting it up, then this machine might do.But for God's sake, if you don't absolutely have to use some platform-limited software, do yourself a huge favor and get a high-spec Chromebook. Windows, in its modern form, is hot garbage compared to Chrome OS or any lightweight mainstream Linux distribution.

review_title: Great for the price, but not perfect.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2023
review_text: this laptop is pretty nice for a low-end laptop in 2023. nice 1080p IPS display, long lasting battery, NVME ssd standard, DDR5 ram, etc. i thought it was a perfect replacement for my laptop, but it wasn’t (although good enough for my needs) i figured this laptop would be like other newer acer laptops in which it had some soldered ram and a empty ram stick slot. i purchased some extra ram to go with the laptop so i could play some games on it without worrying about going over the allotted memory. however, it only has soldered ram. the game i mainly play on it—plays fine on 8GB (FNAF security breach), but only when you have dedicated VRAM. after about a couple days of using this laptop the game crashed 4 different times compared to when it never did on my old laptop due to upgradable ram. the laptop works well for everything else and actually lasts throughout the day easily unlike my old laptop and even has a bunch of awesome features, but unfortunately that one drawback is a pretty big problem. i hope in the future their lower end laptops will have upgradable ram as thats the only thing keeping me from giving this 5 stars.

review_title: Slim and Efficient: Acer Aspire 1 A115-32-C96U Laptop
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
review_text: The Acer Aspire 1 A115-32-C96U laptop is a fantastic choice for those seeking a sleek and efficient computing experience. The 15.6" Full HD display provides crisp visuals for work, entertainment, and everything in between. Powered by an Intel Celeron N4500 processor, it handles everyday tasks with ease, whether it's browsing the web, streaming videos, or multitasking with multiple applications. The slim design makes it easy to carry around, while the reliable performance ensures productivity on the go. review_title: Acer Aspire - a nightmare: Windows 11 OS
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2024
review_text: I found this laptop useless for my needs. The machine worked properly, (reason I gave it 2 stars instead of 1) though I cannot comment on more than that. The Windows 11 operating system is restrictive and badly bundled, with the desktop littered with cheap media features, celebrity news, sports, in a way that hurts the brain. And you cannot make it stop. Nor can you change the default browser from what magnificent Microsoft has provided for you. Also, you cannot use any apps that are not approved by Microsoft. The hard sell to get you to buy into Office 365 is all they seem to care about, not that your computer experience is something that suits your needs. Do not buy this thing if you need it for business, because it does not reflect a business-like design. I think someone at Microsoft has got to be insane to think this is the way forward for personal computers.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2024
review_text: My more expensive laptop that was not even a year old had to be sent in for repairs and I needed to get something quick to use for work while the repairs were being made and this laptop ticked all the boxes for an incredible price. For work I often have many windows open at a time and this thing has no problem handling that. My main use is editing and graphic design and it runs my work programs perfectly even with multiple programs open. Only issue I have is that the fingerprint scanner does not work great. I have reset it but that does not help so I mostly just use the pin instead, but I would love to know if there is a way to fix it. One other thing to mention is the power supply has an unusually short cord. I ended up buying a replacement for it that was only about $20 on Amazon. Despite those two minor things I still think it is well worth it. This laptop is an excellent value for the money!

review_title: FUNYET gave no Windows product key
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
review_text: Ladies and gents, saddle up because today has been an emotional ride. I bought this laptop with the intent to use it for work. I need to be able to access 9 websites, check my email, and run numbers. Pretty simple stuff that I’m after. It arrived today. Unoboxing was painfully simple. The user manual is all but useless, in my humble opinion. There were multiple updates to be had.. which is to be expected as I can only assume the computer is actually a couple of years old despite this being its first use outside of the quality control diagnostics. Y’all. I was on Amazon chat for an hour and a half, 6 different agents, and no assistance in my issue. This is advertised as included with Windows 11 Pro. I had to call Microsoft and be walked through how to locate the key associated with the device only to discover my product key had already be used on a DIFFERENT DEVICE and was no longer available for my use, despite my paying for it. My new laptop wanted me to pay for a $200+ licensed product key despite it being sold to me with 11 Pro included. I got lucky and the rep with Microsoft support was able to get my Windows activated.Please read and learn from my misfortune.Aside from that huge hiccup upon receiving and set up, I’m now logged into all of my accounts and am very excited to have a computer that I’ve never written a high school essay on. Note there is no Ethernet access, no CD/DVD ROM, nor does it have a full sized HDMI port. These aren’t deal breakers for me simply because this computer was bought for work purposes opposed to personal.I’m very impressed by how light it is, the backlit keyboard, the fingerprint sensor, number pad, and the screen quality. For the price, this full sized laptop didn’t skimp on user friendly design features.Computer itself: 9/10Setup: 0/10Amazon Support: everyone but Mustafa(10), 0/10Microsoft Support: 11/10*Updated Review*Since receiving contact from the company in question, I’d like to state I’m please with their customer service and support. They reached out and were willing to right their wrongs. Upon reflection, I have updated my review as my laptop functions above expectation and allows me to do everything I require for my work and it was also reasonably priced considering its features.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
review_text: I bought this FunYet 16" pro computer to replace my old Dell 15" ..... The computer coms packed quite well and is very sturdy material. It arrives within four days from Kirkland, Washington. The screen is very bright and has good definition and contrast. The keyboard is the standard, and the keys are clean and responsive. Here are the negatives: (1) The battery does NOT last as advertised; the battery barely lasts 3 hours, and when turned off at night, loses 50% of its power when opened up the next morning. (2) there are no HDMI ports (3) There is no SD card slot (4) The power port is too close to a USB port and hard to use due to its proximity. One will need to purchase additional devices to accommodate these slots, or even an extender to support multiple attachments. ..... I emailed customer support as to the battery issue, and their answer was, "My computer does the same thing". Since this unit is only 10 days from purchase, I will update in a month or two ... PS. I purchased an extended 4-year warranty to cover my Funyet, as they have NO representation in the USA. UPDATE:  I have now had a lot more time on this Funjet computer, and the cooperation from Customer Service is quite lacking. The battery will not stay full at all and drains down to 64% overnight with the unit turned off. The computer skips when you are trying to load an address or even insert a URL address. I am very concerned about service if this Funyet computer need work. We need to have customer support in the USA; not in China. I will be returning this unit to AMazon for a full refund.

review_title: Pretty good, but not for gaming

review_text: Yo, I'm an fps player (usually overwatch, cod, apex, etc.) and I gotta say, this laptop is not the one if your on a budget. I can't even play the  game I'm playing without the laptop immediately stuttering. And then the specs say that it can run 60 frames.. Nope, fortnite can't even stay at 6 frames (and don't even ask about warzone, apex, overwatch, destiny, mainly because they can't run 2 frames even with low settings). However I can't really beat up this laptop too much, it does has its perks. It can handle editing high projects, at the cost of how long the extract is (I use After Effects). The screen quality is pretty smooth, making a cozy binge-watch for youtube or just watching streams. I hadn't tested if you can stream/video call yet so that will be in a later update.Overall this laptop is definitely NOT a gaming laptop, however it can run small games like The Sims 4, roblox, etc.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2024
review_text: A caveat: I am unsure if my issues were with the laptop, windows, or a combination of both, so take my review in stride.Out of the box it seemed to run great. Zippy, set up was a breeze, and it seemed to be a pretty confident-feeling $299 purchase. The intent was for my kiddo to run Roblox, so the first thing I did was download the app. Didn't work. Huh. Little research, turns out its relatively common to see Roblox and Win 11 not playing nice. Tried a second method by downloading directly from the website. Still no luck.I check Windows Update to make sure everything is up to date. Curiously there was one update that wouldn't apply, no matter what I did. Upon several restarts, still nothing. Update was stuck. Was recommended to reset PC to factory settings. Did that. And on reinstall, the laptop wouldn't connect to wifi, so Windows couldn't reinstall fully. Ended up being stick in a restart loop with no way to fix. Sent back to Amazon for full refund.Suffice to say my experience was not good, but I have no way of knowing if there was something wrong with the harddrive, or software, or what. It remains a mystery to me. Sad, because it seemed like a promising purchase. Part of me expected to have issues, but I'm frustrated I was right. But again, it could be Win11. It's hot garbage.

review_title: DO NOT BUY FROM THIS SELLER !!!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2024
review_text: I can only begin this review with serious misgivings about this particular Dell Inspirion laptop.  When one purchases a product from a "Dell Vendor", one presumes it is a 100% Dell product.  Apparently this was not the case with this laptop.  Exactly 3 days after the Amazon/Vendor's return policy ran out, this laptop stopped working.  The error message was "Corrupt Hard Drive".  I can understand electronic devices will sometimes have issues.  I can also understand manufacturers and vendors need to have a limit on how long they will allow items to be returned.  So we called Dell Warranty Service, and they were very helpful.  They sent a box, pre-paid shipping label and we thought that would be the end of it.  Wait a reasonable time for the laptop to be repaired under warranty, and we could go on with our lives.  NOT SO.  According to the Dell Warranty Center, this particular laptop has a 3rd Party Hard Drive.  Not a hard-drive provided by Dell or installed by Dell or used by Dell.  So... our laptop was... in fact... not able to be repaired under warranty.  Dell has offered to fix the laptop and install the correct, but the repair is nearly as much as the laptop cost new from Amazon.  This is totally unacceptable!  When we bought the laptop, we presumed it was a new Dell Laptop with appropriately sourced and installed electronics that would be approved by Dell (or installed by Dell)... BUYER BEWARE of ROKC Electronics.  They have offered NO Help,  NO Sympathy,  and we are now completely out of the money we spent, and have a laptop that is absolutely Useless!!!!  I can only imagine if we were still in the window for return, they would put the same Non-Dell parts back in, and we would be facing similar issues down the road.  This is not the way to run a business.  And certainly not the way an Amazon vendor should be doing business.  Very Very Very Disappointed!

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2023
review_text: Initial Review June 1, 2023You usually get what you pay for. For the price this is a pretty decent laptop.We have five computers in our house. One of them failed so we needed to replace it. But with so much computing power already in the family we didn't need to spend a lot on a new laptop that will be used only for school projects. No gaming or heavy graphics. This seemed to be a reasonably equipped Lenovo branded laptop for about $350. We didn't expect blazing performance, and don't need it. Given these conditions this turned out to be a pretty decent laptop.The only time I've felt the computer was slow was when opening an app. Instead of the blistering speed of my desktop this laptop takes about 3-5X longer to open an app. Pulling up an app on my desktop might take 2 seconds while this laptop takes more like 8 seconds. Once the app or web page is open I don't notice anything that seems to be slow. Most school tasks involve typing, drag and drop, perhaps photo editing. If you need to edit video you may want to buy a more powerful laptop. Not only is this a bit slow for editing but it doesn't have a powerful GPU.They didn't spend much design time on keeping the laptop light weight. It's a bit on the heavy side but manageable.- 12GB of RAM is quite generous.- Sound through the built in speakers is surprisingly good.- 256GB of storage is enough for school work, more can be added using the SD card slot. Unfortunately the SD card slot isn't deep so 1/2 of the SD card sticks out.- The screen is not a touchscreen.- The screen is clear and sharp with good colors.- The screen is bright but may not work well outdoors with bright sunlight.- The keyboard is okay to type on but they decided to cram a number keypad beside the keyboard so the key spacing is a little tight. Many people appreciate having a number keypad but I never use one.- Having volume up/down and a brightness up/down keys are very handy.- The keyboard is not backlit.- Battery life is acceptble. A full charge lasted me about 4 hours while I used it to set up windows and other apps. I was on the computer continuously for all of those 4 hours.- The SD card reader is a bonus. I would not have expected that feature from a low cost computer.- It has a USB-C port which is great, but that port won't charge the laptop battery. That would have been a bonus feature but I think they left it out to keep the cost low. Charging has to be done through the AC power port.- I did use a bluetooth headset with the computer which worked fine.I recommend this laptop

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2024
review_text: The laptop is fast and seems to work very well.  My only complaint is that it came loaded with Windows 11 S.  What this does is make it so you can't load any apps on the computer that aren't in Microsoft's Store.  Just another power grab on the part of Microsoft.  You are supposed to be able to go to System-->Activation and go to the Microsoft store to get out of 'S' mode, but it didn't work for me.  After much research I came across a suggestion to 'Reset' the laptop.  I did this (it takes a very long time) and when it was reset I could go to the Microsoft Store to get out of 'S' mode, and this time it worked.
