review_title: Keys Popped Off After a Few Uses
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2021
review_text: This laptop isn't ideal for a lot of reasons, but it does what it's meant to do -- very simple things. So, when the display colors were really off and it was a bit slow at certain programs, I didn't mind too much.However, the very first time I used this laptop, the F key popped off. I pressed it back in, haven't had any further issues with that key, and thought okay -- that was weird and kind of annoying for just having received the laptop, but that's fine. It seems to be fixed.Unfortunately, just after the return period ended, the C key popped off. This was after maybe a week or two of use. (I had saved the laptop for a specific trip, so after the initial setup with the F key incident, I didn't use it for a while until I got to my trip destination.)The C key now pops off routinely, and I constantly have to stop typing and press it back in. I can see there are a couple of other keys that seem to be threatening to do the same.Given that a good portion of my work is as a freelance writer, this is an incredibly frustrating problem to have. Although, I imagine it would be frustrating regardless. I don't think a computer I've only used consistently for a few weeks should have this many problems.While it's lightweight, has a great battery life, and more or less functions the way I need it to for basic online and MS Office tasks, the constant key issues force me to downgrade the star rating.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2021
review_text: Overall it's a good little laptop for the price, not a lot of memory but there's always the option of external memory. It operated very very slowly when first powered up but runs well now, I believe it was just all the updates that needed installing that slowed it up. My big complaint is that the camera/webcam does not work, all it shows is a black screen, this is a problem as I bought this for my wife to video chat with her parents and its kind of pointless without the camera, I spent a while looking up potential fixes and troubleshooting but have found no success, and from all my digging I found that it's a pretty common problem with this computer, I wish I would have known before buying. The camera is still non-functional but otherwise the computer works well. I would have rated higher except for the fact that the main reason I purchased this computer is the one thing that does not work at all.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2021
review_text: The one I purchased was NOT a touch screen version. I absolutely love this laptop! It is the MOST lightweight laptop I have ever had! If I'm not using it, it's lasted anywhere from 4-7 days per charge (if the battery is full). If I am using it for like games or other stuff it still lasts a while. I've been on games for at least 3 hours or so and the battery is only down a little so it's definitely worth the purchase as a good first laptop for simple tasks and simple work.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2023
review_text: This was a complete FAILURE on Global Certified Authentic's part.When the product arrived at my door I was highly excited to open it and package it as a gift to my son who is an over the road driver.When I opened the product and inspected the unit I was disappointed to find the following:The casing had a deep scratch on the bottom of the unit. Multiple others all over the device.The charging port was completely useless. It looked as if there was a broken charger snapped off inside the port. The unit would not even turn on.Upon receiving the replacement unit and charging cable, the power supply did not have the proper wattage to charge the device.Again, disappointing 😞 .I contacted the company yet again concerning this issue. I was advised that they no longer had any chargers for the unit in stock and that a refund of only $15 would be provided. Would you please locate me an OEM Dell charger for this device for $15.Well, let me tell you something. The charger that was shipped with the only working unit on the first order which is what was needed for the second cost much more than the amount that was offered as a refund.The product description said excellent condition. These devices are to go through a rigorous refurbishment process to check them for faults to see what has to be replaced or repaired. Failure on Global Certified Authentic's part.Two orders and two failures. I will never recommend this company to anyone and will steer clear in the future.Amazon should delist them until they get there act together.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2021
review_text: Arrived fully charged (which I didn't expect), packed in a tightly fitting air-filled pouch. It had the included thumb drive, a charger and instructions from the vendor on how to return if necessary, and how to leave product reviews. There were no instructions, or a manual, which was no surprise, this being a refurb. I purchased this as an inexpensive upgrade for an old Android tablet that was too small for my needs; not enough room to keep the stuff I want. The tablet took about an hour to get all the stuff I wanted loaded on it, and it seems to be working great so far. Setup was simple, and being fully charged on arrival helped with lessening the feeling of time crunch. You know: the feeling the app won't load before you run out of battery. There was none of that. My earbuds paired and connected with no drama, and it's great having an integral keyboard instead of a Bluetooth one.  Both touchscreen and touchpad cursor control are available, for whatever floats your boat. I personally suffer from fat finger syndrome, and use a mouse a lot, and that works too.  I don't know why this was refurbished, as I have not found a reason to think it hasn't always been in good shape. It's working great for me so far, and the only malfunctions have been my own fault, mostly the above fat-finger comment. It's worth the money, and if you don't HAVE to have the "latest and greatest" this will work just fine.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2023
review_text: The media could not be loaded.                Bought this as a decent backup computer to travel with a nd run my business. On arrival I charged the device fully and powered it on. I noticed food residue on the device and wiped it down fully with Clorox wipes. The fun didn't stop there, the case was damaged and had loose screws in the back of the device. No biggie I can tighten those up and get to work. I logged into the wifi in my vehicle and tried to connect. This was a child's tablet from some school. Once past the main wifi and update screens it asked for a password to a school I've never heard about. I tried to reset/power wash the system No go. I called support, they wanted to initiate a return instantly. I said let's try to fix it. Still no go so now I have a 70 Dollar brick and I still can't send emails on the go like I wanted to. As a claims adjuster this would be nice to have on the go, so I don't have to bring my 17 inch out on the road for any kind of potential damage. But someone dropped the ball on this one. Not only was it not reset I don't even think it went through an inspection for it to be in the excellent section of this website. Sorry but this is a fail in terms of use. Let's see what the next one has to offer before I say forget it and get a refund.

review_title: You get what you pay for, but they still lied
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2023
review_text: The chromebook works just fine and the specs are the same or better than advertised, but it is very clearly not a 2021 model. It is actually a Dell 11.6" Chromebook 11 3189 from 2018, and I have no idea why thy lied about it, I still would have bought it. I just wanted a cheap Chromebook to watch videos on, with and HDMI port, and that's what I got, but the deceit just really rubs me the wrong way. The condition of mine is pretty good but certainly not excellent. There is a small imperfection in the display, and the battery shows as 78% health. Both of which I would have expected to be fixed on a truly refurbished product.  Additionally the laptop is no longer supported and will not receive updates from google any more, which is also pretty suspect considering its supposed to be 2021 model. Overall I got what I wanted, but I would recommend buying something different given the dishonesty of the description in terms of quality and the actual product.Update: The battery completely died within 3 weeks of purchase. I requested a replacement and they send me another one with 78% battery health out of the box, and it is a 2017!!! Even older than the last one.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2024
review_text: Not 2021 like the product name, it’s 2017. It works overall for what I’d like, but it’s already had its last software update and i just got it not even two weeks ago. It’s slow, and I can’t even be on a discord call without it freezing up.Most shocking of all? They put a film on top! They put a film on top to disguise it as a newer model, which i think is stupid. And there’s scratches under the film.But, thankfully, it works for what I need it for. That’s about all the credit I can give it, but it works and that’s why it’s a 3/5 for me.

review_title: Very slow but some good things to go with it
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2023
review_text: I'll start with the positive. It's just enough to have a decent zoom call with. The touchscreen is more responsive than I thought it would be. The 2 in 1 function as a tablet is great for portability to take to work with you which is the reason I bought it. Low onboard memory but the expandable SD slot can boost that to be like a regular laptop. The HDMI port makes it ideal for presentations as long as you're not using any internet. It surprisingly plays streaming videos just fine. The headphone jack even lets me plug in external speakers.  And lastly the battery life is extremely good. I left it "on" (the screen will power down but the computer will still be on to be awake at the touch of the mouspad or key) and after 4 days of not realizing it, it still had a fourth of the battery left.To the bad: Every single webpage or google app that you go to or try to open will take an extremely long time, even right out of the box. 15-20 seconds to open a simple website being under wifi with a fiber connected modem that can flawlessly stream 4K across 4 TVs at once without a buffer (it means I have very fast internet). It's only 4GB of RAM but that's more than enough to be able to open things quickly. So it is, very slow.

Half the keys keep getting stuck, the screen is wobbly, and parts of the Chromebook are cracked and scratched. The Chromebook runs slow and a month after using it, it stopped receiving updates meaning that the Chromebook has passed it's auto expiration date, which causes for apps to crash and close and not function properly. And now, the Chromebook as stopped working completely, even though it's fully charged. The screen won't light up, the battery light won't turn on, nothing. I haven't even had this Chromebook for 2 months before it stopped working completely. The sticker on the bottom of the Chromebook was removed so I wouldn't be able to tell that I received something different than I paid for. I wasted $90 on this barely functioning piece of garbage, when I could have gotten 3 Chromebooks from Facebook Marketplace that have better performance, for cheaper. You're better off throwing away your money than investing it in this Chromebook

review_title: Great value, love the simplistic design
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2023
review_text: Very simple and functional yet it has all of the essentials without any of the gimmicky frills. Maybe it takes a $300 laptop so I don't have to deal with built in Alexa-enabled something, HP-specific ports, fingerprint scanner, and other stuff I don't want or need. They don't try anything fancy with this one which for me is a positive. Plus it's TKL keyboard which really should be the new norm. Does not have a backlit keyboard which is a slight miss but for the price it's not a huge deal.You can take it out of S-mode easily and remove a lot of the addons and you have yourself a perfectly functional Windows machine. Despite the lower-tier hardware it still starts up very quickly if you make sure you don't have too much bloatware. Sure it's a little slow at times but if you're using it for day to day tasks it should be fine. Battery life seems very good, the laptop is also fairly lightweight as well. What more could you ask for at this price point.

review_title: Portable Powerhouse: A Review of the HP 14" Stream Ultralight Laptop"
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2024
review_text: The HP 14" Stream Ultralight Laptop is a stellar choice for students and business professionals seeking a versatile and reliable computing solution. With its sleek design and under 3-pound weight, it's effortlessly portable for on-the-go use.Powered by an Intel Celeron N4000 series processor and 8GB of RAM, this laptop handles everyday tasks with ease while delivering crisp visuals on its 14" HD display. Plus, with up to 10 hours of battery life, it's perfect for all-day use without constantly needing to recharge.While storage capacity may be limited for some users, the addition of cloud storage options and a microSD card slot helps alleviate this concern. Overall, the HP 14" Stream Ultralight Laptop strikes an excellent balance between portability, performance, and affordability, making it a top choice for those with busy lifestyles. Highly recommended!

It would be great though for a student it if using it just to get online! The other thing I noticed is that the brightness is just not that bright. review_title: locked into MS S mode, be careful of the bait-n-switch
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2024
review_text: 5/31/2024Update: Revised review to 4 stars from 1. If you're lured to these by an Amazon flash offer, and begin to compare other options/offers, be sure to throughly compare the descriptions. Or you'll purchase something you didn't want. If you find this out after you set everything up and there is no problem with the computer itself, you're stuck with it. The other issue I had was the inability to exit Win 11 S mode. After hours of trying the standard method and several youtube videos with complex work arounds, I gave up. Today I decided to express my feelings in the MS Edge search window and I received this response from Copilot. (posted in the picture above). I post because subsequent requests produced different results. This work around worked quickly and was a three step fix. Have exited S mode and am happily running Google Chrome. Plus all my Google info and files from my broken laptop ported over. One last note: this is definitely a computer for students. It is priced reasonably considering post Covid greedflation prices. It is comparetively slow and not for use use for gamers. I will keep it as I need a computer for research and writing papers.5/30/2024-My laptop broke. Needed to complete paperwork for a project with tight time lured by "Deal" for laptop with 4GB ram 64 storage Bluetooth, Wi-Fi. $169, 12hr delivery.  I figure it was good enough to get my work done. At the site several other options were available with the same features and more memory. All had delivery dates of 1=2 days except 1 with 8GB ram, 192GB storage for $259 w/ $40 coupon, Thought extra memory and storage was worth extra $90. Computer arrived. It took an 1-1/2 hr to do updates. When I tried to download Chrome to work in Google docs {state recommended for changes}. This computer is locked into MS S mode blocking download of apps not in MS store. After spending 2hrs trying  different S mode exit directions is was resolved to doing the work on my Samsung S20 which took 3 hours to do 1 hr of work. This computer doesn't have Bluetooth, is extremely slow. MS locks y into using Edge in a worse case scenario than they did with Explorer 25 yrs ago. Don't be lured by the free1yr of Home 365. Cannot return because I used it and is technically not broken. HP is obviously returning to the days of cheap low-grade Compaq. Clearest example of Greedflation. It also moved data from broken laptop creating what will be hours of scrubbing to sell at 1/2 price on Ebay.

review_title: Better check PC before downloading all you files
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2024
review_text: The media could not be loaded.                I bought the HP 14" Stream Ultralight Laptop thinking, it was a good addition to my current desktop HP computer running Windows 11. Setting up the new PC was easy, perhaps too easy. New PC asked for router password which I gave.  PC asked for permission to copy all my files from my old desktop.  I am figuring “what the heck” it made set up new PC easy. Big mistake!  You have to understand everything was automatic up this point.  I didn’t get real feel for the laptop. When I finally got around to actually using PC it was BAD.  It picked sometimes without hitting left button (the “hover” function was turned on --- I tried to turn off NOPE).  Often, I had to press the left button several times to pick.  Later on, when I hit left button it acted as if I pressed right button. (given a choice number of actions “open new window” etc.). I requested a return and Amazon approved my request.  But here’s the rub: Amazon does not want my personal files on the laptop.  But my new laptop is a clone of old desktop through the connection with THE CLOUD – anything I do to one of PC is reflected on other PC!  I thought I broke the connection by disabling the laptop access to router NOPE.  When I try to delete a file from laptop, the laptop says “cannot delete file because you are offline”.  Apparently, the new laptop is a good PC, I just happened get this lemon.  I will try to show you the problems on video. I could only upload one video -- I press the left button and PC act like I pressed the right button.

review_title: You get what you pay for - but not bad!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2024
review_text: Honestly, for the price, this is not a bad laptop! I was looking for something I could game on, instead of cramming up my MacBook with stuff. The initial storage room for this laptop is not huge; however, it comes with an SD card! That was a nice bonus. It is not the fastest laptop in the world, but that is to be expected for how cheap it is. The keyboard is really nice and the keys feel good to type on. I don't really use the mouse tracking pad, but it hooks up to my USB mouse just fine! I think that this laptop would be perfect for someone who doesn't need to load a lot of programs, maybe someone who enjoys streaming videos, or just browsing the internet. Overall I think this is a good laptop for the price, but do your research to make sure this is what you are looking for. When I set the laptop up, it said something about a finger print lock and a touch screen - both of these options are not available for this laptop.

I often find myself wondering what happened to a whole block of text. Obviously clicking the undo button in the middle of a writing project could mean clicking undo 75 times before you find the mistake.2. The screen is way too small for a writer because it is long. That means that your document will only display about 4 inches at a time unless you minimize the text down to about 70%. As a writer, these options are very frustrating.3. I believe this laptop was advertised as a touchscreen, it is not.4. Auto sync- don’t do it unless you really want everything transferred over to your brand new laptop. I have old files that should’ve been deleted from my old computer now on my new computer and I never wanted any of that. review_title: Not a bad Chromebook, but not what was advertised.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2024
review_text: I ordered this Chromebook for a bit of research on ChromeOS.  I was specifically interested in the Dell 3180 since I'm familiar with many Dell laptop products.Upon receipt of the Chromebook, it was not the Dell 3180 I expected, but an HP Chromebook II G6 EE (see photos).  For what it is, it is equivalent to the Dell Chromebook (size and profile, micro-SD card slot), but uses the USB-C port for power and recharging.  The 3180 (from the photo) uses a barrel jack for power, which I find more rubust and reliable than the USB-C port.I am giving the HP Chromebook a chance for the research.  I only wished the details of the actual make/model had been accurate; this oversight I might expect from eBay, but never not from Amazon, regardless if the product was directly from Amazon or from its partners.I might decide to purchase a second unit for my research; but only if I could be assured that I would  receive the actual make and model of Dell Chromebook advertised.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2024
review_text: Worked great for exactly 2 months. Suddenly, the system did not even recognize that the display is a touch screen. Rolling back Win 11 update, having device manager human interface search for hardware changes, doing Dell-recommended hard reset did nothing. Dell support arranged shipping to them. Dell was good about handling this promptly. Dell replaced the FACTORY 256GB SSD and removed the NOT-FACTORY Kingston 1TB SSD (yes, there are two SSD slots). It shipped the 1TB back with the unit in a separate bag. I replied to Dell support email that I received it back and had questions. Dell rep called me and patiently answered my questions. Though his accent was strongly far-eastern, I could understand most of what he said and he kindly repeated when asked.In short, 3rd party retailers will supe up a Dell product (in this case) to upgrade its specifications. I've used Kingston drives many times with no issues, so this is not a criticism of Kingston per se.  But for whatever reason it was either faulty or incompatible.This purchase was a good deal even if it turns out to be 256 GB rather than 1TB. The problem is it wasted a ton of my time to resolve.See images for Dell return letter and Dell rep reply to my questions after we spoke on the phone.My only annoyance with Dell is that when they reinstalled Windows 11 home on the new SSD, they installed the S version. Windows claims the S stands for more "secure." Perhaps, but you can ONLY install 3rd party apps downloaded from the Microsoft store. So, I could not install Zoom! That's unacceptable. I googled how to remove the S "feature" permanently. That worked, and I could then install the Zoom app.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
review_text: I bought this laptop (3511 Laptop, as  an early Christmas gift for my adult son who is returning to college in January. I ordered it on October 15. My son used it in November to apply for admission in January. This week while on a zoom call with the college, the computer screen went blank, except for a white horizontal line. If you check, you will find few options to get through to Dell for either service or to give a review. Since I bought it from Amazon, I called their customer service number. My only option is to return it to Amazon and they will credit my account with over $135 less than I paid for it. It is their policy not to give full refunds after 30 days from purchase date. The customer service representative was thorough, professional and sympathetic, stressed that he had no choice but to refund my account for a fraction of our cost when we send back the useless Dell computer. I’ve used Amazon for a long time as many people, particularly senior citizens, use for their shopping during the holidays, especially. Please be careful, especially when ordering an expensive item from Dell or through Amazon. Neither stands behind the products they sell.

review_title: Win 11 / MS sucks -- key info not disclosed by all 4: seller, Amazon, Dell and Microsoft
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
review_text: Dec 16, 2023: I bought this laptop on Amazon US website because retailers here in Beijing/China do not sell devices with English-language OS. First of all, the process of import into China was not fully disclosed by Amazon at the time of transaction. Consumer needs to share a lot of documentation. The device does not come with basic apps preinstalled. Meaning, although the OS is Win 11, the device does not have MS Office pack bundled with the OS. But these apps are "pinned" to the screen. When you open, say, Word or PPT document, the user is prompted to buy MS-Office monthly or annual subscription. You feel as if MS OS has made both hardware/device (Dell) and the user inconsequential and incidental -- such is the overwhelming, overpowering nature of MS presence on the PC. So unlike in the past. You don't feel empowered but dwarfed, conned, manipulated and tricked. Had I been proactively informed by Amazon and Dell that the device does not come with any frequently used basic software/apps, i would not probably have bought this PC.

review_title: Should not be this slow, given the specs
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2024
review_text: I'm not totally convinced I received a computer with the specs outlined in the description. I kinda think they swapped some parts on this computer, because there is not reason for a computer with these specs to perform this terribly right out of the box. Also, Windows 11 is terrible.A few issues I’m having:-The computer keeps shutting down instead of going to sleep. When I step away for lunch, I come back and the computer won’t wake up. I click, press buttons on the keyboard, and even press the power button, but nothing happens. I have to hold down the power button and the computer reboots. This causes me to lose everything I’m working on and I need to reopen everything.-The USB-C jack does not work with the HDMI. I have an adapter to connect the keyboard, mouse, and monitor via the USB-C. This worked on my old Lenovo computer, but does not work on this one. I would prefer to unplug one thing instead of 4 different things if I want to move around with my laptop.-The USB-C jack is emitting power, even when shut down. This leads to batter drain. This never happened with my old computer.-The headphone jack does not work.-The computer is very slow and laggy. If I try to browse the internet during a zoom meeting the meeting gets very laggy. This was not an issue with my old Lenovo and should not be an issue with a computer of these specs.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2024
review_text: Good work laptop

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2024
review_text: Where to start. That's easy, don't ever buy a Lenovo laptop. I purchased mine in March of 2024 and the screen stopped working within 6-weeks of the first use. I then contacted Lenovo as it was obviously still under warranty and was instructed to ship to their service center for repair. Once it arrived at Lenovo and was diagnosed, I then received an email back with a quote of $164.68 to have it repaired. The symptom they gave was as follows: CID - 3rd Party SSD. When I emailed back asking for clarification on "3rd Party SSD and why that wasn't covered, was then told that the Lenovo warranty doesn’t cover 3rd party parts. Keep in mind that this was a laptop purchased through Amazon new and arrived in original Lenovo packaging. They basically passed the buck on the repair and wouldn't agree to honor the warranty. There's no way that this machine had any part other than the originals as manufactured by Lenovo. Once explaining the situation to Amazon, they were quick to give me a full refund once the original unit was returned. Sadly I've been without a laptop for over a month now, and all of this has been a huge headache. The laptop was hardly used and never left my office desk. This is nothing more than a cop out by Lenovo to honor its warranty and would not recommend that anyone buy this laptop or any other from Lenovo. They obviously don't mind selling their products through 3rd party vendors (yes Amazon), but will not honor the warranty. I would love to share my email exchange with you all, but there is a disclaimer that basically says that the information in the email is confidential and that any copying or distribution of its contents is unlawful. Unbelievable. DO NOT BUY!

review_title: Lenovo Sent a Used, Already Turned On, Defective Computer AS NEW!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2024
review_text: What's the first thing you do when you get a new laptop? Turn it on, right? And walk through the steps to set it up..Not with this one. Because Lenovo didn't send me a new laptop. This one they sent me was already turned on as soon as I pulled it out of the box, which I found strange. But then was immediately greeted with this error message asking if I wanted to reboot from a device, troubleshoot, or turn the computer off.I never got a chance to turn my new laptop on and set it up because Lenovo sent me a Used, Already Turned On, Already Error Messaged laptop AS NEW.Lenovo had previously been my go-to and I trusted them. That trust is gone. This is very disappointing and disheartening. as well as inconveniencing with work time lost, as I now have to wait for the return to process before I can purchase another laptop that is new and functioning.I am returning this immediately and will not be buying from Lenovo ever again, and will also post this review elsewhere so that others can know that Lenovo is now sending Used, Already Turned On, Already Error Messaged laptops As New. This is completely unacceptable.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2024
review_text: I have had some very nice laptops that cost thousands of dollars.  I also own a high-end Lenovo but this is my go-to.  The Fiesta Red color is stunning.  Boots up quickly, nice feel to the keys, track pad is responsive and the the screen is crystal clear yielding sharp, vibrant images.  I don't need as much out of a laptop like I used to (I am retired), but I teach English in South America and do lots of very complex PowerPoints.  You can run multiple screens simultaneously with videos, easy to splice, computer does not "hang" at all.  We Chromebook lovers know how great Google OS is...excellent security, updates only require a re-boot, on-line and hard drive storage, excellent stability.  Chromebooks have come a long way and are biting into the regular laptop market and this one may surprise you. The metal casing is protective and sturdy.  Screen is versatile and opens fully to tablet form.  Touchscreen is excellent...what else can I say.  I will update if I run into any problems but at this point I have no issues.  Before breaking the bank on a "regular" laptop (and then you are stuck with Microsoft Windows and the crazy updates that don't recognize your peripherals, screw up your drivers and generally suck), check out a good Chromebook.  You will save lots of money and get a better machine with a better operating system that looks nice and performs.

review_title: Great chromebook much like pixelbook go.

review_text: Surprisingly xlnt in all ways. And the price on sale at $349 was fine after having paid 1200 for xlnt pixelbook and for mediocre spin 714. Great back lit keyboard. Good touch screen. Fast enough - I couldn't want for more really. No ports as is very customary on chromebook so dongles are needed for ext monitor and usb which isn't an issue.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2024
review_text: I purchased this on Amazon on sale.  The value is very good. The design is great. It is light weight. The size is what I wanted.  I am a bit disappointed in the graphics which I hoped would be sharper. My fingers are crossed regarding the touch screen because I read in the review section that the touch screen died after a short time.  So far it is just fine, but it is a concern.  I took a chance because of the price.  I am enjoying using it for now.  I had purchased a cheaper chromebook which was driving me crazy because it was so slow and clunky.  I couldn't maneuver on some website with heavy advertising such as the nypost.  Also, the screen kept changing sizes and I could get it back to normal. All kinds of problems which made me decide to go for a more upscale book.  As of now, I do recommend this model, it is fast and functional.

review_title: amazing quality and OS for the price.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2024
review_text: i was in the market to find a cheaper laptop simply to use as my asset management device, so when i seen the Chromebook come on sale I couldn't have been more excited, especially from a name like Samsung. it does exactly everything i need it to do and I am able to trade assets on the go without using my mobile phone.note: sometimes Chrome can show buggy drop-down menus on pages, simply open your page in incognito mode and this should fix your issues. example: Coinbase drop down menus are sometimes buggy, incognito fixes this and is more private anyways 👍

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2022
review_text: Nice, light, fast system that looks great. Sadly, it arrived with touch screen not working.Also, pretty disappointed that two Android apps I use all of the time (OneNote and Slack) are not supported on Chromebooks. I would have overlooked that if the touch screen had been working.Apparently my 10.2" iPad makes a better chromebook than this turd does.Returned.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2024
review_text: This is my second Chromebook. My previous CB was almost a decade ago so I wasn't sure how much the OS had improved. As a user, I'm primarily a Mac user but I do also have a gaming Win11 PC.Functionally this device is less limited than I expected due to being able to enable Linux and also via installing Android apps.The display is fantastic as far as colors and contrast. Touch may be a bit too sensitive. The i3 is more than adequate and it runs smoothly for expected CB usage such as web browsing, chats, music, and watching videos.The sound is adequate but your ears won't be in awe. The speakers are located on the bottom and easily muffled by your lap.Build quality is a mix of metal and plastic. It's above average. The fiesta red is beautiful, although the metal lid is slightly darker than the plastic bottom half with the keyboard.I'm pleased with this Chromebook.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2024
review_text: First, the Samsung computer itself does run great as a chromebook, but only as a chromebook.My issue is with the Chrome OS itself. I use Microsoft Office products and that has always worked on my other chromebooks, although not always smoothly.This chromebook does updates once or twice a week and in the past few days I have not been able to use any Microsoft Office apps or web based products. I believe this is by design,  Google wants you to use their Office products only.  Google docs and Google sheets are terrible and inferior to Microsoft office.I do not like Microsoft windows computers, they are buggy and unreliable and have major security issues. review_title: A great Chromebook that's often overlooked.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2022
review_text: This is a great Chromebook that's overlooked, due to some harsh and biased reviews out there on the web and YouTube. Thankfully, some of the more objective reviews made some good points and pointed out certain things about this device that made it appealing to me. That combined with the fact it was on sale when I was considering it sealed the deal for me.Some things about this device to note:- Build: Very good, aluminium base and lid with a high quality plastic deck which has been colour matched very well. I got the red and it does have hues of orange here and there, which I like. No creaking but there's a slight flex when holding it at one corner, but it's barely noticeable.- Keyboard: A bit shallow but the keys are a good size and has a nice typing feel to it. I find it enjoyable to use and I'm fairly accurate with it. It's backlit too, with a nice subtle glow.- Speakers: Not very rich in sound, but the sound is clear and sounds good for a device with this profile. It is down firing though.- Touchpad: a bit small, but definitely useable with a nice click and the surface is smooth since it's glass. So thumbs up there.- Webcam: The webcam is 720 and not very good but will do the job, I guess.- Screen: The screen is very nice, it's plenty sharp in this form factor with good colours and deep blacks with great viewing angles.- Battery: Battery life is good, I think I average around 7 to 8 hours. I could probably get 10 out of it if I manage the screen brightness a bit more.- Peformance: This is a 10th gen i3 with 8gb of RAM and while most would say that it's not as good as the 11th gen, this is still a well performing machine. I run multiple tabs at once and the machine remains nice and snappy while using it so performance is very good. It also runs very quiet, I can barely tell the fan is running at times.-Ports: Port selection isn't great, the device only has the two usb c ports on either side but there is an SD card slot to expand the storage plus a headphone jack, which is nice. I invested in a little USB-C hub to provide USB-A and HDMI ports.I would definitely recommend this device and I would buy it again, especially at the discounted price but even when buying it at the full price, it's still a great machine that many would be happy with I think.(I almost forgot to mention, for anyone wondering, mine didn't ship with the massive black sticker on the left of the trackpad that I saw in some reviews, so seems the retail versions don't have it since it's almost impossible to remove cleanly).

review_title: Keyboard and Monitor are different colors!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2022
review_text: The review from Svdg50 was a red flag (no pun intended), however I was hoping the problem was isolated to international shipments as I didn't see any mention in the domestic reviews. Not the case! I just received my fiesta red chromebook and the monitor is what I believe is supposed to be the fiesta red color but the keyboard frame is obviously a different color (more of an orange hue). This issue doesn't appear to be isolated to the Samsung Amazon store either, because I just drove to BestBuy (CA location) and their floor model has the same issue! I can't find any other reference online to the fiesta red being two different colors intentionally, but all of the pictures on Samsung's, Amazon's, and BestBuy's website show a chromebook with one uniform red color.I don't know if Samsung is trying to offload old inventory, but if Samsung's lying about the external components, it calls into question the quality of the internal components. It's possible the Chromebook will be amazing despite the aesthetic, but this rating reflects the abhorrent false advertising going on.

review_title: Experience versatility and power with the Samsung Galaxy Chromebook 2 360
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2022
review_text: As a frequent traveler, I was in need of a reliable, lightweight, and portable computing device that could keep up with my busy lifestyle. That's where the Samsung Galaxy Chromebook 2 comes in.Right out of the box, I was immediately impressed by the Chromebook 2's sleek and stylish design. The Fiesta Red color option is a nice touch, giving it a unique look that stands out from the sea of boring silver laptops. And at just 2.7 lbs, it's lightweight and easy to carry with me wherever I go.But it's not just about the looks - the Samsung Galaxy Chromebook 2 also packs a powerful punch. The 13.3" Full HD touchscreen display is crisp and vibrant, making it a joy to use for streaming movies or browsing the web. And the 10th Gen Intel Core i3 processor and 8 GB of RAM ensure smooth and responsive performance, even when running multiple applications at once.But what really sets the Samsung Galaxy Chromebook 2 apart is its 2-in-1 design. I can use it as a traditional laptop for typing up documents or taking notes, or flip the screen around and use it as a tablet for presenting to a group or watching movies on the go. This versatility is a game-changer for someone like me who is constantly on the move.Overall, I am extremely satisfied with my purchase of the Samsung Galaxy Chromebook 2. It's a reliable, feature-packed device that meets all my computing needs, and the 2-in-1 design is a major bonus. The only thing I wish it had is a built-in stylus. If you're in need of a versatile and portable computing device, I highly recommend giving the Samsung Galaxy Chromebook 2 a try.

review_title: Too fragile! Avoid this otherwise excellent Chromebook.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2021
review_text: This is beautiful and very capable lightweight Chromebook. Unfortunately, I can not recommend it. It's too fragile.The screen cracked within 3 months of normal at-home use. I am not a road-warrior. The device was never dropped. There was no trauma. But screen cracks are not covered by the warranty. So it cost $365 to repair through Samsung.The screen and bezel panel is very thin by design. It exhibits a small amount of flex in regular use. The tension created from regularly opening and closing the screen is too much for the design. (There are no protective cases available for this model to give it more rigidity or protection.)So either get an extended warranty that covers screen damage or forget it.

review_title: 2 major problems: multicolour body and poor google chrome integration (crazy!!!!)
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2022
review_text: I would love this laptop if there was not two major problems, that can happen to you too. First, I've received an item that has TWO colours, an orange part and a red part. Ridiculous. Dear Samsung, please contact me to fix this.The second point shocked me most. Say you are on a pc or mac, using chrome. You've got a personal (google) and a professional (google suite) account. You're used to switch between both with ease. It matters because one account has company data on it, and the other may have personal passwords. Now you get a chromebook like this one, thinking it's going to be super well integrated. NO IT'S NOT! In a chromebook, you login in the computer with say, your google account. If you choose to log-in with your company google suite account, and it's not an ENTERPRISE licence which costs an additional 50 USD per year, then you CANNOT "enroll" the laptop in your google suite account. Because you cannot enroll, you cannot install anything from google play, including VPN or any other app. Useless!Now if you login in your personal account, and then from within, add your professional login, well you've got a chrome that is synced to your personal account, you can add apps, but you can't access whatever else is supposed to be synced on your pro account, such as passwords! What a mess. No way around it.

review_title: Very good for what it is.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2024
review_text: I'm rating this as a 5 based on what it is. This is not a powerhouse or gaming computer. It has a dual-core i3 chip which is just enough to accommodate simple tasks. I picked this up as a travel computer so that, if something happened to it, I'm not out of a lot of money.If you want something fast with lots of cores that can handle gaming and/or other CPU/GPU-intensive apps, this won't meet your needs. If your needs are more modest, this may do the trick.All I'm looking to do with it is check email, browse the web, watch videos, etc., while I'm away from home. I can imagine it being an adequate student laptop for a family on a budget.That said, it has a decent feature set, considering what you pay for it. The operating system (Windows 11 Pro) is not activated, though it is mostly functional. You can't personalize the display, and it nags you about activating.Because it's not activated, you don't require (and cannot use) a Microsoft account. You create an account that isn't tied to your normal Microsoft stuff. I can't use One Drive, for example, but that isn't what I care about with this machine.You can activate Windows, of course, which (at the time of this posting) will set you back about $300 USD. However, if you want a fully activated Windows laptop at some point down the road, you've spread out the cost over time. It's an interest-free loan in that case (though who knows if the price of activation will go up in the meantime).It has plenty of ports (3 USB including type C, HDMI, micro SD, wired headphone/mic jack, and a dedicated LAN port). I like that last one, as you can use WiFi or a physical cable to connect to a router.The keyboard is full-sized and, so far, has held up to simple use. Same with the trackpad.It comes with WPS (a free alternative to Microsoft Office), which I haven't used, but it should do fine for basic tasks (word processing, spreadsheet, presentation). As far as I can tell, it uses the Office file formats (docx, for example), so it should be reasonably compatible.I haven't had an occasion to print anything with the laptop, so I can't speak to that.It comes with 16GB RAM and a 512GB SSD. All in all, not bad for the price.

review_text: The media could not be loaded.                Compré esa Laptop en enero y pedí a un familiar que viajaba de USA hacia mi país que pudiera traérmela y ahorrar en el envío hasta centro america. Al recibirla venía con todos sus accesorios, las especificaciones correctas y todo iba bien. Suelo cuidar mucho mis cosas para al tener que revenderlas poder hacerlo en la mejores condiciones por lo que no le he dado ningún rasguño ni usado programas no compatibles para mi computadora. Pero al rededor del 4 mes de tenerla en 1 o 2 ocasiones hizo un parpadeo extraño pero creí qué tal vez era por la aplicación que estaba usando o que estaba descargada y lo dejé pasar. Pero ahora un mes después la situación es incontenible y no me deja trabajar. No se si esto es un defecto común de fábrica de esta marca o modelo pero el vendedor no me contesta nose que hacer realmente o si este defecto tiene solución e invertí mis ahorros en algo que necesito para tareas básicas de mi trabajo pero de uso diario.Investiguen antes de comprar el productoAyudaaaa!

review_title: I’d give 0 stars if I could
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2024
review_text: I had to buy a laptop for a class I am taking. I chose a refurbished model because I did not want to contribute to the ongoing genocide in the Congo related to mining of materials for tech devices. Unfortunately, this MacBook screen has been shutting off without notice since the day I got it. Sometimes it stays on for the whole time I am using it, other times, it shuts off in the middle of my class despite being in use, having no apparent sleep or screen preferences that would indicate such behavior, and without any ability to turn back on. It seems to come back without any input from me. The computer itself is not dead, I can hear the buttons being pushed and it allows shutting off. It’s currently not turning back on despite having saved school work on it that I won’t be able to retrieve before sending it back to be returned. I am now in the position of having to scramble to buy another computer hastily so I can take an in-person exam next week. I’m not sure what is going on, but I am incredibly frustrated and have never had this issue with any other Mac computers I have owned.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2024
review_text: I’ve gotten renewed devices before and it’s always gonna be a bit of a gamble, but this is pretty much as described (I chose excellent condition). It has a couple small scratches and a dent (pictured) and the battery does say “service recommended” (which doesn’t mean there’s anything wrong, just that the battery is on the older side) but for a four year old computer I’d say that isn’t a dealbreaker. I’ve been using this MacBook Air regularly for about a week and I’ve had no issues and the battery does hold while streaming video for about 3 - 4 hours. I haven’t attempted any gaming which I’d imagine is where you’d see lagging and battery drain, but for my needs it’s pretty much perfect (a sticker will easily cover the small scratches). Years ago I bought this same model new and it cost me well over $1,000, so for less than half that I’d say it’s worth it.

review_title: works well, but came with wrong charger
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2022
review_text: Shipping took a bit longer than expected and it was shipped via FedEx which made me nervous because FedEx tends to lose packages with tech contents. But, they delivered this one without requiring my signature or anything, they just put the box in front of the door.The laptop came in a big box and it was just sort of loose in there with a generic charger. I turned the laptop on and the battery was at about 70-80% charged. The laptop so far, works well. I installed all my work programs on it and everything runs well. Then the battery was running low, so I plugged it in. The computer continued to work but it stated "Battery not charging". I tried shutting it down and turning it back on...nothing. Then I tried a different USB-C cable that I have that connects to a USB outlet and it finally charged but super slowly. I checked the charger and it's 85W. The MacBook Air uses a 30W. It shouldn't really impact charging of the battery with a higher powered charger so I'm confused why it's not charging. I tried a few different outlets and it works in some outlets but not all. I wrote the seller and they said they'd forward my concern to the proper department. We shall see. I can't comment too much on battery life yet since I just finally got it fully charged but I felt that it drained pretty quickly from 70% to almost 0% but I was also installing and running a bunch of programs.From the outward appearance, the MacBook Air is in great condition. I was a bit nervous from reading some reviews where there was significant damage. This one has one little scratch on one of the sides but that's it. display, keyboard and trackpad are in excellent condition and looks like new.If we get the charger situation resolved then it was definitely a good purchase and I'd recommend it as you can save a few hundred dollars by buying a "renewed" computer.Just updating my review. I took the computer to the apple store and it was determined that the charger was not working properly. So, I purchased an apple charger. The seller has given me a partial refund for about half the coast of the charger, which is fine. The apple store also ran diagnostics on the laptop and said everything is in good shape.Overall, happy with the purchase.

review_title: Good value for a college student without high-power needs!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2022
review_text: Processor-wise, this MacBook Air isn’t a powerhouse, or blazingly fast. But it upgraded to Ventura 13.0.1 just fine, so it’s as current as can be for MacOS now (pro tip - always upgrade your MacOS when buying a refurb, as it more than likely won’t be current since it was shipped from a shelf, I’d bet).This laptop is definitely as advertised, so big kudos to the supplier. Screen is clean, and case and screen are scratch-free. Keyboard has the normal somewhat shiny keys here and there (finger oil, usually), so a delicate cleaning with isopropyl usually helps restore as good as it’ll get (which, again here is pretty good and no more than expected). My son, who’s in college, uses mostly cloud-based school apps and Google docs, so horsepower isn’t a big need. And he’s a Nintendo Switch guy for gaming, so I never get the IT Support call for slow laptop when trying to destroy his gaming enemy (thank God). I moved him from an 11” MacBook, which was an OS or 2 locked behind (and apparently dropped more than once, but he won’t come clean there), so even though that was actually fine horsepower-wise still, this one will give him a few more years, plus save me some $ towards his Masters (ugg) degree. So all-in-all, positive experience and product.

review_title: I'm a PC guy....yet I freaking love this Mac
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2022
review_text: For YEARS (maybe even decades now) I've been heavily against buying Macs....they were always waaaaaaaay too expensive for what you got.  And even for creatives you can get a top of the line PC that can also play games at the cost of most Macs.But now....the M1 generation is here to change everything.  This thing only cost me around $1,200 and it can edit photos and video with 0 issues, EVEN 4K FOOTAGE!It runs forever, it rarely ever skips when working....it just freaking works....like flawlessly.I'm also glad to see that Apple took the route of making this thing a beast, but giving it one glaring flaw which I'm fine with to keep the cost down....that flaw is the HD space.This thing has only freaking 250GB in it which is almost nothing in this day and age for creatives....mine as well have given me 50GB lol.  So having an external HD attached to this thing 24/7 is a must, but that's a price I'm willing to pay for this.I recommend this to any photographer/videographer that doesn't need a daily driver Mac to edit with.  When I say Daily Driver, I mean a computer that you use for everything, for going on FB, playing games, work, etc, etc.  I personally ONLY use this for editing and it's perfect for that.If you need a daily driver Mac then consider one of the Pro or Max series because you'll have more power and more space to do what you need.  But those are so expensive that I'd only recommend them if you are doing a lot of hardcore video editing or are in desperate need to have your setup consist of only one computer.  At that $3k+ price tag you can buy this M1 Mac Air and get a solid gaming PC to act as your daily driver.

review_title: Completely over the moon for my first MacBook
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2023
review_text: This is my first MacBook, and I couldn't be more happy with it.  Unfortunately, I cannot afford a brand new one, but this performs better than any brand new laptop I've ever purchased. review_text: OK, understand that I'm just an old guy well into my 70s, so, as might be expected, I don't need a laptop for anything fancy, just the web & email. review_title: Don't bother with the Core Ultra; this unit is great
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2024
review_text: It's still very early days so I can't comment on durability yet. But I will provide some opinions and commentary.This Acer Swift Go 14 replaced a new Asus Zenbook 14 with OLED screen and Core Ultra 155h. The Asus arrived with a defective touchpad so it went back to BestBuy.So enough history. I had been lusting after this Acer unit  for quite a number of months so, when the Asus went south and Amazon dropped the price on the Acer, I ordered it. It arrived in two days (as promised). Came with a zippered case (which I haven't even opened yet).Forgot that it had a touchscreen; I'll never use it as the screen doesn't fold back into tablet mode so it's essentially worthless to me; they could have left it out and sold it for less. I guess everybody wants an iPad wannabe, eh?The screen itself, however, is sharp and clear and very bright. I tend to keep it at 50% brightness as I computer indoors. The 1920x1200 resolution is perfect. I keep it at 125% magnification and can read the small lettering just fine with my glasses.The keyboard has plenty of key travel (unlike MacBooks) and the touchpad, which I don't think is a Synaptics, operates well. It's not oversized (as Macs tend to be) but feels right to me. Tapping, two-finger scrolling, three- and four-finger swipes are supported (as is a traditional "click" if you press).Performance: Very speedy; feels as fast if not faster than the Asus Zenbook I returned. If I could install Windows 10, I might do that only because Win11 gets in my way with its incessant nagging and suggesting and whining. Maybe when I figure out how to turn off all the annoyances, I'll be happier with Win11.General Design: One of the things I've liked about Acer non-gaming laptops/notebooks is their "vanilla" design ethos. Keep it simple and clean. The case of this Swift is a lovely somewhat squared-off "chiseled" look in the same sense as an Ioniq 5. I think the manufacturing execution is not quite Apple quality--the case port edges are a little sharper than Apple would permit--but everything plugs in the way it should. The keyboard is recessed below the palm rest a bit so your greasy fingers won't end up leaving marks on the screen when you close the lid. Speaking of the keyboard, it's nice and large with well-spaced keys and adequate backlighting.Battery life: Ran it for about 6+ hours with lots of web use. I think I had about 50% left. No complaints.As I think about it, the Acer reminds me most of my 13" 2012 MacBook Pro although it's a larger screen, higher resolution, incredibly faster, and about 1.25 lbs lighter. :D That Mac was, IMHO, the pinnacle of Mac laptop design. I think Acer has done a great job with this unit.I'll report back in a few months regarding any QC issues that, hopefully, won't pop up.

review_title: The Most Versatile and Portable Windows Laptop
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
review_text: This is the closest I've seen a Windows laptop get to being a MacBook replica. The portability, performance, weight, and overall ease of use make this laptop an all-around option depending on what you are looking for. The laptop includes a wall adapter with a fixed USB-C cable for charging in addition to support documents and limited warranty information.When first setting up the laptop, I did have to plug it into power as the battery was out of charge on arrival, but within a few minutes I was able to power it on and begin the setup process. The setup is the same routine questions and answers on most laptops, but this one does have some extra bloatware preinstalled- namely the Acer apps and McAfee Antivirus. The setup also gives you the option to set up your fingerprint if you would like additional security, which is baked into the power button. The process here is simple and it is the same process as adding your fingerprint on a phone, however, the power button can be pressed easily when doing this, so do it gently.Once the setup is complete, you'll be in Windows and ready to start using the laptop. The default wallpaper is an Acer one, and you will have some pop ups from McAfee asking you to set up or extend your subscription. I recommend uninstalling these apps and any others you may not use in addition to also disabling OneDrive as it will free up some of the resources from being used up by the unwanted programs. The laptop also has a few USB ports for connecting your devices in addition to the headphone jack, HDMI port, and a MicroSD card reader. For expanded use, I recommend using a docking station to get even more versatility out of this laptop.The laptop itself runs without issue, and the built-in display is bright enough for my normal everyday usage although it can appear dim when using it outdoors or in brightly lit areas. The screen is also very colorful and doesn't have any issues with the picture washing out or distorting when looking at it from an angle, and the integrated touch screen works flawlessly whether I use my fingertips or a capacitive stylus. My only complaint about the display is that it is limited to 60hz, which can make scrolling or moving things across the screen feel choppy and sluggish at times but that's coming from someone who uses 144hz+ displays most of the time. Most people will be more than okay with that frame rate. Additionally, the speakers on this laptop are surprisingly good. The speakers are rich and full sounding without the hollow, harsh sharp sounds that you typically get when listening to voices or watching online content. They still don't have the same level of depth and detail as a pair of headphones or dedicated speakers, but they will be more than enough for the average person.As far as the performance of the laptop goes, it works really well. The performance cores of this i7 chip don't always like to engage which is fairly noticeable when watching streamed content such as videos or scrolling through e-books or news articles, but once you open a more demanding application, such as a game or editing software, the CPU will boost higher and the laptop will feel more smooth. The internal SSD also helps this laptop to boot up extremely quickly, as I find myself on the Windows login screen within 15-20 seconds every time I power it on from its shutoff state, and if it's asleep from just having the lid closed, it will wake up immediately when lifting the lid. The laptop on its own can handle almost everything you throw at it. It can run almost any online game without issue and it can also stream most online content without any lag or hitching with the exception of the occasional jitter if you try to load videos in 4K resolution. The internal graphics on the CPU can also run a large amount of older games at lower resolutions and detail settings, which also help give this laptop a lot of capabilities despite its small and narrow design. When running non-intensive tasks, the laptop is virtually whisper silent, and even under load it does not get as loud as I was expecting. However, my favorite part of this laptop is the Thunderbolt USB-C ports. These USB-C ports are special compared to other USB-C ports as the Thunderbolt technology allows you to not only use either of these ports to charge the laptop, but if you get a docking station as mentioned, you can charge the laptop, power a mouse and keyboard, output an image on another display, read SD card files, and much more just with that one Thunderbolt port. Not only that, if you are a gamer, you can use these Thunderbolt ports in conjunction with a GPU enclosure, which will allow you to play newer AAA video games on your laptop by just connecting an external GPU to the Thunderbolt port on the laptop. Despite the small design of the laptop, the Intel i7 chip pairs nicely with my older RTX 3070 when connected to a GPU enclosure, and I can play any game from my Steam library if I choose. Don't get too excited though, as this feature does require both a GPU enclosure and a GPU to put inside of it, but I am just telling you how versatile this laptop can get if you had the extra equipment.Lastly, the battery life on this laptop is absolutely stunning in how long it lasts. Whenever you simply close the lid and let the laptop rest in idle, it barely sips power and can last for days in standby without losing much battery life at all. Additionally, the battery charges fast when needed, and since it uses USB-C for power, as long as you have an adapter and cable rated for higher wattages, this makes the laptop easier to find a substitute charger for if you ever misplace the original. In normal use, I can easily get a full day or longer out of this laptop before it needs to be recharged if I am using it continuously, but it can last much longer as mentioned if I only use it for a couple hours here and there.Overall, this is an exceptionally versatile laptop that can be easily taken on the go or left at home on a desk to do all the things you need. Need to finish a college essay while eating brunch at a coffee shop? It'll do that. Want to sit at home, relax and watch your favorite content creators? It will do that too. No matter how you need or want to use it, it will do the job. Whether it's for productivity, gaming, entertainment, etc, it's the first Windows laptop of its class that I can genuinely say I would use on a regular basis. I highly recommend it!

review_text: Just got this PC delivered this morning and finished setting it up. review_title: The computer died at the 7 month mark.

review_text: I tried to get help with my dead ACER laptop purchased oct 10 of 2023. A swift go 14. I used the laptop on my lap enough that the snid has a missing digit where the sticker is wrinkled. Magic disappearing ink. No help from manufacturer product support without 11 digits. Mine as 10. The ACER product support agent said amazon will have the snid on record.  Have you ever tried to contact Amazon?  Just beat your head against the wall. I can't find a way to get the info I need. My warranty is good for 5 more months but it's worthless without the snid. Amazon services is the seller. I guess the lesson here is don't buy anything you really need and aren't prepared to throw away from Amazon. My price was just under $800 at the time. Another expensive lesson from Amazon just like the $400 taco pump that died in 35 days and the seller on Amazon said tough luck.  Those carry a 1 year warranty as well.  See the pattern?  There is no warranty or help from Amazon for any purchase. I forgot the vac I bought that was supposed to have 2 aluminum sections but came with 1 and the seller had me take pictures and send them but never helped. It's perfect for a child who stands 3' tall. Never used... anybody want a deal?  Save yourself a headache don't buy a product with no support or warranty and Amazon has changed to a no help company.

review_title: Blazing Fast and Brilliant OLED Screen!
