review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2024
review_text: Review for: Acer Aspire 5 A515-56-347N Slim Laptop - 15.6" Full HD IPS Display - 11th Gen Intel i3-1115G4 Dual Core Processor - 8GB DDR4 - 128GB NVMe SSD - WiFi 6 - Amazon Alexa - Windows 11 Home in S Mode,Silver.This is not the fastest laptop, but it is functional and works well for the price. It has a very nice feature of allowing you to add an internal 2.5" SATA HDD or SSD. It comes with only a 128 GB NVMe main drive, so the ability to add an additional drive is nice. I had a Samsung 500 GB SSD from my old laptop, so I will have plenty of storage. I got the Samsung drive to speed up my old (HDD) laptop, and it made a big difference. It was actually a little faster than this one with the Samsung SSD. I wish I had made the Samsung drive the boot drive before I got the laptop all set up. But with the NVMe drive I thought it would be a bit faster than my old machine. This is not painfully slow, just not peppy. Using the Samsung SSD as the main (C) drive may have made it faster. I may change it over later. It has one DDR4 slot that is populated with a 4 GB DIMM. There is 4 GB down, giving the machine 8 GB total. I replaced the 4 GB with a 16 GB DIMM. It is built well for an entry level product. The screen bright and crisp. It has a good port selection and even has an Ethernet port. A lot of newer laptops don't have an Ethernet port. It also support WIFI 6. It comes with Windows 11 Home in S mode. I didn't notice the S mode in the description. Thank goodness you can deactivate this mode, or this laptop would have been returned. S mode only allows Microsoft approved apps to be installed. For example: I use Firefox browser, and in S mode I couldn't install it. There are several others I use that wouldn't install. I noticed the price dropped $21 from the time I ordered this laptop until today, when I started to write this review. I called Amazon to see if they would refund or issue a credit for future Amazon purchases. To my surprise Amazon's previously stellar customer service has changed. They say they don't do price matching. I believe price matching is if the product is found at a different store at a lower price. This price change is within Amazon. Amazon wouldn't budge. I did get to a supervisor and she read from the same script (exact verbiage) as the first person I talked to. Supervisors used to have some leeway, like a small gift card for this type if issue, but apparently not any more. I guess Amazon is not interested in customer satisfaction like they used to be. I thought about reaching out the supplier, but decided it is not worth the effort for only $21.

review_title: Great value laptop 4-stars IN ITS CLASS
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2023
review_text: This review is for the Acer Aspire 5 A515-56 (8GB, i3-1115G4) edition. According to the box label, it was manufactured July of 2022. It came with BIOS version 1.28 installed which makes sense as that came out on 2022/05/27.  There are four newer BIOS versions with the latest being 1.34 published on 2023/05/12.  The BIOS does not have the ability to install .bin files directly.  You will have to update via Windows or a DOS booter/flasher utility.I have not booted Windows 11 at all.  I immediately installed my own 2.5" SSD (A 500GB Crucial MX500 that I had already) in the empty drive bay.  Some reviewers have said you are stuck with Windows 11.  This is completely false.  You will however have to disable Secureboot in the BIOS in order to boot off a USB installer before it will let you do anything but run Windows 11.  To do this, you must first set a password for Secureboot.  Then you can disable Secureboot. Then you may clear the password.  It's really not hard at all.I am running the latest Linux Mint XFCE edition, and I'm very pleased with the hardware compatibility.  Everything is working as it should.  Make sure you leave compositing enabled or you WILL get screen tearing when you watch videos.  I have not had any issues with slow speeds or disconnections with the Mediatek wifi.  I do recommend disabling power saving though for optimal performance. It will impact battery life, but odds are you want wifi on anyway, right?I haven't touched the built-in m.2 slot 128GB nvme drive other than to check its SMART stats for failure and hdparm to test speed. It looks like a fast little drive, but my plan is not to use it until I'm 100% sure this laptop will last.  If something goes wrong, I can remove my 2.5" drive and return it without any fuss, because the Windows OS has nothing on me.  For that reason, I won't try to update the BIOS anytime soon either.  Maybe in a year.The screen is adequate.  It's 60hz, 1080p, and bright enough not to be straining at full.  The trackpad is one of those painted styles with no buttons.  It doesn't track your fingertip very well at all which is annoying but it works.  The worst part is that there is a defined "middle click" zone between the left and right sides.  This drove me crazy because middle click defaults to CLOSING windows and tabs.  What a terrible default setting.  Fortunately it's easy to remap (in Linux anyway) so problem solved.The sound is pretty terrible but that's virtually all laptops.  I don't understand why the laptop market suffers so much from bad sound in the era of video viewing and music listening.  Who DOESN'T want great sound out of their laptop in this day and age? Headphones get annoying and don't work for 2 people watching something.  Fortunately, Linux lets you crank beyond 100% out of the box without installing extra EQ tools.  I find I can often go up to 125-150% without distortion or clipping.  You can also get boosted volume out of most decent media players.  No matter what you do though, you will not hear any bass.  Again it's terrible, but even $1000 gaming laptops are equally as lousy with built-in speakers.I paid $300 for this, and I'm happy with what I got.  The fact that it has 3 USB type A and an RJ45 means it's a real computer and not just another "mobile device".  I can attach my mechanical keyboard, my wireless mouse, and still have 1 free USB-A slot for a flash drive, external drive, or older smartphone.  The RJ45 means I can plug into a router if wifi isn't working or I need to configure network hardware directly.  An SD card reader might have been nice, but that's something I don't mind using a usb peripheral for.I really think at this price point nothing else compares.  The i3 has only two cores, so I feel the need to keep hyperthreading enabled.  If it was a quad or higher core, I'd disable hyperthreading as a hardening measure.I hope this review helps others make a decision.  If something goes wrong with this thing hardware wise, you can expect an update to this review within days. 👍

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2023
review_text: Estoy encantado con mi compra del Acer Aspire 5 A515-56-347N. Esta laptop ha superado todas mis expectativas y se ha convertido en una parte esencial de mi vida digital. Con un procesador Intel de 11ª generación i3-1115G4 y una SSD NVMe de 128GB, esta laptop es una máquina potente. Tareas que solían llevar tiempo, como la edición de fotos y la multitarea, ahora se realizan de manera suave y sin esfuerzo.  La pantalla Full HD IPS de 15.6 pulgadas es una delicia visual. Los colores son vibrantes y el ángulo de visión amplio hace que ver películas y trabajar en proyectos sea un placer. Además, Windows 11 Home en modo S ofrece una experiencia informática moderna y eficiente.  La conectividad WiFi 6 proporciona una conexión rápida y estable, ideal para mis videoconferencias y trabajos en línea. La inclusión de Amazon Alexa es un toque adicional de conveniencia; puedo controlar tareas domésticas con comandos de voz.  El diseño de la Acer Aspire 5 es elegante y moderno, y el color plateado le da un toque de sofisticación. La calidad de construcción es sólida y el teclado es cómodo para largas sesiones de escritura.  En resumen, esta laptop ha mejorado significativamente mi productividad y experiencia en línea. La recomendaría encarecidamente a cualquier persona que busque un dispositivo potente y eficiente. Es una inversión que vale la pena y estoy emocionado de ver a dónde me llevará en el futuro.

review_title: For the price and features can't beat this Laptop
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2023
review_text: Terrific display, sensitive touch pad and keyboard.  More ports than you would expect. Comes with 8 GB memory and 128 KB Nve solid state drive.  The small drive size is a result of the price point of this laptop.  However the laptop comes with some screws and a cable to install a second sata drive in an existing bay inside the laptop. Instructions for installing are on line, and are pretty easy. Remove several screws holding the bottom cover. Pry off cover, disconnect the battery cable, connect provided cable to hard drive, install sata drive with provided screws, connect other end of cable to connector on computer board. Reconnect battery Icable. Result for an extra $40.00, now have a 500GB internal Sata drive in addition to the 128 GB boot drive. I was a little concerned about the i3 processor having adequate power, however the machine boots up quickly, browsing fine with many tabs opened, so more than adequate for what I use it for. I don't do gaming. Also computer comes in its ow n box which is then put in a separate shipping box. Prime shipping in 2 days. Not a mark or ding even on the shipping box!

review_title: DO NOT buy NEW laptops or computers thru Amazon !!!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2023
review_text: I bought this for school and it's been a great laptop, for the 3 weeks I've had it (other than only having 1 HDMI connection, which I didn't know I'd need 2 for the extra monitors I also bought). I'm taking 15 credits in college and basically have homework 7 days a week. Today, I put it in sleep mode to take a break. When I came back, it was pulsating (video) for almost 20 minutes. It seemed to be fine after that, but I contacted Acer and they said there was a defect and it should be replaced. So, I contacted Amazon and they can only refund the money to get a new one...AFTER I send the laptop back to them! That would mean about a week that I would have no laptop to do homework on. They suggested talking to Acer - again - which I did. They said that sales thru Amazon don't connect to Acer, so Amazon is the only one that can refund/replace the laptop.I am not able to do my assignments on computers at the college, as they require specific programs that are not able to be installed on public computers. So, my only option is to keep a defective laptop and PRAY it doesn't die on me while I'm still in school for the next 3 months. NOT COOL AMAZON !!! I will NOT buy another laptop or computer from Amazon EVER again.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2024
review_text: Have never done a Chrome Book before but we wanted to have something for convenience around the house and for travel and shopped for quite a while to find the right combo of features at the right price. We're very happy a couple of months in with this while I wouldn't get it for anything but casual use...I don't know how we lived without it now! I come from Dos/Windows/Android systems and there was and is still a bit of adjustment needed and my guess is ios users would have more of an adjustment.We're very happy with the screen quality and the touch screen functions...just getting to scroll easily is a major plus. Makes a nice bridge between tablets and pc's and I have a real keyboard. The 12 hour battery means I don't even bring my adapter with me most places...and since it is usb C on the charger...I can use a cord on anything to top it up away from home or in the car. I wish the screen would do a full foldover so I could really use this as a tablet...but those seem quite a bit pricier. Streaming video and youtube with a decent connection is just fine but a gamer would want something more. My wife enjoys doing her email and pictures of family and the ease of use and uses this exclusively now.Obviously there are some high end Chrome books and some cheaper ones too...but we had modest demands and got them for a modest price and couldn't be happier with the choice.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2022
review_text: I bought this just to tide me over because my MacBook Pro’s keyboard broke. I bought a Chromebook about 5 years ago and they have definitely improved. This Chromebook is very good. Scrolling can sometimes be choppy. The screen is very good. Images are crisp. I don’t do formal testing but I did put it side by side against the HP Omen gaming laptop I bought a year before and they are quite comparable when watching HD videos from YouTube. It starts up quite fast which is expected. I used Microsoft 365 while I had this laptop and it’s probably the only negative for me. I’d rather have it installed.I am very happy with this product but I gave it to my father so he can have a new laptop. I bought another one that is more expensive (a proper laptop) and I’m more satisfied with this Chromebook. No issues here except: I don’t like that they say it’s 2022 when it’s manufactured in 2018 and the updates only last until 2027. Don’t get me wrong. I’d still have bought it because I don’t plan to use it past 2027 anyway.I may buy the 17” version of this Chromebook just to have it for watching videos and browsing. It’s not that much more compared to this version although the 17” one is not touchscreen.

review_title: Sent in for "repairs" right after receiving it.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
review_text: I purchased this item brand new and it wouldn't connect to the internet except as a guest.  I had to wait until the next morning for tech support to arrive to work.  They walked me through steps to try to reset it back to factory specs (???) which it got stuck at about the third step.  She told me they would send me labels for FedEx to pick it up, I told her I didn't have a printer, she said FedEx would have the QR label.  After two more phone calls, I found out I have to jump through hoops, find a FedEx onsite place, after waiting a day for the QR label to hit my e-mail, take it to an onsite location where they can use my email to print out the label and send the computer in for repairs.  Due to my health problems, none of this can happen.  I have to send my phone with someone else, to the next town over to the nearest FedEx onsite location, with my "NEW" CHROMEBOOK, to ship it back, wait for them to receive, fix it, return it to me, and hope it works.I have had two Chromebooks in the past and loved them both.  Unfortunately, I will never trust this machine now, and I will never buy another Chromebook.  Lost a lifelong customer over this one.  What happened to "We'll send you a new one?"  If you send out a faulty item, you don't ask the customer to jump through hoops so you can make repairs and send the same crappy item back to the customer!  You send them one that works in the first place!!Update:  I received my Chromebook on 11/29 (my sister received hers the same day, same problem).  I was able to get it shipped out on the 12/5 via FedEx using Acer's QR label in my Gmail.  It was supposed to be delivered on 12/8 but got hung up and wasn't returned to them until 12/11.  I received at email saying it was received and would take 7-10 BUSINESS days for a certified technician to look at the machine.  This is the worst customer service I have ever seen.  Buyer Beware!

review_title: before buying read the Chrome Auto Update Policy
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2023
review_text: My third Chromebook. This one's the best of course. Before you buy a Chromebook you have to read the Chrome Auto Update Policy. It's online. Look up the model number to learn how long it will receive updates. My previous CB was new, but it was still less than 2 years from the end of updates. After updates ended I had more problems and after about a year, my bank told me my version of Chrome wasn't good enough for their security requirements. The short life CB is often cheaper. If you don't need the latest security it may be fine. This one has 6 years of updates to come.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2023
review_text: This is my wife's 'daily driver' laptop outside of work. As you might expect, its main functions are web-based. That is, what many of us are doing now and this laptop excels at this.Pros:Long batter life - this machine  has a much longer battery life than my macbook air.Decent Screen - large touchscreen that lets you pinch-and-zoom, scroll, etcGood build quality - It is plastic, but after almost 8 months no incidentsPlenty of horsepower for most tasks - no hiccups on web-videos, email, web surfing, and light computing tasksPrice - this thing is a great deal.Cons:While the keyboard is decent, it does not have a backlit keyboardThat's about it for the cons! If you are looking to do video editing or cutting edge gaming, this is not the machine for you. However, if you are looking for a laptop with a decently sized screen and long battery life to do emails, word processing, and web-surfing, this is a great choice to do it economically.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2023
review_text: I ordered this without even thinking about operating system, I just assumed it was Windows bc every Acer I have ever purchased is Windows. No, it's Chromebook, which I didn't really mind until IN came across these 2 stupid, stupid changes. So they thought it was a good move to get rid of the caps lock button, where it has been sitting cozy for 30+ years for all of us to use, they replaced it with a "search" button. So now, instead of gracefully typing away, quickly pressing and depressing the caps locks, very quickly, now instead I have the option to even quicker than before to get to a search bar. And even worse, despite having a normal size touchpad, rather than being able to quickly and flawlessly press the bottom right of it to "right click", the option is completely void, and in order to right click, you must use two fingers, which you don't get timed right most of the time. review_title: Incredibly Slow - Used Laptops Are Faster
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2022
review_text: Pros:- Battery life is fantastic. I easily get 10 hours of use- Touchscreen works well, and the lid is sturdy enough to handle touching the screen- Touchpad is comfortable- Webcam is fineCons:- Incredibly slowIt was lightning fast at first, and I was very happy. But after it updated to ChromeOS 100+, it has since become frustratingly slow and laggy. YouTube and Twitch streams stutter, and videos often freeze while audio continues. Takes about 15-20 seconds to straighten out then it's smooth from there on.  Powerwashed three times, uninstalled all non-standard apps. Hasn't helped. Mouse began stuttering with ChromeOS 107.- TouchpadThe cursor will at one point be way too slow and sluggish or stutter, and other times fly across the screen because it's too fast. Almost like it's trying to catch up.- KeyboardIt has a texture that reminds me of 100 grit sandpaper. I don't care for it.Overall:Battery life comes at the cost of performance. If you're like me and can't stand laggy machines, skip this one. I blame ChromeOS, not the hardware itself. (However: others have been happy with their purchase, so perhaps mine is just faulty.)

review_title: Something's Wrong, But Which Problem Do I Prioritize?
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2023
review_text: I charged it fully, then set is aside.  When I returned days later, the battery was dead, so I plugged in the charger as normal. I called Acer, and ACER TRANSFERRED ME TO A VOICEMAIL THAT IS FULL AND NOT ACCEPTING MESSAGES.I called Amazon again.  They said they can't send a replacement, so I'd need to return for refund.I decided to text Acer customer service.  They are having me to a power wash on this new chromebook to see if that fixes it.  The power wash fixed the charger issue.Now the problem is the touchscreen is not sensitive like an iPad.  I sometimes have to hold the screen with one hand and use the index finger of the other hand to touch the screen several times for it to take on input.  This will not work for my application.  The device will need to be returned for a refund if this can't be fixed.  So I'm texting Acer again.  They say they can offer a repair services, but I'm thinking that since the device is brand new, this is how all Acer Chromebooks behave.

review_text: We were very happy with this laptop for the first three months. Things went smoothly until they didn't. One day I went to turn it on, and nothing happened. review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2022
review_text: I bought this to replace my old Dell Chromebook my daughter dropped and broke and I wish I bought this one in the first place. My school claim I wouldn't be able to use Chromebook for my LockDown Browser test. Maybe in older version but this one it works like a charm. Love Love Love this computer

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2022
review_text: Video Player is loading.Play VideoPlayMuteCurrent Time 0:00/Duration 0:00Loaded: 0%Stream Type LIVESeek to live, currently behind liveLIVERemaining Time -0:00 1xPlayback RateChaptersChaptersDescriptionsdescriptions off, selectedCaptionscaptions off, selectedAudio TrackFullscreenThis is a modal window.I bought this laptop on June 9, 2022, and this review is being made today (July 10th) so I can give a good enough review of this product after some time using it.I bought this laptop for the soul purpose of needing it specifically for college, I wanted a laptop that isn’t so expensive. I wanted a laptop that looks nice, that is good quality, but not enough to viciously eat up a huge chunk out of my money. I want to spend only what’s necessary, and luckily I found this laptop. I read the positive reviews which made me feel motivated, yet made me nervous at the same time when seeing the negatives.✅Honestly I’m glad I ignored them because this laptop is good, it works perfectly fine. The touch screen is very convenient when writing my essays, short stories, or when I’m doing my math assignments/exams online, and when I’m watching YouTube/Netflix in my spare time. I’ve had a much smaller laptop previously, so it was weird for me when typing on this laptop because it’s bigger than my old one, but thankfully I’ve adapted eventually. The sound/speaker is good, I can hear it loud and clear. The face cam is good, I use it for my zoom classes and it works great. No complaints as of yet. Also the charger that comes with it is completely new, clean, and functional—I don’t know if it’s just me? But the first time I used the charger? It got hot, like really hot when I first used it. It was only that first time and then it never happened again after some uses. I often forget to unplug the charger when I’m not using it but it never was hot when left in that state—but regardless I put it away as soon as when I don’t need it, don’t want it to blow up or something. The battery life is amazing, it last the whole day and I only charge it before bed since it charges up really quickly, so it’s not necessary to leave it plugged all night till ya wake up. Hell you can even charge it the next morning and you’ll be fine. Also there’s two sides where you can charge your laptop both left and right, along with it has an extra volume buttons on one side. The power button has a light that’ll blink softly on and off when you haven’t turned it off completely to let ya know that it’s still on. Overall I don’t have any complaints about the laptop, it’s the best laptop I’ve had.⚠️Though I must remind you that the keys do not light up, so you’re going to have to have a light near by, unless you already have the keys memorize then you’re fine. I don’t mind using a light, after-all I’ll be using this laptop a lot for a while—I’ll probably won’t need the light near me by that point. Don’t place too much pressure on the touch screen it’s not necessary, or else you’ll damage it. Screen quality is great, I have anything negative to say about it…just that it’s too bright? Wish it had a dark mode.⚠️I must give ya a heads up that the laptop could break for the screen side of the laptop itself, with enough heavy pressure or impact it could damage the screen. It’s pretty bendable if you put enough force on it—but why would anyone in their right mind do something like that?? If anything, everyone knows ya have be really careful not to drop it, place anything too heavy on the laptop, or bending the screen. Be aware of the backpacks with laptop pockets, most of them do not have padding on the bottom, or enough of it, and it can damage the laptop if being too careless. To be honest all laptops can get damaged if not being too careful. So just care for it when taking it outside of your home. Again I wish it had dark mode, but that’s just my only complaint, or more like me nitpicking…but other than that it’s a good product.In conclusion, it’s works great for school, Listening to music on it, for watching movies, and is overall good quality. It’s not so expensive, and it worth buying this laptop. I will update this further on in the future if there’s anything negative or positive to add, and I’ll even add a video later, so you can see the laptop before making your purchase 👍.Hope this helped you make up your choice whether or not to buy this laptop, good luck!🍀👍UPDATE:11/21/22It’s has dark mode now, and so far the laptop is still working perfectly well! I have no problem with the touch screen, the battery life is still amazing, and I have no lagging/glitchy problems at all so far. Again this is a APP based kind of laptop, so there might be other programs you use that might not work on this laptop. My review is still the same, I like this product, and for it’s price! Also I added a video review too! Happy thanksgiving 🍁UPDATE: 06/13/2023Still no complaints! My laptop still functional! ^^

review_title: Great quality laptop even for the price
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2024
review_text: Bought this as a Christmas gift and honestly one of the best laptops I’ve come across. Very cool versatility and fast processor.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2022
review_text: I  purchased  this  refurbished  laptop a few weeks  ago. I purchased it mostly for my  catering  business. I have a desktop computer. I can be on a computer for hours  handling business and sometimes I don't want to sit on at my desk at my desktop computer.  Having this laptop lets  me sit in bed and handle everything for my business with ease. You can  handle a lot because you can have multiple tabs open at once.  It's works with Goggle only not Microsoft. Which, is fine with me because my business documents  are in  Google docs. I prefer Google anyway. It is lighting fast with my Wifi. I like that I can download apps directly  from the Google play store. It even has a camera so I am able to do a Zoom meeting from it.  The touch screen feature is great and the touch pad  feature works well.  You can choose to enter a pin instead of a password when you first turn on the computer or to wake it from sleep mode. It does not have a fingerprint scanner. It's a nice blue color as well. The keyboard does not light up. That's not too big of a draw back for me. The speakers on it are okay I'm not expecting much sound from a laptop speaker. The battery life is freaking amazing it has a 12 hour battery life. It even tells you the battery percentage and how much time you have left before it needs to be charged like a cell phone. I have gone days without charging it and it hardly lost any battery power.  It even has blue tooth, headphone jack, and a 1 hdmi port.  You can flip the screen to use it as monitor  or flip it all the way back  to use a tablet. It does not have caps button. The caps button was replaced with a search  button. When you press the  search button. You can for  look for anything quickly. It can be something on Google,  on you laptop, apps, anything. Just  press or hold down the shift  button for caps. The screen does not detach from the keyboard.  Guess what I'm using to write this review?!  For whatever reason you need a laptop. GET THIS ONE NOWWWWWWWWWW!!!!  Did I mention I purchased this laptop refurbished. But it works like NEW.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2023
review_text: It always scares me when I purchase something renewed or refurbished, however this laptop hasn't failed me during my years at university. Two years later and it boots up as fast as when I first bought it! AND it's affordable which definitely helps a struggling student like me.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2023
review_text: Awesome computer for my needs.  Been using it for about a month or more.  Battery is great!  Only complaint I have is with the screen viewing angle.  Its limited as to which angle you can see the screen.  You almost have to be directly in front of it to see it perfectly bright and clear.  Not directly but almost.  Computer is very light for a 14 inch laptop, and its yoga style makes it easy to carry around.  Its like having a king size tablet for quick demonstrations, graphs and videos.  Before this I mainly used a 10 inch tablet for those business needs so having this was a huge upgrade for me.  I use it as both a tablet and a laptop.  I use it almost everywhere I go for my computing needs.  Lighter than your typical laptop which is great.Power: I run a web based business and so far so good.  It runs all the programs such as wix, dispatching software and google documents.  For my needs it is fast enough.  I go on roblox to spend time with daughter with word games and other games on the site and it runs fine for that but lags on some of the more advanced gaming.  I'm not a gamer but I do have a business and this works just perfect for my needs.

review_title: You get what you pay for
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2024
review_text: From a longtime Chromebook user, here' my review. I've always used the higher end Chromebooks, and become spoiled with how easily they can replace traditional laptops.  This was my first foray into the budget models (I got it refurbished for $180) and I really got what I paid for.  The processing speed is too slow to help you forget traditional laptops.  It is a perfectly good couch computer.  You know, the one you leave plugged in on the couch and use to scroll social media an e-mail while watching equally mindless television.  If you need to use this for any form of work, I highly recommend dropping a few dollars more on something that isn't powered by a 1980's graphing calculator processor.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2023
review_text: We bought this Chromebook for our child to play Roblox with their cousins, watch shows, and other play other games. When it works it works, however it also crashes a lot. The picture is nice, the touchscreen can be sensitive or nonresponsive other times, and battery is great. Only half the memory has been used, is scanned regularly for viruses, and everything is updated but it will crash over and over whenever our child tries to watch shows on Netflix, or play their games which is frustrating. If you're looking for something to type up a paper or stream YouTube it will work but be prepared for crashing after a few months of use. We plan on getting a different Chromebook later for our kid but this one was ok for the few months we've owned it. In hindsight it's worth investing in something better to save yourself the headaches.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2022
review_text: While this refurbished computer worked for about a month, it has now become a paperweight and a total waste of my money. I should not have bought a refurbished computer, I see that now. One, after a month the keyboard wouldn't work and we could only use the touch screen. I asked for a refund and they insisted that they work through the problem rather than give me my money back. It was back and forth and they wanted me to call them, not supply me with a replacement or give me my money back without a struggle. Since my son needs the computer for his online school, I opted to keep the screen at a certain angle so that the malfunctioning keyboard would work some of the time. Then the screen turned a grayish color and all the display was distorted. I power washed (as it factory reset) the computer, but it is a hardware issue and the local computer repair shop said it was not worth it to repair. It's too late for a refund and I'm not pleased with the fact they wouldn't refund me my money when I asked. So, I went to a brick-and-mortar store and bought a new computer where I can return the product if it doesn't work properly. I'm disappointed and frustrated with the whole mess. I will never buy a refurbished computer again and won't work with this company again.

review_title: Great product for the money, but need to make sure it's been "renewed"
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2024
review_text: Physically, the laptop I received looks brand new, with some slight wear around the USB-C port that's hardly worth mentioning. The screen was scratch free, and no perceptible wear on the keys or touchpad. The power supply was obviously used, and even came with a sample of the previous owners hair (gross!). Battery life has been great. After the initial charge, I've been running (mostly idle) for over two weeks and battery life is just under half. All in all, I'm very happy with the condition of the laptop.Now for the bad. The laptop had not been "renewed." It booted up to a login screen for the previous owner's domain (BP Oil). There was no way for me to directly login. I had to log into the BIOS and force it to boot from USB so I could access it. After getting in, I could see that the previous owner's files were still there. I reformatted the drive and loaded a fresh copy of Windows 10 and I'm able to use it as I need to now, but this would be a deal breaker for most people. The former owner (BP Oil) and their vendor (TekRefurbs.com ) broke every rule in the cybersecurity rulebook on this one. They need to do a better job at protecting their assets.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2024
review_text: The media could not be loaded.                What was a 1☆, and went 3☆, and back to 0☆!  The previous users, Athenahealth IT Dept or support agency DID NOT reset the laptop rendering it useless.  It started out with a battery issue that Amazon support help. Yet the laptop wouldn't boot to Windows login.  Amazon support couldn't assist with this and Dell wanted $99 out-of-warranty fee. P.S. I even downloaded an OS recovery USB and it didn't work!UPDATE! It's now a solid 3 🌟  I was able to get the unit to accept the USB recovery from DELL's website. My other concern is I was promised by Amazon Tech Support that I would receive a partial refund or special credit for my inconvenience and that they could not assist me in resolving my issue. As of today I have not seen it on my account!

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2022
review_text: I received the laptop in time for my wife's Christmas present and was very happy until I discovered it didn't have wifi..  You will have to connect your internet with an ethernet cable.. Before my purchase I read the questions and reviews where someone said it DID have wifi but I can tell u first hand that IT DOES NOT have wireless internet..  Right time I turned it on for the 1st time, it asked me to plug up my ethernet cable to connect my internet..  I also tried in the setting to hook up to my wireless internet and wireless was not even an option..  Don't get me wrong, It looked great with only 2 very small scratches on the side and it was just like opening a brand new computer when i started it up..  Next, the mouse also didn't work when I tried to scroll down and I'm sure it was like that from the old user but everything else worked..  It's not a bad buy but Remember, You Are Buying A Refurbished Laptop not a new one..  I'm sending it back and already just went ahead and ordered a new one since I have it extra money right now and since it's a Christmas present..  Thanks for reading and I need to start writing more reviews because I always try to read them..  Merry Christmas Yall!!👍

review_text: I found malware in the OS (to include a trojan.) Worse, I found a Scheduled Task link to connect out of country at 1am every morning if the machine is asleep. If you buy the Amazon warranty, and are prepared to dump and reinstall the OS, then you should be okay buying this computer from THIS refurbisher. Note: be sure to get the software key from the OS before you delete it, as it's not on the computer.

They provided a phone number on the box which I called 4 times and never received a call back. Windows 11 Home would not activate. That was the reason why I was trying to contact the seller. I did not hear from them so I called HP. HP stated the reason Windows would not activate was that the seller did not use Genuine HP parts when they upgraded the laptop which flagged the system. It also voided the manufacturer's warranty on those specific parts. HP helped me solve the problem since they have 24/7 service,  and this was a Friday evening. I received instructions from the seller the following week on how to fix the problem which I had already corrected with HP's help. Seller warrants the whole machine for 1 year, but my question is how does one get service if they cannot contact the seller easily I am not happy with the seller due to the inability to be able to reach them easily.

review_text: I needed a new computer and my boss suggested I look for refurbished Mac’s since he had great reviews about his personal device. review_title: Run far away from this company!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2024
review_text: I don't usually leave reviews, but I feel I owe it to society to warn the masses. Shortly after the two week return window closed, this computer started to fall apart.  Here is a list of what went wrong: the keyboard keys stick-including spacebar and entire bottom row; the computer wont hold a charge; computer won't turn on at random; it overheats constantly, even when not in use and closed; overheating slows system down; screen cuts out or glitches, goes black randomly and flickers; crashes for no reason;  won't accept a charge from the power adapter it came with; computer remains dead  often while plugged in; the fan is always running (loudly)  gets hot even when not open or on; restarts when closed; and last but not least the tap pad doesn't respond.  In a customer service chat with Amazon, I was told that if the third party seller did nothing, Amazon would assume responsibility. Of course, the third party seller did nothing, and Amazon changed their mind and said they too would do nothing.  The computer was a gift for my daughter for college, cost $550, and is now just an expensive piece of clutter for her dorm room.  So disappointed.  I'm very shocked by Amazon's shabby customer service.  I expected better.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2024
review_text: So I bought this laptop in 2020 originally, and it was perfect until I broke it (which was entirely my own fault lol, nothing wrong with the laptop itself). Luckily I managed to find this listing again and got another this year, and it's just as great as the first!! The screen is bright and has no scratches or anything, the keys all work, it came with a working charger too. It has a sliiiight dent near one of the front corners on the outside, but honestly you can't even tell unless you're actively feeling it out!Super great deal for a broke student trying to get an actual laptop that will work for more than a semester or two! I don't particularly care about having "new" apple products though, to be fair. Lol.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2024
review_text: The actual laptop is in great condition, works beautifully, etc. so I give five stars to the seller. Apple I would give 2.5 stars to on this one.What I didn't realize is that Apple totally screwed up their product by skimping on the camera. Apparently it's a production choice from 2018 to at least 2020. My 2015 MacBook has a beautiful, clear, crisp image but this one is super dark and grainy, regardless of my lighting or how clean my camera lens is. I am a telehealth provider so my life revolves around zoom calls. Despite really liking the laptop itself, I am considering returning the product and getting something that better meets my needs :/ 2 stars for Apple

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2024
review_text: I selected the "acceptable" condition because I'm just a student who needed a small laptop to carry to class. After seeing some reviews about their laptops being damaged (possibly occurring during transport) I still took the chance -- and I'm certainly thankful that I did! The only damage I've noticed is a small scratch on the side/corner of the laptop (on a profile that I don't frequently check), a smear on the screen that I am unable to wipe off, and damage to a few of the letters on the keyboard. The laptop didn't arrive the cleanest, but I was able to clean it off myself. I recommend this for students or individuals on a budget. Please keep in mind that you will need to update the software quite a bit, before the macbook is able to support certain downloads such as Microsoft Word.

review_title: Item works well, but its condition was incorrectly described as “excellent.”
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2024
review_text: Overall, I’m happy with the item. What I’m not happy about is that the condition was incorrectly described as “excellent.” When I think of something being described as “excellent” condition, I think of something with no noticeable imperfections. This unit has several nicks on the edge of the clamshell. A more accurate description of the condition would have been “good with some signs of normal wear.”As for the unit’s performance, I have no complaints. The keyboard sucks, but that’s not the seller’s fault; Apple’s decision to use the butterfly keyboard is the culprit here.Had the seller described the condition accurately, I would have known what to expect and my rating would reflect that.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2024

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2024
review_text: This laptop came in brand-new. I will always buy used going forward.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2023
review_text: So, I did not necessarily have amazing expectations for this, but it works fine for school. Price was very good considering the product, which can go for like $1000 brand new. Here's my ratings for different categories:Battery:Well, this category really is not great. The battery life is not good at all. It drains very quickly and takes a long time to fill up.A 100% charge might last 1 - 2 hours of continuous, non-heavy use.It takes around 3 hours to fill from 0% to 100%. So... better off using it as a desktop than a laptop.Keyboard:It's a keyboard. It works as a keyboard. Not a ton to say. The only negative about this is that there is a weird white splotch on the S and D keys that is ingrained into the keys itself. It will not come off with rubbing alcohol and seems to be stuck in there.Heat:This thing gets QUITE hot while charging and using. Not to mention the fans are pretty loud for lightweight use like browsing the internet and using Microsoft word.Screen:The screen came pretty flawless and works great, no complaints.Lag/Usability:Okay, this is really disappointing. The main reason I got a mac was to replace the incredibly slow school Chromebook I was issued. For a 600, almost 700 dollar computer, this is pretty laggy and slow. It can be incredibly frustrating at times.Scratches:A few minor scratches on the bottom, not very noticeable. Perfectly fine.Would I recommend it?If you have low expectations, sure. If you want the high-quality experience that you might be used to on Windows laptops or your iPhone, you will not get that with this product. I would not recommend this to friends or purchase it again. I do not believe this is necessarily the sellers fault, but I will say if you want a refurbished mac book I would likely go with a recent macbook pro model if given the chance to purchase again. DEFINITELY get the asurion protection plan recommended to you by amazon, 70 bucks for 2 years is very good and quite a nice safeguard.Overall, 3.5 stars. Seller was prompt with shipping, and did a good job for the value. My grievance is more with the laptop itself than the seller.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2022
review_text: I bought this Macbook about a month ago maybe more. When it was delivered I received it in an aftermarket box, not an apple box which is cool it is renewed I have to say I have seen a lot of renewed devices and I have never been impressed by them but when I opened the box to my Macbook I was stunned great packaging then once out of the sturdy bubble wrap it was in I was stunned again pristine remarkable I would have thought I bought a brand new Macbook Air. Not a scratch or ding insight screen is again remarkable. Set up was easy the touch ID works fast I mean like I said I feel like a bought a brand new MacBook Air. It's fast and updates fast. Charging holds for a long period of time I have gone 2 days without charging and I use it daily off and on during the day when not busy. The charger is also not an aftermarket charger it's an apple charger. Worth every penny highly recommend it. I have no complaints also know I am a student and it has held well in the storage area for all my note-taking no issues there as well if you are a student looking for a MacBook for note-taking and online classes as well this is perfect for you.

review_text: This is my first MacBook (never bought due to the price), but after looking at subpar Window computers and tablets of similar price point, I decided to go with this refurbished MacBook just to switch things up. The only thing was a sticker on the bottom with the product code and a green sticker. Other than that, I don't see any indication that this MacBook was not new. It came partially charged and ready to use, and I was able to set it up in minutes. I updated the OS which took a while, but after that the laptop runs and works just fine. Sometimes I notice a bit of lag, but with 8GB ram and me running multiple windows/tabs to do my work, that is to be expected.Overall I am really satisfied with this purchase and I'm glad I can call myself a MacBook owner finally without spending thousands of dollars

review_text: I wrote earlier stating some of the issues I had with my laptop. To make a long story short the laptop did come to me dead which was a slight hindrance. Long story short I read somewhere to flip the laptop over and hit where the space key should be at  on the back of the laptop. I did it three times (not too hard of course) and it worked. It was slightly annoying due to the fact I just got my laptop yesterday and I had these issues. However, overall it was worth it. The laptop itself is very stunning and like I said in good condition. I have heard that this keyboard from the 2019 MacBook Air had its issues. However, I do know Apple offers a free service to fix these keyboards which is nice. Overall, it was an okay product.

review_title: Restarted by itself three time in a row, which drove me crazy!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2024
review_text: I have been hesitant to buy refurbished electric devices, especially things like computers which will store important personal data. However, I decided to give it a shot this time. Turns out I made a mistake. There are some obvious cosmetic defects in appearance, which is not out of expectation given the fact that this is not a new one. What is not acceptable and makes me decide to return it is that when I was transferring the data from my old IMac to it, it restarted all of a sudden with the screen showing something like "the computer needs to restart because of a problem." So I had to start over everything. The same situation happened again and again afterwards, which drove me crazy. It was just three days after I received it. What would happen after I keep it and use it for six months, one year, or two years? Money is one thing, but what if it totally collapses and the personal files stored in it can't be retrievable?  So the best option for me is to return it before anything worse happens. I will not make the same mistake again.

review_title: It worked great for 5 months and then….
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2023
review_text: I ordered the 2019 MacBook Air as a Christmas gift for my 11 year old Niece.  It arrived on December 17, 2022, it is absolutely beautiful (rose gold) perfect size and it performed well.  Until this month, May 2023.  It auto shuts off and then goes to black.  We are utterly disappointed.  I now have to get it serviced at an Apple Store as they are running a diagnostic test on the Mac to determine the prognosis.  I now have to pay  40% of what I purchased it for to get it repaired.  Highly disappointed.  So purchase at your own risk.

review_title: Terrible!  Not Amazon Seller!  Do NOT buy!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2021
review_text: I bought this computer last week.  I was happily surprised when it arrived the next day (early).  When I took it out of the box, it looked perfect.  That is where the good things ended.The battery was not fully charged, but that was ok.  I plugged it in, but it did not charge while I was working on it.  When I removed the charger, the battery icon said that the charger was still plugged in (it was not).  I tried charging while the laptop was closed.  No dice.  The battery charging icon never went away, no matter if the charging cord was plugged in or not.Then one time I went to open the screen, and the entire screen was filled with horizontal lines. Mind you, I had only had the laptop for two days and had been on it for an extremely minimal amount of time.I immediately  contacted the seller, Who I assumed was Amazon, but it turned out it was a third-party seller. The seller told me that I should take the computer to a computer repair shop and have it assessed and then send them the report. I informed the seller that by live in a rural area and an extremely far away from any type of shop like that. In addition to that, the seller wanted me to take pictures of every angle of the computer and send them to her.I then requested to just have a replacement computer sent to me since I just received this last week. The seller informed me that they do not do this, and told me that I could return the computer for a refund, but I would have to again send them pictures.I’m extremely frustrated by this entirely process.  I received a defective product and the seller should step up and try to make it right instead of putting all of the burden on me.  I would definitely not recommend to anyone and would NEVER, EVER buy from this seller.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2023
review_text: I went in very optimistic feeling like I had found a great deal on this Macbook Air. I have owned many Apple refurbished products in the past and have always had had a great experience. I will mentioned, that all of those refurbished product where purchased on the Apple site and not Amazon. My previous Macbook Air is from 2010 and it was also refurbished at the time of purchase and it's still kicking to this day. I wanted to update my tools as I am an Interior Designer and am in constant in person meeting with clients. Today was such an embarrassing day thanks to my new Macbook Air. I received this computer a few days ago, I downloaded that latest IOS and synced it with my iCloud. I started to notice that every time the computer sat idle it would completely shut down and after booting up every app and document would be erased. This happened several times and after messing around with some settings it seemed to be ok. Well today it happen again during a client meeting and my computer shut down in the middle of a presentation and tried to reboot 7 times. Mind you, the computer was fully charged and operating very simple task, a PDF file.That is all to say that this will get returned ASAP. I thought I was getting a great deal on this computer but I guess I will have to keep purchasing from Apple directly.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2021
review_text: First off, ignore the smudges. That’s all me. My MacBook came in just about PERFECT condition. Literally the only thing wrong with it was the screen had a very small scratch on the far left end that I didn’t notice until day 2 of having it (which is to be expected, it’s RENEWED) but everything else was perfect. Biggest hesitation with getting the i5 Air was hearing about the loud fan and overheating. I don’t do any heavy video editing or gaming on it (and if you do, you should be getting a pro anyway), but I do have a lot of zoom meeting throughout the week and do a lot of streaming and the only time the fan ever had to turn on was during an update. I’ve never had a problem with overheating. 10/10 would highly recommend if you’re ballin’ on a budget and need a new MacBook. I wouldn’t let the bad reviews scare you. They have a 90 satisfaction return policy, so if yours does end up having problems, just RETURN IT.

review_text: Very impressed with the condition of this device!  There were NO scratches or issues with the screen, case, or keyboard.  The whole thing looks brand new.  LOVE the fingerprint login. There is a charger included and it works perfectly.  I would recommend this one to anyone looking for a solid but reasonably priced computer.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2022
review_text: I got this Chromebook to replace my last Samsung 11"  Chromebook which I had for about 3.5 years.The Acer spin 11 was pretty good and I liked it alot. The keyboard worked much better than my Samsung.That thing has a mind of it's own, I think. You type one word and the Chromebook types up something else..Expect for this one small problem and it started just after a month or so after I had purchased this.Once awhile it wouldn't turn back on after I had idling for whatever time it took to be in power saving mode butIt wouldn't turn back on, everytime when this happens I have to press the side power button for about ten seconds to turn it off first then, I'd give it a minute before hitting the same power button again. I hold it just long enough to see the blue light goes on next to power button you just pressed. Oh just out of curiosity, what does the power button do located right top corner? Cause it won't shut the computer off or on. No matter how long you hold the button down. Anyway back to main issue, just awhile I left the Chromebook to visit UPS store and came back, tried to reboot my Chromebook as usual but this time it won't turn on. I tried unplug & replug all the cables like power, HDMI. Man I only had this for about 4-5 months and this happens. My warranty expired as well.... I'm very disappointed.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2023
review_text: I genuinely don’t think I have any complaints about this product. Prior to buying this computer, I was very against buying a touch screen computer because there seemed to be too many cons and not enough pros, such as a hyper sensitive screen and a battery that dies faster. This is not the case whatsoever with this laptop. I’m now a college student, but I’ve used the computer since Senior year of high school and it’s worked amazingly for getting homework done. I also love the 360 rotation, which allows me to turn the computer into an tablet as well as display any work very effectively. The only thing is, if you are looking to play games alongside doing your work, this may not be the laptop for you, as gaming runs incredibly slow. With that, it is a Chromebook, so all accessories and app stores are associated with Google, and you may not be able to access some apple or Samsung only apps from this computer, though this hasn’t seemed to be an issue for me. Beyond that, I swear by this computer. Also, the battery life is great. Often times I watch shows in school, and I’ve never had an issue with it dying on my prematurely. In fact, the battery life lasts a full days use, and I charge it over night. Definitely recommend if you’re looking for a computer for schooling.

review_title: GREAT upgrade from tablet for my kids, first Chromebook
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2022
review_text: I did a lot of research as to what to get for my kids to replace their aging and damaged Samsung Tab A's. We decided that it was time to go to a Chromebook so that they could get more repetition with a standard keyboard and GoogleOS. They are still able to download all the PlayStore apps that they had on their tablets, but now with better hardware and longer support.This model has 64GB of storage (with SD card option), so thats a huge upgrade. The RAM is 4GB, which is more than most cheap tablets these days, and you can tell. Its a LOT snappier than the Galaxys.The 2in1 flip with the screen is my kids favorite part! They can use it like a "real computer" and then flip it to make a huge tablet screen instead. Much bigger than the 8" screen they had before.For an entry level chromebook, these are sturdy, snappy, and cheap! I dare you to find something better for preteens at this price point!NOTE: some of the reviews here complain about the speaker quality/power. This was one of the only things I was weary about when I finally committed to this unit. Those reviews are DEAD WRONG. The speakers are GREAT on these Chromebooks. The quality is clear, and they are louder than both of my other laptops and tablets. Playing videos through YouTube at 1/2 volume is much louder than the max of my other units. Don't let the "terrible speaker" reviews sway you.

review_title: Excellent lightweight, reasonably priced Chromebook, but not a good substitute for an iPad
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2022
review_text: Assessment after six months: This is an excellent low priced Chromebook overall, with fine screen quality and light weight. Set up was easy as is true of most Chromebooks. I purchased it to replace an older iPad, which I liked but was slow, and lacked connectivity and available keyboards. This Chromebook has two USB-C ports and two standard USB ports.  The keyboard is first rate and the track pad is good enough that I don't need a mouse. Accessing files on a USB key is easy enough on a Chromebook but impossible on an iPad. I have encountered only two significant drawbacks. The first is a touchscreen that is slightly  inferior to the iPad. Those of us who are new to the Chromebook need to realize that it is a hybrid: in some respects it resembles an iPad and in others a PC, with advantages and disadvantages compared to either one.  This particular Chromebook is not appreciably faster than my six year old iPad.Google Play for the Chromebook is inferior to the Apple App Store in terms of available apps but apps are generally easier to install than with a PC. In many cases you have the choice of accessing a website through an app or via Chrome. If you are used to using airline apps on your iPad or android smartphone you will find that they either aren't available (American, Southwest) or are available only in the reduced size smartphone version (United, Delta). This should not prevent you from accessing the airline's entertainment system through Chrome but I find that a bit less convenient. I find using Word documents on the Chromebooks inconvenient since you cannot download and run Microsoft Office, although the online version can be utilized. At best if you are a serious Word user you will find the Chromebook workarounds lacking in convenience.  Editing .docx documents is easy enough with google and experienced users probably have methods that I haven't yet figured out.  I  considered purchasing a basic iPad 2021 (9th version) with a keypad, but the cost is twice that of this Chromebook, which has a larger (11 inch) screen is larger than the iPad and not much heavier than an iPad with a keyboard case.I purchased the Chromebook as a substitute for an iPad (lower price, larger screen) but after six months the disadvantages for me outweigh the advantages. Using Word (or PowerPoint) on the iPad is pretty much seamless as long as you keep your files on the cloud; on the Chromebook it awkward unless you want to use Google drive more or less exclusively. Another disadvantage, although manageable, is browsing the news or other daily feeds. As with your office computer you can access the source's web address but the handy apps that are available for the iPad or a smartphone frequently are not available at all or do not work properly on the Chromebook. MS Outlook does work well and the larger screen in a benefit for reading some messages. The ability to link your phone message system with the Chromebook is a significant plus; it is possible to do this on the iPad but it is awkward because of the lack of an app for some messaging platforms. The Chrome operating system is a generally well designed one once you get to know it but it pales in comparison with IOS. If I had it to do over I would purchase a low end PC even at about twice the cost.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2023
review_text: I bought this to take with me on my trips rather than my heavier, more expensive laptop.  Up until today, I was really happy with it.  Today, I was testing the ability to connect with this device to the ASUS router at my house so I could upload pictures from my travels directly to my network.  The app, AICloud, works fine on my phone and other chromebook devices but, for some reason, my Acer Chromebook won't upload files.  It will let me access my USB drive and download files but attempts to upload fail every time.  I spent some time with Asus trying to identify the issue but since it works with other devices, they suggested it was an Acer issue, which seems pretty reasonable based on my 20+ years in the IT industry.Acer's first tier tech couldn't help beyond saying to call Asus, which is what I'd expect from Tier 1 support.  Once I persuaded them to pass me up the ladder, the tier 2 tech listened very attentively before saying this wasn't their problem and he was unable, or unwilling, to try to work with me on a solution.  In effect, the Acer team makes devices that are not compatible with apps obtained from the Google Play Store so, as the saying goes, "Caveat Emptor".For the record, I didn't rate Gaming because I don't play games on this device.  Maybe I should since it can't do really technical chores.

review_title: DO NOT BUY - didn't even last two months!

review_text: Learn from our mistake and don't waste your money! We purchased this product in mid-December. Not even two months later, it completely died -- wouldn't boot up, wouldn't charge. We sent it back to Acer for repair, since it was under warranty. They had to replace the motherboard. They sent it back, and it worked...for four hours. Then died again. Acer now wants us to send it back again for another repair and refuse to issue another device or a credit. We'll see what Amazon might be willing to do, but in the meantime -- please do yourself a favor and don't buy an Acer.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2023
review_text: Received the lap too sooner than expected. Packaging was neat and safely secured. I was more so impressed with the physical condition of the laptop as I’ve seen and heard of many horror stories from others who have order refurbished MacBooks throughout. I received a clean and truly refurbished MacBook as described. There was only one minor imperfection which was a small scratch on the bottom that is hardly noticeable. Also some very fine and minor rough edges that is only noticeable if you were to look at it up close but that is expected with used product. The MacBook also came with a new charger. The battery life appears to be in normal condition and no issues so far. Keyboard, touchpad, touch bar, and screen functions work just fine, no issues.The only slight “con” I had was with setting up the computer. I assumed the seller set the laptop to its original factory setting as I was not able to perform certain functions initially due to having an outdated MacBook OS. After doing some simple research, I was able to download the MacBook Ventura OS version which is the most current OS. The MacBook is now updated and I am satisfied with my purchase. I would recommend giving this seller a try.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2023
review_text: I love this computer so far, first MacBook that I’ve owned. Minimal scratches on outside of laptop. Can’t talk about battery life because I’ve been in the house so far with it on the charger. But when I take it off the charger it seems just fine. Only minor issue is laptop overheating from time to time. ALSO IF YOU DONT KNOW MUCH ABOUT MACBOOKS MAKE SURE YOU BUY A TYPE C ADAPTER FOR MACBOOKS WITH DIFFERENT OUTPUTS.UPDATE: I’ve had this laptop for a couple of weeks now and the battery is horrible. It’s been on the charger for days and it won’t go past 1%. It keeps saying not charging even though the charger is plugged in and the laptops battery health is normal.I honestly would recommend everyone to sacrifice and save more money and buy the laptop brand new.EDIT 2: THIS MACBOOK BATTERY KEPT EXPANDING AND THE LAPTOP WAS OVERHEATING LIKE CRAZY. ACCORDING TO GEEK SQUAD THE BATTERY IS BAD AND HAZARDOUS AND COULD HAVE EXPLODED. SO I WILL BE RETURNING.I wasn’t expecting this to happen I was ignoring the other reviews because I really wanted to try it out. My fault.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2022
review_text: I purchased a brand new MacBook Pro 2017 15” in 2018 for a little over $2k. It was smashed and I needed a new laptop.  I can’t afford the $2k at the moment so I decided to purchase renewed MacBook Pro 2017 15” 1tb memory from double dex refurbished. Let me tell you! Whoever is in charge of repairing the MacBook pros is doing a fantastic job. I had ordered the same MacBook Pro with less memory from Buspry and received a dented up aluminum case MacBook with a screen replacement job that was so botched. The M key didn’t work.  I returned the unit and reordered. The laptop came in two days. Almost mint condition. The tiniest scratch. Everything else was immaculate. The screen perfect. No scratches. Keys work perfect. The laptop is clean. No dents. It looks almost brand new. It’s been operating fine. I would recommend double dex refurbished again and again. Im you guys keep doing what you’re doing. You’ve earned a customer for life!

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2024
review_text: I bought this MacBook for simple everyday use and for work but no longer work for the place I needed it for so I use it just for my daily use. This laptop is surprisingly great with small games, I wanted to start playing games to pass the time and it runs the games as it should, maybe a little loud with the fan and battery may not last but I normally use it in clamshell mode anyway so the battery isn’t a horrible issue. I would say for around $450 it is great, I at first had a bit of issues with the space bar but after about an hour of typing and breaking it in it seems to have fixed the issue. When I first got it the battery was completely dead as expected but took around an hour to charge to a state of being able to use, the screen had no problems, it is amazing value, setting up the OS is simple and quick, the screen had no cracks, scratches, or anything wrong with it, and the laptop itself had a great overall appearance with no buffs or scratches to be seen. If I had to recommend a laptop that is affordable, works well, for school or work, or even just daily use I would recommend this one. Great job with the refurbishment!

review_title: Awesome refurbished MacBook Pro - Enjoying it by now.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2022
review_text: Despite I was hesitant to buy a refurbished MacBook Pro, adding that some buyers had a non favorable at all reviews when I was thinking to buy, I decided to try with this vendor Kanga and if any issue happens, to return it before the 90 days period.By now being the third day after "unboxing", the experience has been so pleasant, with the following highlights:1.- Speakers performs like sound bar systems, even better that some bars for TVs. I've been listening this morning a Pink Floyd concert in YouTube and i've found its flawless sound is amazing, much better than my 50 inches Smart TV.2.- It had MacOS Monterey preinstalled, and after a not so long update, I had the latest version 12.4, with all current patches.3.- It has a minor scratch on the back of the screen, and I won't see it when I put the case on the MacBook Pro, so I don't care too much of this. It looks and behave like new MacBook Pro, in a mint condition, despite it is at least 5 years old.4.- Coming from a MacBook Pro 2015, I'm getting used to the touch bar, however the learning curve has been no significant and I'm learning quickly its features. Touch Bar working fine at the moment.5.- Touch ID did follow its procedure to acquire my finger marks, so now its working fine too.6.- I believe those who mentioned bad experiences with their buys, however that is not my case until now.7.- I may think by a moment that I'm using a MacBook Pro with M1 Pro, without paying that hefty price. However when looking that the Apple support status it is out of warranty, so I'm coming back to the reality.8.- I found it required additional hardware to connect with my HDs with Thunderbolt for USB C, so having converters I did the first Time Machine backup with no issues.9.- Battery is above 90% capacity, with no cycles of use, so I understand the degradation may come because of the time and not by a previous use.I'm trying to use adding heavy workloads to the MacBook Pro in order to find any possible issue (like graphic card bugs), however at this moment the behavior is very good as expected.So I congratule Kanga to deliver this excellent device that I'm enjoying by now. However if something changes, I will update this review in the coming days, or to return it at the first failure.

review_title: Be aware of purchasing any electronics devices  plus Seller not willing to work with me

review_text: I acquired the MacBook Pro 15" for professional purposes. Although the product seemed to be in great visual condition, it unfortunately has several problems. The battery is faulty, there are scratches and dents all over, and the speaker only works intermittently. review_title: Decent, but only order excellent condition
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2024
review_text: Im a seasoned tech guy with year of experience with use and repair of computers and networking and this device is definitly decent. I ordered the "excellent" refurbished item and it arrived fully functional and ready to update(which is required to be done by the buyer due to factory reset and this being an older computer) but something about the chasis sticker threw me off. The whole top and bottom of the macbook has had a sticker applied suspected to be used to hide scratches. Also even though "excellent" was the target theres still a chip in the casing along with the obvious sticker cover up job they did.(which should be advertized atleast) just that alone leaves this feeling like a dkoldies style "refurbishment" which leads me to beliee it definitly wasnt refurbished as a true refurbishment would require opening the device and cleaning/reapplying thermal paste(at the very least). with such a thin compact form factor this is very much needed part of refurbishment for this mac. Otherwise to these defects the mac performs and all functions it originally had are operational. I would just say dont order anything besides excellent condition or you definitly will run into some of the issues you see from other reviews.

review_title: Scratched Up and not in “Excellent” Condition

review_text: Opened the box and noticed immediately there were dings and scratches on the computer. Keyboard imprints are visible on the screen. It looks like they tried to fix something around the camera because the normally smooth sealant is rough.The computer seems to run OK.Disappointed.Edit: The screen is damaged. There's a bright spot on the left side of the screen.Update: While the product itself was a mess, the outstanding customer service I received is noteworthy. review_text: I have to say that support is good, the answered and helped me in the way they say that could be able to do it.Sadly, they do not cover international return, and It'd cost me almost half the price to ship it back to return, so I had to stand with the model I received.The computer arrives with a cover sticker up and downside, not ugly, but I'd prefer without it, and I fear to remove because it could hide scratches or something.The battery lifetime is weak, It won't last more thank 2 hours.The screen resolution, keyboard, touch bar, camera, and performance is works excellent, I can run docker containers, connect to server, do my work and everything works.This is my first MacBook and by the price paid, it wasn't bad deal.

review_title: So far, Great for the price!*UPDATED* battery poor quality&crashes
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2022
review_text: Apple 15in MacBook Pro, Retina, Touch Bar, 2.9GHz Intel Core i7 Quad Core, 16GB RAM, 512GB SSD, Space Gray, MPTT2LL/A (Renewed) - I needed a new laptop for photo editing as the Ram on my Microsoft surface pro is not equipped enough for Lightroom/photoshop, everyone suggested a MacBook of some kind, but my bank account can't get on board with those steep prices of $1,500+ so when I found this refurbished one for $650 with the option for monthly payments, I couldn't pass it up! I have had it for about a week now and so far so good. It arrived faster than it was expected, the cosmetic damage to the laptop is okay, there is a large dent/gouge on one of the edges that is pretty significant. The rest appears mostly unscratched but that's because it appears to have a sticker across the entire front and back of the laptop to appear as though it is brand new. It looks fine, the only way I noticed was when I look at the bottom of the laptop I expected to find model #s so I could buy a compatible case for the laptop and there is nothing on the bottom of the laptop what so ever. When I saw that I looked at the edges and sure enough there is a sticker across the whole surface to cover any cosmetic damage. The A key on the keyboard sticks a bit from time to time, otherwise functionality, speed, and battery life have been good so far. The screen is REALLY REALLY sensitive to touch (changes color in the spot that anything brushes by it) so I worry the screen will break at some point in general transportation of the laptop. Even if I run my finger across it with no pressure, it reacts as if I'm pushing on the screen hard. I will update if anything changes!***UPDATE: the battery only lasts for 2 hours of use unplugged, it dies if it’s not being used either. And at least once a week it gives an error message stating that it unexpectedly restarted due to an issue. Not thrilled with the issues but I need the device.

review_title: This is a very much long overdue review...
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2023
review_text: I'm a photographer returning to work on a budget & was in great need of a new MacBook since my last one had a damaged screen.When I received this MacBook everything checked out okay. It came in great condition and operated fine. However, after a few days, it shut off on me without warning and kept giving me the signal of it needing to charge. I thought it was because the night before I accidentally left it on charge, which is something I try not to do.I tried two old charger cords that I had, as well as troubleshooting it as directed online, but it didn't work. When I contacted the seller they told me to try the same stuff that I saw online to troubleshoot. I also took it to a computer tech and he told me I would need a new MacBook. I tried again taking it to another computer tech and all it needed was a new charger cord and adapter. this cost me $130.Since then I've been having more issues with it.1. It has to be kept on charge to stay on.2. It sometimes shuts off on its own while on charge.3. The USB ports doesn't operate as it should. God forbids my laptop shuts off because the charger was accidentally disconnected or just shuts off on its own, I would have to keep trying the other ports for them to work or restart the computer and wait about 15 minutes for them to kick in.4. A few days ago, out of nowhere, the laptop or USB port had a glitch and completely formatted my SD Card with 2 recent photoshoots on it before I got the chance to transfer them over. Thank heavens I was able to get the photos back. I had to pay close to $90 to download a software that would allow me to access and  restore the deleted photos.I did contact the seller during the refund period, however, I live in Turks & Caicos where anything we order would not be delivered to our doors. We would have to have it sent to a friend's address and have them bring it over whenever they can or have it sent to a company's US address and then pay additional duties and freight on the items. Returning items are not easy and can be very costly. So, to return this MacBook & get the refund, I would have to go through one of the shipping company's and pay to have it sent over & then order a new one which takes time away from me getting work done and more than likely turn away clients. The seller did ask how much it would cost to have it sent over, but after considering the time frame I may be without a laptop and getting work done, I just stuck it out and trying to get the most out of what I paid for.
