review_text: The machine arrived in good working order. Has a few cosmetic scratches, but no big deal. The description says it comes loaded with OS X Sierra, but it had Mojave instead. Didn't really matter because I upgraded to Monterey anyway. The drive is formatted in APFS, so that was no problem. It came with a power supply, but not the extension cable for the supply. Fortunately I have a spare and they're interchangeable.For some reason, the product page doesn't include a photo of the right side of the computer, so I'll tell you: it has two USB-C ports. The MacBook has a total of 4 of them. These are the only ports, so you'll probably want to buy an adapter for your thumb drives, data cards, HDMI cables and headphones.But I'm deducting one star because the computer arrived with a very dirty keyboard and screen. See photo. So when the seller says they they did a thorough check, they obviously aren't being truthful. I'm hoping there isn't anything substantial they overlooked, too. I have 90 days to find out.

review_title: Best Decision I've Made in Years - Buying a Reconditioned iMac Pro
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2021
review_text: If you are reading this you are probably wondering if buying a reconditioned iMac laptop is a good idea.  Based on my experience, it isn't . . . it's a terrific idea!  Needless to say, I was very nervous about what I'd just done, bought a top of the line iMac Pro loaded with every bell & whistle I could possibly want, used and refurbished.  There were cautions about it might arrive with scratches and signs of wear but assurances that the computer itself was in excellent condition.  So, when it arrived and I opened the box I was expecting the worst.  As far as I can tell, I have a machine that was never used.  It's condition was pristine, just as it would have been if I'd bought it at the local Mac Store.  I've had it now for three months and it works perfectly.  Loads quickly, solid keyboard with no problems, Retina screen bright with sharp color, battery life so far of about 5-6 hours with moderately heavy use.  I couldn't be happier with the purchase.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2020
review_text: First off, everything with this computer internally is correct and exactly what I ordered. Battery is still fairly good with ~120 cycle count. Computer runs like it’s brand new. Computer even came with a brand new apple charger, which I was not expecting. However, in regards to the external part of the computer, there is definitely wear/tear/scratches even though the product description says looks like new. I am ok with the wear and tear as I still got a great deal on this particular model vs. other sites. There is a pretty significant and deep scratch underneath the screen next to the macbook pro logo. There’s is a chunk/dent on the left side of the computer base and there is a scratch on the back. Personally, I am fine with these issues just because I got an awesome deal but just don’t expect your model to come in external grade A condition. Overall, I’m happy with my purchase.

review_text: I bought this seeing the price tag. Seemed like a good deal. Got the product, after about 5 hours of use it would no longer turn on. Does not turn on when we attempt to restart.K, time to return it. Whats the return policy? if you do not remove the accounts from the device, they can keep up to 50% of the return. Well how am I supposed to remove the account if the product doesn't reliably turn on. Why on earth is this my problem now?Several hours on the phone with amazon later, several weeks into the process, and after several screw ups from amazon's returns team, I finally got an assurance on my refund for sending the item back.Its not enough really. Thats my time down the drain dealing with all this BS. These guys have a 3.8 rating on Amazon, that is TRASH, and it was my mistake for not heeding that. A 4.4 rating is the AVERAGE rating on amazon, these guys are way below that and rightfully so. If you want a refurbished apple notebook that meets quality standards, you need to cough up the dough and buy through Apple directly. Don't give these guys your money.

review_title: Product description is misleading! Avoid this if you can.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2022
review_text: The laptop itself is in good physical condition, as described. I installed macOS Monterey on it and things usually run smoothly except for about 5 minutes into any usage the fans kick on, even if I'm not doing anything intensive, the position of the machine is such that it has sufficient external airflow. I'll be doing basic web browsing and using non-intensive apps and the fans will just spin up and stay on the entire time. There may be dust build up inside or else there is another problem - maybe it has something to do with the latest macOS version running on the old hardware.After more extensive usage I realized just how spent the battery life is. The number of battery cycles exceeds 200, and it cannot hold a charge for more than 2 hours for basic file system tasks and browsing - practically just the screen being on. The battery drains to 10% within 2 hours and usually only barely makes it to 1.5 hours. This is extremely disappointing, as the description relayed the battery health would exceed 80% and stated that it would last around 10 hours.

It plays 4k 60fps videos easily, both on youtube and VLC.I've been burning off a full charge since 6pm. It's 9pm right now and I'm still at 75% and I've been playing videos, browsing the web and installing apps since I started. This is insane.The unit looks practically brand new. The battery appears to be the original Dell-branded battery. It's clean, spotless.[EDIT] I did find one nickel-sized spot on the monitor where the colors are slightly faded. You can only tell on a plain solid-color background and only if it's a lighter color. My desktop is currently plain black and I can't tell. Even when it's noticeable, it's barely noticeable. [END EDIT]The only thing that was even a bit shady was the Windows 10 install. Today is 5/9/24. According to sysinfo, the install date is from 2019. I doubt this laptop has sat for 5 years. I have a feeling the seller just deleted the users and made a new one. There was no set up or Welcome to Windows like a fresh install.For me, this is completely irrelevant. It's getting a fresh install in a couple days. But you might care.This is beyond an incredible value. Anyone older than 40 will understand that computers 1/1000th of this power used to be $5000 (in 1980's dollars).

review_title: A Hidden Gem Among the Bargain Chromebooks
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2021
review_text: SUMMARYA surprisingly well-rounded and well equipped budget chromebook that doesn't get the attention it deserves.LEAD-UP TO THE PURCHASEHaving recently given my Google Pixelbook to a friend who was in desperate need of a computer, I was in the market for another chromebook... just in time for Prime Day June 2021.  I didn't need a powerhouse since I have learned firsthand that running Linux on a chromebook sounds better on paper than it does in real life use.The 2-in-1 form-factor was fun to tinker with but in practical day-to-day use, I found it better to use a dedicated Android tablet (Samsung Galaxy Tab S6) for touch and pen tasks.  A traditional clamshell design would be fine for those "laptop-y" things... and an 11" or so screen would allow for a very portable device.PRIME DAY HUNTINGWith those requirements in mind, I went hunting in the Amazon (see what I did there? ;-) ) for a suitable chromebook.  I found that most of the deals were for devices that had been released two or more years ago.  A few other "deals" weren't any cheaper than the regular prices at other stores (for the same processor/RAM/storage configurations).I ran across the Lenovo Chromebook 3 (LCB3 for short) and it really intrigued me. Not only was it quite inexpensive, but it had a decent processor (Celeron N4020), decent storage (64GB), and more ports (2-USBC, 2 USBA 3.0, microSD card slot, and headphone/mic jack) than my old Google Pixelbook (2 USBC, headphone/mic jack).I watched some reviews on Youtube for this device and only one gave it a half-decent review.  In spite of the lack of glowing reviews, I purchased it.UNBOXING AND USEWhen the LCB3 arrived and I opened the box, I was impressed with the look and feel of this chromebook.  I don't have to qualify this comment with (...for a $170 chromebook).  No, it is legitimately a good looking and feeling chromebook, period.The lid has a tasteful Lenovo branding plate on it and a section of the lid has a fine gray hash pattern stenciled on that gives it an interesting and attractive look.The screen is a matte screen... yes!  I've always been a fan of matte screens (especially on Thinkpads) and although the reviewers complained that it wasn't a bright display, I found it to be just fine in the places I typically use a notebook-type device.The keyboard isn't the same as that found on Lenovo's other laptops, but it feels stable and quite acceptable for long typing sessions.The trackpad works well and is consistent.Battery life is extremely good.  I haven't run it all the way down yet, but on multiple occasions, I've run it on battery mostly surfing and typing for 3-4 hours and the projected battery life remaining registered 10+ hours.  I don't know how true that is, but I'll try to run it all the way down and update with the results.Performance is more than adequate.  The combination of the Celeron N4020 and the lower screen resolution results in a very smooth and responsive experience.TAKE THE EXPERT REVIEWERS' OPINIONS WITH A GRAIN OF SALTBecause expert reviewers have access to a wide variety of devices, (many of them high-end), they can have their perspectives skewed a bit.  It's nothing personal against them, it's how we're all wired.  That seems to be evident in their review and coverage of the LCB3.Lenovo has been "killing it" (in a good way) lately in the chromebook space.  Their Chromebook Duet gets most of the attention, but this LCB3 is the hidden gem in their recently released chromebooks.I've owned the older Lenovo ThinkPad chromebooks in the past, but the LCB3 feels more like a ThinkPad than those officially branded ThinkPad chromebooks were.  I'm baffled as to why expert reviewers haven't given this device more attention.I was initially concerned about how well the few Android apps I rely on would work on a non-touchscreen chromebook, but so far, they work as expected.I'm delighted with the LCB3 and it will fit nicely with how I use my chromebooks.  I hope this is helpful to those who are considering purchasing the Chromebook 3.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2022
review_text: I got this computer for work. I needed something cheap and highly portable, and having used a chromebook in school I knew I wanted one. This chromebook is great for the price and needs I needed met. ChromeOS is a pretty smooth and well rounded system, and this particular laptop is sleek, thin, lightweight, and visually pleasing. It does have Linux built in, but I can't comment on that because I'm not the most tech savvy. The good thing about chromebooks is you don't really have to be.Keep in mind if you want a chromebook, most of the time the apps are meant for a phone or tablet. As far as I know, most games won't work or will be hard to play, and some apps have diminished usage because of how tapping vs. Clicking works. Not that big of a deal to me, but it could be frustrating to someone who wants a regular laptop for casual use. The touchpad on this particular one is pretty good, and large enough to use given the size of the laptop. The keys are a little thin and small so sometimes I miss them or mistype when going fast. The screen is perfectly acceptable, vibrant and it fills most of the bezel. Overall, 8/10.

review_title: You Really Can't Beat the Price
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2023
review_text: This is a cheap laptop, which is exactly why I bought it. I use it when I travel for work since it's really lightweight, and by running linux on it I can do anything I would need it to.The screen is blurry, and it can sometimes do a weird thing where it doesn't turn on while outside, but it gets the job done and is no frills. The built in chrome os has major training wheels but that may be desirable for some users.A note on running linux on this: your best bet is using Crouton to set up a chroot. This chromebook has a Gemini Lake processor, so trying to do anything more fancy like a dualboot or replacing the chromeos completely with linux or windows doesn't really work sadly.If you decide to go ahead with the chroot, my advice is to use a simple desktop like xfce if you run ubuntu. I tried to get unity working and you may have better luck (or skills xD) than me, but when I tried booting the initial setup never ran, and doing tricks like opening the terminal via a shortcut just didn't work.In short, though, it's a fun little computer and is really good for the purposes of travel.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2022
review_text: I've been using this for about 8 months now and this thing is fantastic, I work in excavating as well as a surveyor and this little thing goes everywhere with me. The screen can be seen in about any lighting condition, direct sunlight is a little sketchy but still usable. The battery life (for me) is about 2 weeks, really depends on what I'm doing though. If I'm really using it for work and then come home to mess around on the internet I'll get about 10 hours sometimes 11 hours but that's really pushing it. The screen size is pretty nice it's only 11 inches but for what I really do on it I don't mind, if I need to do more I usually get on my 17 inch but for timesheets and excel this little thing is nice. Performance side of things this thing runs great, 99% of apps open in seconds. For the money this is a fantastic machine, perfect size for on the go, responds instantly, and lives all day or more in my case. The only thing I would say I don't like is that only 1 of the 2 USB C ports will charge it, would be nice if it would work either way.

review_title: Satisfied with the one I got
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2022
review_text: This is my first Chromebook, and I've been using it for two days.  The battery life is amazing so far; it does appear to be 10 hours. Reading the reviews, it seems like a wide range of experiences, and I feel fortunate that mine works well so far.It was very easy to set up. I saw 11.5 in the description, but the actual display screen is 10 inches. It isn't a touch screen, and the keys are dark gray, not black. This was an impulse purchase after getting a new laptop a few days ago. My 6 year old Dell would work no longer, and I got an expensive gaming laptop. It was my second one, but I was not expecting it to get so hot, with a noisy fan. The battery life is about an hour. To feel more comfortable, I wanted a Chromebook for email, YouTube, and Amazon videos. So, this is doing what I want it to.I will likely get more used to having no delete key, instead the alt+backspace key is used for that function.  I was surprised when my bookmark bar appeared with bookmarks from 2013 on. I've deleted many of them in the bookmark manager.My main dissatisfaction is the disappearing vertical scroll bar. In some emails, you can select "view inbrowser". I would be more frustrated if I didn't have the laptop available. There might be a fix for that; I haven't researched yet.I purchased mine when it was 52% off, which is worth it.  Buying electronics is risky. I've been very disappointed in the past, which is why I'm relieved and accepting of the machine I got.Almost everything has become more expensive, and reasonable expectations seem to be in order. With two days use, I'm not regretting my purchase.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2023
review_text: I didn’t know the difference in the Chrome Book. I thought it was a Laptop… with Windows, like others. I couldn’t figure out there was a difference till I reviewed it on the internet. I read it’s not a Gaming PC, nor a Graphics capable computer! It has confused me seeing I have 3 other Laptops tho broken. When I first opened it I was almost disappointed! But I had gotten it just for writing. My PC and tablets can do gaming if desired. So, finding this out made me realize it is exactly what I wanted. I’m not interested in super speed, 4K graphics, or storage; I have 3 external drives or a terabyte of extra storage. What I did need was an extension of my Desktop computer. I wanted to share my office program and use MS WORD. It does all that! I wanted to have a way to take my Desktop on the run. I can with this unit. It’s very lightweight; almost too light to do what it does. It’s fast and sharp enough to view YouTube videos without lagging. The memory and internal storage is real small; 32Gb storage… My phone is 10 times faster, has 4K video, and 50 gigabytes of Cloud Storage. So like I said; “It’s exactly what I wanted!”The price was also what sold me… not to forget the pretty white color I chose. Is this worth the money? YES!Can you print with it? YES!Add a mouse… keyboard… Yes & yes! Sound isn’t top shelf but you can hear it clearly.Overall… I’m very satisfied with this product! You will be as well!

review_text: The HP Notebook Laptop is a powerhouse of performance and convenience, all packed into a sleek and stylish design. With a 15.6" HD touchscreen, this laptop offers a stunning display that enhances your viewing experience, whether you're watching movies, editing photos, or working on spreadsheets.Powered by an Intel Core i3-1115G4 Processor and 32GB RAM, this laptop provides exceptional speed and smooth multitasking capabilities. You can easily handle demanding tasks, such as video editing or running multiple applications simultaneously, without any lag or slowdowns.The 1TB PCIe SSD ensures ample storage space for all your files, documents, and media. It allows for quick boot-ups, faster file transfers, and snappy app launches. You'll never have to worry about running out of storage space again.The built-in webcam lets you stay connected with friends, family, and colleagues through video calls or online meetings. The Type-C and HDMI ports allow for easy connectivity to external devices, such as monitors, projectors, or printers. Additionally, the SD card reader provides a convenient way to transfer files from your camera or other SD card devices.With Wi-Fi capability, you can stay connected to the internet wherever you go. Whether you're working from home, at a cafe, or traveling, you can rely on stable and fast internet connectivity.The HP Notebook Laptop runs on Windows 11 Home, the latest operating system from Microsoft that offers an improved and user-friendly interface. It provides a seamless experience, with a host of features and enhanced security to keep your data safe.Overall, the HP Notebook Laptop is a reliable and powerful device that delivers top-notch performance and versatility. With its sleek design and impressive specifications, it is suitable for a wide range of users, from students and professionals to casual users who appreciate both style and functionality.

review_title: Some tips on all negative reviews on S Mode and Battery...
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2024
review_text: So I bought two of these computers, one for my daughter and one for me. Let me say first that DURING your INITIAL setup make sure that you DO get properly signed in to your Microsoft account and your OneDrive account. Set them up during setup. Also make sure that one drive is set to sync. While setting up my daughter's computer I got the password wrong so it set it up without signing in. After setup I did sign into Microsoft and OneDrive but did not set it up to sync. I could not get that computer out of S Mode no matter what I did. I had to reinstall a brand new windows 11 and then go in and delete the old operating system in order to get it out of S Mode.On my computer setting it up I DID properly get signed into Microsoft account and one drive and told it to enable the sync. This one came right out of S Mode after the setup was done when I followed Microsoft's instructions. It must have something to do with enabling those things and signing in during setup and not afterward! (Microsoft should be CLEAR about this and nowhere did I find this information online - truly it was by accideny).As far as this complaining about a battery not holding charge. First of all your standby time unplugged I have at least 10 to 12 hours, if not a few days. I left mine unplugged overnight and it only went down less than 10%. If you're using your computer yeah you're only going to have maximum 3 to 4 hours of battery time and that's the same on all of my laptops. Secondly this computer comes with an HP interface program called MY HP that includes Diagnostics. You will have to create an account and sign in but there are diagnostic tools in there that will test your battery. One of the things HP says (Especiaaly with a new computer or if you are replacing a battery) is that you need to condition the battery so that it does not get damaged or operate improperly. What they recommend is that you discharge the battery until the computer shuts itself off. Then you plug it in (if it starts up when you plug it in let it boot and turn it back off all the way). Then allow the battery to charge with the computer off for a minimum of 6 hours. Then you unplug the charger and let the computer sit for at least 4 hours still completely off. Once you turn it back on reload the HP diagnostic software and run the battery test again. If it still tells you that the battery needs conditioned then you will repeat the process up to three times until it tells you the battery condition is good. Make sure when you do this that you have the power setting set to charge the battery to 100%. Once you have conditioned the battery go in and set it to power saving so that it only charges the battery up to 80% so that way you don't overuse the battery and you don't get Ghost charges. If you do this you will have a longer usage time and standby time. And you won't damage the battery in the end.

review_title: Excellent purchase!.....until it broke 3 days later
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2021
review_text: EDIT: 3/25/2021Well I guess it was too good to be true. The laptop was working perfectly fine, and then today I got the black screen of death. We plugged it in, tried to reset it. Went through all of the trouble shooting steps and it didn’t turn back on. It makes the chiming sound like it wants to turn on, but then it just doesn’t. The keyboard lights don’t turn on, and the screen is just blacklit. I’m very saddened by this development. We have requested a refund. Hopefully the return will be smooth. Also when you print the return label you also get a letter that says that Kanga Supply reserves the right to charge you a 20% restocking fee if they find you returned the product that isn’t defective. They also say they’ll charge you “up to a 50% fee” if you don’t remove your account from the device and turn off find my Mac. Since my screen is black I have been unable to remove my account. Hopefully they don’t charge me 50% of $900 because the screen isn’t working and I can’t remove my account. 😭😭😭😭............I have wanted a MacBook for the longest time. But the price was just so much more than I have ever been willing to spend. But this year we finally decided to splurge on a MacBook. I was so happy to find this listing. I was able to get the larger storage size for cheaper than a brand new smaller storage MacBook. I was super worried about it being delivered. I was worried it would be damaged in transit. It was not. It was wrapped very nicely in a very thick bubble wrap. It arrived with 7% battery life and looks brand new. The battery has 80/1000 cycles used so it wasn’t used a lot. However since it is the intel chip and not the m1 the battery life isn’t excellent. I used zoom for about 1.5 hours and the battery dropped from 100% to about 70%. It’s not terrible but I would definitely recommend bringing the charger or a backup battery pack along with the MacBook. The shipping was excellent and it even arrived a day earlier than expected. Overall it is an excellent purchase and I’m very very glad we went with it.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2023
review_text: I really really like this laptop BUT my main purpose is to use it for ZOOM calls for work. I work remote and use it on a daily basis. Because of that, I am returning it. Unfortunately, the video camera does not work. It freezes and lags. At first I thought it was the wifi but I tested the speed and it was great. I tried from multiple locations, house, library, hotel etc. Then my IT friend suggested I make sure all updates have been done. I spent SO LONG making sure to have everything installed properly. He also said it doesn’t look like it was wiped properly because there was stuff on it that shouldn’t be. Every time it turns on it says “Michigan Medicine” on the black screen. Weird. Anyways… after many tests, I pulled out my old laptop and ran ZOOM at the same time, side by side on the same network. My old laptop worked perfectly. We even downloaded Skype to see if it was a ZOOM or camera issue. Skype didn’t work either. I tried testing the camera from the settings and it was black (see photo) or it was a frozen image. We determined there is something wrong with the camera and I need to return it. I’m bummer because I like it otherwise. Everything else was great about it- the speed, design, ease. I’m not sure if I’ll risk it again and buy another refurbished laptop or just shell out the big money for a new one. Just wanted to post an honest review for those who are like me and actually read these things. I hope it’s helpful.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2024
review_text: I really do love this laptop, this thing got some power to it, I can easily connect my iPhone device to get text messages and calls directly from my laptop, it can run all my work application such as zoom and software I use without any issues.  I get a good 8 hours of battery life which is not terrible and it covers a full work day for me. The volume is loud in my opinion when watching YouTube videos or streaming in general, I tend to use my headphones most of the time and never actually use the laptop volume. I don’t have any slow loading issues, the webcam is 720 p and works fine for what I need it for. I use it daily in a call center and never run into any problems with it. I used a MacBook before I got this laptop and has all the bells and whistles that my old MacBook had. I highly recommend this product if you’re a student.Only downside to this device is it does not offer a backlit keyboard ): so working at night requires a light to be on, or if you’re like me and memorized the keys than it wouldn’t be a total deal breaker.Update: 6/26/24This laptop is still performing excellently after a few months of use. The battery life remains strong at 8 hours. I did purchase a higher quality webcam since Zoom calls were a bit spotty. All my devices connect without any issues. If you’re like me and need to connect multiple devices, I recommend investing in a hub, as the laptop offers only 2 USB-C ports, 2 USB ports, and 1 HDMI port. Overall, I love this laptop and it works fantastically for all my needs.

review_title: Good system, defective HD. Had to return.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2023
review_text: I have some pros and cons on this laptop purchase as a whole. Pros: The laptop was super clean and appeared unused. No scratches or anything. The system started up and ran tasks quickly, touch screen worked great and image was beautiful. This next pro will be explained more in the cons. The return and refund process were painless and very fast. With a 90 day warranty period, the Amazon refurbished offering is low risk. )Just keep all the packaging in case you need it.)Cons: This system came already logged into Windows. I feel it should boot to the Windows setup screen and not already have an account which could have malware installed. I messed around with it for 10-15 minutes to check out the features and then it froze up, rebooting gave me a “Hard Drive not Installed” error. I rebooted to setup, and it worked again for 10 minutes. This was repeated for a while so I learned how to wipe windows with a fresh install. Once it was updated and through the setup I got about 30 minutes before the error occurred again. At that point I submitted my return request and packaged it up.Overall, while it worked it was great. I’ve already ordered the same model as a replacement. Fingers crossed that it has no HD issues.

review_title: From Apple to Windows - A Refreshing Change with a Few Notes!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2023
review_text: First off, I want to say that I am a diehard Apple user. This HP 2022 Stream 14" is the first Windows product I've ventured into in a long while. My main motivation to switch things up was to see the contrast in user experience between a Windows laptop and an Apple one.One thing that definitely drew me to this laptop was the price tag. Unlike its Apple counterparts that can run into the thousands, this HP laptop was an affordable $319.00. That's incredible value for money!However, there was an immediate downside I noticed: the absence of a keyboard backlight. With my not-so-great eyesight, a backlight would have been a big help. Despite that, the laptop itself feels light, even more so with the protective case I added.In terms of battery life, I manage to squeeze out a good 4 hours, especially with tasks like schoolwork and Zoom meetings. As for the Windows system, it's taking some readjusting, but overall, the laptop has been holding up well. It's been a worthwhile shift, and I appreciate the balance of cost and functionality this HP offers.

The hard drive is tiny but I bought an external hard drive for less than upgrading the storage. It would be nice if the USB ports were on the right side instead of the left. All in all though I'm very satisfied with it and would buy another one when the time comes.

review_title: Love the large screen size yet lightweight
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2024
review_text: Great work computer.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2024
review_text: SOME WORDS TO THE WISE. Overall, I'm satisfied with these HP17x laptops. BUT!!! There are a couple things to be WELL AWARE of, before buying. First, and FOREMOST. A word of caution! As most everyone knows, Microsoft has, for quite some time, been transitioning truly from a software company into a retail sales company. That fact is abundantly clear! Now, be well aware of what Microsoft has done in its latest versions of WIN11-HOME. Many (perhaps most???, perhaps all???) Windows11-HOME based computers are delivered with the OS in "S-Mode." We run HP desktop and laptop computers exclusively, so I can speak only to my several more recent HP purchases. However, I no longer subscribe to WIN11-HOME. All of my recent purchases have been ordered with the WIN11-PRO OS. My advice to those considering buying any computer preloaded with WIN11-HOME: "stay well away." "S-Mode", does not allow the user to load any 3rd-party software. All software must be obtained (think $$$$$) from the MS Store. While MS claims that the procedure required to exit "S-Mode" is quite simple, in fact, we've found that it is nearly IMPOSSIBLE!!! And, it will require the involvement of MS 'off-shore' tech assistance, which is not necessarily easily obtained. One such call that I received, after HOURS of waiting, arrived at 2AM. If buying an HP17x laptop, order with WIN11-PRO. PRO versions are not restricted by "S-Mode" software. Now, to the computer. Typical of HP products, this laptop is well built, with an excellent display. Ports are somewhat limited, but, for me, that is not a deal-breaker. I like having the 32GB of RAM, and at least 1TB of storage. I expect these laptops to be more than adequate into the foreseeable future. My one complaint with these, and it is critical, is that the integral cooling system is WHOLLY inadequate. When used for long periods of time, especially on mains power, which we do, these computers will run HOT!!! My take on that is, putting an engineer and an accountant together, on any design project, inevitably results in trouble. In an effort to make this laptop as slim and as light-weight as possible, the internal cooling apparatus has suffered for it. In these, the CPU does generate a lot of heat. The air duct is quite small and narrow, and the internal fan is a joke, except that it's not. So!!! Buy a serious laptop cooler, to go along with your laptop purchase. And, I don't mean one of those multi-fan, USB powered units, that generate heat to remove heat. High quality, AC/DC-adapter powered gaming type coolers are available from Amazon. You'll be happy you made the purchase. At first, battery life is quite short, but we've seen that over time (repeated charge/discharge cycles) battery life does improve some. In our case, having to use mains powered coolers, we simply use mains power for our laptops, and we don't rely much on battery power. Of course, bear in mind that having to have access to AC power does diminish the practicability of using a laptop computer, in the first place. The HP17x series are big computers with a healthy display. One minor complaint is the lack of a backlit keyboard. But, for the money (around $500), these were still a good buy.

review_title: No, No, and I returned it
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2024
review_text: As others have mentioned, this comes with Windows 11 S, which is not stated in the description. It's allegedly simple to turn off. I never got that far.It is not possible to use this machine without logging in with a Microsoft Account."Turn off the wifi" I read. Well there is no way of turning off the wifi on this. No switch. No wifi button on the keyboard. No airplane mode button on the keyboard. No combo of mystery keys suggested online worked.I then tried the 'put in a bogus email and password so it gives you the option to use a local account'. No it does not. I tried over and over and over for an hour. Back it goes to the 'Log in with a Microsoft Account' screen every time.No choice, I had to log in with a MS account.In the course of trying to change to a local account, the UAC kicked in and stopped me from clicking to change any setting, install anything or do anything at all.After five solid hours of searching for a solution and finding images and descriptions of options that were not on this machine. I gave up, put it back in the box and returned it.It's worth a restocking fee to get rid of this thing.As for Windows 11: if I want 3 different desktops, widgets that push MSN, icons thrown in the middle bottom of the screen, and a system that blocks me from doing anything I want or need to do with it, I'll get a Mac.UPDATE: The seller refunded the Full amount. (I did pack it up exactly as I received it). Thank you!

review_title: Dell Latitude 5400 Business Laptop: A Reliable and High-Performing Choice
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
review_text: I recently purchased the Dell Latitude 5400 Business Laptop with a 14-inch FHD Non-Touch display for my mother-in-law, and I am thoroughly impressed with its quality and performance. This laptop has proven to be an excellent choice for everyday use, combining reliability, performance, and ease of use.The first thing to note is the Full HD 1920 x 1080 resolution display. The screen offers crisp and clear visuals, making it perfect for both work and entertainment. The non-touch aspect of the screen does not detract from the experience, as the clarity and brightness of the display are exceptional.In terms of performance, the Dell Latitude 5400 stands out. It handles everyday tasks with ease, be it web browsing, working on documents, or streaming media. The laptop runs smoothly, and I haven’t noticed any lag or slowdown, even with multiple applications open. This is a testament to its robust processing power and efficient memory management.The build quality of the laptop is another highlight. It feels sturdy and well-constructed, which is reassuring, especially considering it is being used by my mother-in-law who appreciates simplicity and durability in technology. The design is sleek and professional, making it a good fit for both business and personal use.One of the aspects I appreciate most is the laptop's user-friendliness. It is straightforward to set up and use, which is important as it is intended for my mother-in-law, who prefers uncomplicated technology. The interface is intuitive, and navigating through Windows 10 is a breeze.Battery life is also commendable. It lasts long enough to get through a significant part of the day without needing a recharge, which adds to its convenience, especially for someone who may not always be close to a power outlet.In conclusion, the Dell Latitude 5400 Business Laptop is a fantastic choice for anyone seeking a reliable and high-performing laptop. Its combination of a clear FHD display, solid performance, robust build quality, and user-friendly experience makes it a valuable device for both work and leisure. I am very pleased with this purchase and would highly recommend it to others looking for a dependable laptop.

I added more memory when I got it, I went from 16GB to 32GB and the 500GB SSD is fast (less than a minute for boot up time).Cons: The cooling fan and battery are know to go bad but are easy to replace and cheap and the age is starting to creep up.Summary:Overall a great machine for the money and my usage. Parts are cheap and not hard to replace.  A must buy for a 2nd computer for travel or around the house. It's not that expensive so if it's lost or broke you're not out a lot of money.

review_title: Great Computer, Good Experience With Seller
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2024
review_text: The computer came quickly and works like a charm. Had to adjust settings to get the most out of the battery, the default settings=2 hours of battery life, but with a quick google search I found how to turn off certain background apps and switch from the default "intelligent cooling mode" to "battery saver" using the Levono vantage app as opposed to the systems own power settings.  The laptop is fast and efficient for school and can handle older games like Fallout New Vegas like a charm. I bought the touch version for the IPS, 300 nit screen because I did not want to settle for a tn display at 250 nits that you see in some over Levono models. I don't use the touch features, but the display is decent and bright enough for what I need it for.  All in all, I have no regrets about buying this model.  With all that said, make sure this is the model you want. Returning this due to buyer's remorse comes with a hefty restocking fee. It's not an item you can just return for the heck of it because of Amazons overly lenient return policy. (It really is, I used to work as a Customer Service Supervisor at Whole Foods and after Amazon acquired us, I went from supervising a team of cashiers to doing hundreds of Amazon returns a day. Hard to say we were a green company with all the packaging waste we went through on a daily basis). But that is all beside the point, I personally had a great experience with this computer and this seller. Highly recommended!

review_title: Connecting to internet is a nightmare in setup.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2024
review_text: Setup is a nightmare.I am guessing it depends on the manufacture date of your particular computer if you will encounter this issue or not.I bought this laptop for my daughter's birthday. Gave it to her, and started setting it up. That's when I got the same problem that a lot of people have mentioned in reviews.It would not recognize my Wi-Fi network. It would not recognize my mobile hotspot. It does not have a physical ethernet port to connect a hardline. The Network connection screen does not have an option to bypass if you do not have internet connection.I had to contact Lenovo support. They had me open command prompt to re-run the initial Windows setup in a manner that would allow me to select "I do not have internet" in order to bypass that step.But it got worse. The laptop would not even allow me to turn on or off WiFi... because it came with a bad Network Adapter installed. The tech support agent at one point told me I could just return the laptop for a replacement, but eventually got me to lenovo's support page on a different computer where I was able to download an updated Network Adapter driver to a USB, and transfer that to the new laptop.I might update my review depending on how the laptop performs, but based on the setup process- it's a nightmare

review_title: Great speedy, budget laptop! S-mode can be turned off easily
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
review_text: I'm leaving this review mainly just because others have voiced complaints about this laptop being delivered in "S-mode," which prevents users from installing apps that aren't pre-verified by Microsoft. While this would in my opinion indeed be terrible if users were stuck in S-mode, this is not the case at all. IT IS EXTREMELY EASY TO REMOVE S-MODE, and you can find instructions easily by Googling: "Switching out of S mode in Windows"Finally, the laptop itself is fast with its SSD and competent processor. The screen is sharp. It's fairly lightweight. Really, my only complaint is the size of the SSD, but how much storage can one realistically expect for a laptop this affordable?If you're not doing intense gaming or video editing (and maybe even if you are...not sure), then I think this laptop will handle what you need it to do.Very satisfied!

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
review_text: i'm not sure if i got a defective laptop, but i'm running into quite a few issues with it. the fan is on about 70% of the time, even when i only have a couple amazon tabs open or when i just turn it on. i keep checking task manager and it's showing cpu and/or memory spikes up to 98% for no apparent reason. it happened a couple times while writing this review. i had to take a photo with my phone because the snip tool wouldn't open while this is happening.most of the usage is coming from microsoft edge browser. i've done many google searches and tried many different combinations of settings both on msedge and the laptop itself, including performance and efficiency settings, but nothing helps. i've even tried using different browsers from the microsoft store but still same issue. i want to use the laptop, but i always end up putting it away because i can't stand the nearly constant fan.there's also a fast clicking/ticking noise from the top/right edge of the keyboard, especially when i open a new program or browser tab. i googled this and it says the hard drive could be failing. one time, i left the laptop open and it was constantly making the ticking noise until i closed it. also, i can also hear a faint static noise from the same spot on the keyboard, and it ramps up when i use the touchpad.i saw another review that said youtube plays fine on this laptop, but mine is constantly dropping frames (even with hardware acceleration on. without it, it drops lots more). i've never had a laptop do any of this before, and i really wasn't expecting it for $311.there was a few times where the laptop started lagging so much that typing was in slow motion, then it wouldn't respond to any inputs so i had to leave it to resolve itself. also, the battery drains unnecessarily fast, in my opinion.i've downloaded and installed all the latest updates and the laptop is still in S mode. if amazon or the manufacturer could assist, i'd greatly appreciate it. i didn't want to go through the hassle of a return, but the laptop is unusable in this condition.

review_title: Must have received a defective unit
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2023
review_text: Purchased this ASUS unit to replace a 5year old laptop that had been behaving erratically.On arrival went through the pains of setting up a new system with hardware vendor and OS vendor tasks, trying to minimize the snoop ware and added garbage they try to get you to agree to install. Once this was complete started migrating software from old laptop.Got interrupted so shut down new ASUS until later. Upon trying to boot up to continue - no display on ASUS laptop. After several attempts to boot up and then trying the hard boot process as per the ASUS tech support web site; initiated live chat with ASUS.After various suggestions ASUS requested that I connect an external monitor. Now I don't carry an inventory of spare parts around so had to cobble up a connection to a 55" tv located in another room. Running back and forth to keep the diagnostic going  ASUS timed out the chat session twice so I had to keep reconnecting and asking new "chatter" to reference back to previous session to avoid having keep repeating myself.Got external monitor up and was instructed to perform a system reset. First time nothing happened, still displayed on external monitor. Second time may have done something because now even external display doesn't work. Can't see anything. Can only assume my personal software got erased with system reset but cannot verify. ASUS chat then said stated unit needed to be sent in for repair.No way am I going to endure the time delay and aggravation of going through the repair process on a new machine so I have returned and found a non-ASUS unit.This is the first, and last ASUS device I have purchased. This is provided as an awareness to anyone considering ASUS products

After the keyboard issue, I gave this HP a good rating.  That dropped steady to now (2) Its under warranty and I want a refund. I don't have hours to be on the phone with support. review_title: I love my chromebook! Just a couple caveats
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2023
review_text: I've owned chromebook for 10 months now and I just love it! Here's some updates after using if for awhile:1) Screen flickering: this is a problem but not long term. Also, if you just close the computer and reopen it, the screen will stop flickering.2) Battery life: very long, and it only takes me about 35 minutes to get a full recharge. This hasn't been a problem for me!What I don't like:-Keyboard lighting: the keyboard is so easy to use and works well. But the blacklisting is not bright and the silver keys with white letters makes it difficult to see the letters...unless yours in a dark place 🤔The keyboard is my biggest pet peeve but if yourve memorized your keys/placements you'll be fine. I just wish they had done black ink on the letters of thr keyboard so they were really clear and seen well.Another pet peeve:Chrome books are difficult to connect to printers. Most home printers are compatible with Apple or PC computers. My printer had a hard time connecting via wifi. It never quite worked. I'm going to get a different printer.Everything else I love...Including the compatibility with Goole products, but even non Google apps or products connect well with it. It's such a user friendly operating system and runs so smoothly!

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2021
review_text: Having always used "Windows", and therefore completely new to Chromebook, it is a definate learning curve.  I feel hampered as I've only ever used Microsoft type computers and being elderly may have slowed my learning speed.I will try to update this review as time goes by.My old laptop was extremely slow and I was looking for something different and speedy.First impressions after having a Chromebook for 1 week:-It is FAST.  Pages load really fast!-It was easy to transfer all my data & settings from my old computer, thanks to using Chrome in past years.All my photos are there.  The Chromebook shows you how and guides the process.-The keyboard lighting CAN be brightened to improve key visibility.  This was one of my big concerns as many reviews mention it.  The key were hard to see due to the low lighting at first.  I didn't find a reference to it on the Chromebook at first and needed a quick fix.  A search on Google showed me how.  I followed the instructions and now I can see the keys very well in normal household lighting.-It is a learning curve to learn the keyboard shortcuts.  I am jotting down notes in a notebook.-There is a Chromebook simulator for learning.-It has a easy, sensitive touchscreen.-Screen brightness is easy to adjust.-No detectable heat output.-Battery lasts a long time.-Tablet mode:  Open it completely until the two outside surfaces touch and it is completely flat.  The touchscreen is quite responsive.- Any questions I have regarding how to use this Chromebook can be easily answered by a quick Google search.- The screen comes on instantly when opening, if I don't turn the Chromebook off.  Navigation icons are at the bottom of the screen.Still learning; will update.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2023
review_text: It’s beneficial while I’m off of work due to a work injury, but the speakers seem to have lost their loudness. Seems like after each use the speakers get lower and lower on sound. I’ve never gone past half on how loud I have it because the speakers were good; now I have to connect to a speaker via Bluetooth, to get sound to come through. Other than that the system works great! It isn’t slow or anything can work with my systems from work. Love it!

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2021
review_text: If you want a laptop with a nice-sized screen, 360 rotation, and touchscreen it's a great laptop at a great price. I've had mine for 3 months now with no issues. I use it for college and a charge lasts me all day until I get back to my dorm. If I don't use it much over the weekend say an hour a day then a full charge will last all weekend. The only downside is that the touch screen is capacitive and not active. If you want to write a lot of notes on your laptop and you can spare another hundred or so get the C436 it has an active screen. My notes are really sloppy and it's not the easiest but it works fine and I only use it in lectures to make annotations on pdfs and then take notes on paper when I get back to my dorm. I wouldn't use it for notes all the time because of that. But for the price it's the best all around for what it offers.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2022
review_text: I got this for use at work as we got new ePCR software and were handed iPADS without physical keyboards and I just couldn't do it. That being said.. I use it at home also! This machine has turned out to be a great overall device. The display is nice and bright. It's fast.. and the battery life will last well into 2 days in a single charge! The fact that it starts up in seconds is a plus as I can do what I need to do and shut it completely down and be back up in a moment's notice. The keyboard took some getting used to.I have seen folks mentioning that the keyboard being backlit being useless especially during the day as the contrast makes the markers on the keys nonexistent. I've seen that there are lots of folks who haven't been able to turn the brightness down or even off. I have your solution.. using the alt key plus the up or down brightness key will turn it up or all the way off. I have found this to be quite useful as the only complaint that I have had thus far is this problem. But no more! Alt key plus the brightness key (up or down depending on what you're after) and you're good! I'm using it all the way off right now with only the screen brightness being just fine. The screen is halfway up. Give that a try before you seek to write it off as useless. I hope this has helped!

review_title: STOPPED WORKING- HAVEN'T HAD IT 2 MONTHS
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2023
review_text: I received this laptop on January 4,2023, and by February 18,2023 it stopped working. It doesn't come on and it doesn't charge. Right before it went I out, I had just looked at the battery percentage which was at 57%. I tried contacting the seller, and got no response. But before contacting the seller, I contacted ASUS and the warranty on the laptop expired last year, so there was nothing that they could do about it. This was labeled as being new and I really think that it was refurbished. I contacted Amazon and they informed me that it was unable to be returned because it was past the return window. I waited 2 days for the seller to respond. Because I don't want a refund, I would just like for the laptop to be exchanged for one that actually works. I ended up contacting Amazon again, and they were able to provide me with a full refund, but will be charged a restocking fee, which they promised will be refunded once the item is received. If I knew that this laptop would come with no warranty/expired warranty and that the seller would do NOTHING to help, I would've never purchased this laptop. I was able to have this resolved due to Amazon-NOT THE SELLER! I'm now back to shopping around for another laptop, but Thank God that I was able to get this resolved, and will definitely will be purchasing something better this time.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
review_text: This chromebook is fantastic and was such a bargain too.  I love it!! It is perfect for all my needs.  The keys are a little hard to see unless you dim your light source and then it's perfect!!  Also, very fast delivery!

review_title: Tried Chromebook instead of Laptop--BIG Mistake!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2022
review_text: I'm a senior lady who is 71 years old.  I have used computers my whole adult life.  When I ordered this Chromebook instead of my usual purchases in the past of Laptops, I did so by reading what the differences were between the two, then I spoke with my son-in-law about the differences and got the impression that there was not that much difference.  I just received my Chromebook four days ago.  I was surprised at how nice it was.  Very heavy to me at first, compared to all other Laptops I've used, but as I'm using it, it does not fall off my lap when I move a little!  I am going to keep this in mind when I find the right Laptop for me. This Chromebook in my opinion, is one of great quality!  Quite solid and sturdy!  I have two favorite things on this Chromebook.  One is the screen!  It is so clear, very colorful, easy to read. It is the BEST SCREEN I have ever used!  The Touch Screen is more precise when using it as a laptop.  For example, ones I have used in the past, have always been difficult to select the exact spot where you want the cursor to be!  I would need to select, go back, select again, go back, the line, the letter, the number.  I don't know if it's due to the clarity of the screen or if it's programming, but not having to constantly select and re-select over and over again, is a blessing!  The fact in which you can fold this  screen over and work on it as a tablet is great!  What I don't necessarily like is how "touchy" it is.  When I folded it over and started using it as a tablet, My hands, in holding it to use as tablet, kept touching the on/off button on the side.I would touch the enter keys and shift keys and kept ending up somewhere that I didn't want to be!  This Chromebook said one of the features was a "backlit keyboard".  If it is, it is a very poor one! I could see somelighting underneath the keys, but the letters and numbers on the keys do not light up with this!  What good is some lighting underneath if it doesn't light up the actual letters/numbers?  I'm also frustrated with this Chromebook that the keyboard is too simple!  With a Laptop, I could switch between screens I had opened by using the Alt Key with the Tab key. Not on Chromebook!  If I wanted to type a word fully in caps, I just had to touch the Shift Key. Not on Chromebook!For those who learned and worked on a Chromebook in the past, I believe this would be a good one to try,really feels very solid and sturdy.  For me, I'm going to be returning this one and keep researching for the best inexpensive Laptop I can get. I will be sending it back for a refund and keep looking for the Laptop I'm use to.

review_title: Stylus WORTHLESS, Chrome Operating System flawed - keyboard backlight weak
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2022
review_text: Ok, I realized going in that Chrome was oftentimes complained about and that this is a Chrome machine.  I am not saying that Chrome is a crummy system, in fact, I find this computer runs Chrome fast and with very few hiccups.  The problem is Chrome will not do many things I have come to expect from Windows or MS DOS [or whatever it’s now called].  It is fast and every halfway normal operation can be accomplished.  But problems do arise. For example, I can put my own photo in as wallpaper for the opening menu but I can’t manipulate it.  My photo was too large for the screen and that couldn’t be adjusted.  I had to use their supplied pictures.  Not a big deal, but that ability was something I expected and was stunned when the program refused to do it.  There are several other “what’s going on “ moments, but I think you get the idea.This machine is fast.  I surfed the web with no problems, looked all over Amazon, read books with numerous graphs and complex pictures, and looked over a few of my own photos without difficulty.  The ASUS did load Google Documents and Documents then loaded my document files from the iCloud in nothing flat.  To augment the internal memory I added a 256 gb microchip which was instantly recognized; however, I had to jump through some hoops when I realized nothing was being saved or moved to the chip.  I found the needed adjustment in settings and I was moving ahead again.  I really enjoy being able to add memory to the computer with a chip.  I think this is a major advantage over machines that don’t have this capability.The machine does have a few problems that might be considered deal killers to other people. First, the keyboard is not good. It is difficult to type on and this resulted in numerous corrections having to be made. I have actually purchased another keyboard from logitech that hooks up to this computer by Bluetooth. Once this keyboard was successfully paired I was able to begin typing on what I consider to be a standard keyboard and many of my errors disappeared. I think the keyboard is a big problem with this computer. The backlight on the keyboard is almost useless. I will note that when the back light is at a low setting it is extremely difficult to see the keys.  You can increase the brightness by pressing the alt key and then pressing the increase brightness key on the function keys across the top. The keyboard will increase substantially in brightness; however, I find that even at the brightest setting the keyboard is difficult to see. It may work well in low light conditions, but in a room with regular light it is still difficult to ascertain which key is which.  An experience typist will not find this a problem, but to people like me I think it is a substantial problem.On the keyboard there is no caps lock. Why this was omitted is confusing. I find that using the caps lock is a constant undertaking. To achieve capitals the operator must press down the alt key and the little magnifying glass key then the machine will lock on cabs.The weight of the computer is nothing to sneeze at. While the number of pounds seems small, try holding it out at arms length for more than 10 seconds and you will quickly see the weight is a necessary consideration.In my opinion, the screen is sharp and easy to read.  For more demanding screen details you will have to go up in price.  Viewing movies isn’t a problem, in fact it looks quite nice.I have saved the worst for last.  This particular computer from ASUS does not, stress not, have a good stylus associated with it. I bought a stylus from Amazon and had to be especially careful to use the exact number for this computer because there are other models very near in number to this model and styluses that work with other models will not work with this computer. The stylus I bought does not allow one to draw on this computer. The stylus badly lags when used for drawing, and the stylus is not accurate in placing the line. This may be the computer itself and not the stylus; however, this lack of ability to accurately use a stylus is nearly a deal killer for me. I am very used to using the Apple iPad Pro 12.5 inch. Not being able to use a stylus is almost incomprehensible to me at this stage of computer development.  Having this  ASUS computer only work with a very few highly specific styluses is most disappointing.  It took me over a week to start looking for a stylus to pair with this machine. Had I known the limited availability of styluses, and the nearly usable nature of a stylus with this particular machine, I would not have purchased this laptop computer. I really enjoy drawing, and drawing on the iPad is one of my favorite hobbies. I was looking forward to being able to sketch on this ASUS computer, but I find this is impossible with this particular machine. It is unfortunate the previous reviews I read did not mention the difficulty in pairing a stylus with this computer and the horrible nature of the resulting stylus lines if a person attempted to draw.  Amazon’s return policy on computers prevents me from returning this machine. I suppose I could trade this in somewhere and try again, but that would be quite expensive. The next machine will avoid Chrome and will definitely either come with a stylus or have a good stylus readily available. A machine that I cannot draw on is an anathema to me.AD2

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
review_text: There are a number of things I don't like. 1. It does not sit flat on a flat surface. The hinges lift the device.2. It is difficult to open. I added a pair of small silicone dots to make it easier to get a nail under the lid. I used thicker rubber bumpers to lift the device so the hinges can work without lifting the device. 3. The keys are difficult to see as the letters are against a silver, not black background. I have a black lettered skin which helps...but defeats the key light and must be taken off when lit keys are useful.  Its end of use life is only 2029. The 8 gigs of ram and a decent processor are this Chromebook's strength.  For about the same money I bought the Lenovo unit I'm using to write this review. The Processor and ram are the same, but will get updates through 3031. Here is the Amazon listing: Lenovo - 2022 - IdeaPad Flex 5i - 2-in-1 Chromebook Laptop Computer | Intel Core i3-1115G4 | 13.3" FHD Touch Display | 8GB Memory | 128GB Storage | Chrome OS. It also has better sound.

review_title: Terrible support by seller and manufacturer
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2023
review_text: Screen went blank about 10 days after the Amazon warranty expired. The manufacturer (ASUS) had me take it to Best Buy and they wouldn't honor the ASUS warranty because the unit was not purchased at Best Buy. The seller (GamerLand Express) gave me instructions to try which were the same things that both I and Best Buy had done multiple times. Now they won't respond to my request to replace the computer under the 12 month manufacturer warranty. Use caution when dealing with either ASUS or GamerLand Express.I returned the unit to GamerLand Express. They reported previous damage and said that ASUS would not honor the warranty. No one identified any damage, provided any pictures or any proof of damage. This company should not be allowed to sell on Amazon as all they have done is given me the runaround concerning this computer. They would get zero stars if that was allowed.

review_title: The Least Impressive Chromebook I've Used to Date....
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2022
review_text: First off the bat, the audio is nearly useless without the 'Ears,' plug-in for Chrome, which allows you to EQ and boost the volume to a suitable level for content consumption.Next, with battery life being one of the main selling points of Chrome OS, you'd expect this device to fare well. Why wouldn't you? I mean, my previous Chromebook was an even older model from Asus and it easily gave me 10-12 hours on a single charge.Not so with this device. You're lucky if you get 3 or 4.Finally, the keyboard backlight automatically engages upon booting up. This isn't something which can be customized in settings, and it generally makes the letters highly illegible. So, upon booting, you need to disable the function immediately, then crank up the screen brightness because it has one of the dimmest displays I've owned in ages.Luckily, I bought this only as a spare computer, since I have a MacBook for content creation.Good luck! 🤞

review_title: Its fast - everything on it works perfectly - its great for research
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2024
review_text: Its fast - everything on it works perfectly - its very easy to set up.  It does come with a lot of factory installed stuff that I had to uninstall.  But I think just about all computers are like that.  It has fantastic AI capabilities and its a very nice computer for the price.

review_title: Great little machine at a ridiculously low price!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2021
review_text: I figured 4GB of RAM would be sufficient just for day to day use. I was a bit disappointed in 128GB of storage and decided that even though it was a really nice machine for the price, for another $80 and change I could really make it fly.. if you look at my photos you can see that there's built in space for a 2.5 in SATA drive. In addition there is room to add memory and I decided to add another 8GB of RAM along with the SATA drive and 480 GB of storage. Obviously it makes a huge difference. If you look at the pictures I posted you can see that the Acer storage is depleted by half as soon as you turn the machine on. The Steve drive is the one that I installed. Plenty of storage now. The circled in red photo shows the increase in RAM... WHEN LOOKING FOR INSTRUCTIONS be aware that this model came out back in May of this year. There are very few instructional videos or written pieces to explain where this memory goes. The SATA drive is pretty self-explanatory. The only video I could find with this particular machine is provided by a user whose name is.   @Silicon Edge   you have to go to YouTube and search that name. I don't believe Amazon would allow me to post a link. It's not in English but all you have to do is watch his hands. If you try other videos you might think it's the machine you've bought until you open the back of yours and you look at the back of theirs and realize that it's different. I highly recommend temporarily taking out the screw on your right side of the battery to secure the ribbon clip. Then just readjust the battery and put the screw back in. Watch the video you'll know exactly what I mean. I love this computer. For $460 including the new ram I upgraded this machine. It would have cost me way more than that to buy it with that memory and that storage from scratch. Quick PS. I bought an HP 27 inch monitor here on Amazon and created a nice little setup. $169. You'll love the machine Don't think twice just buy it. If you want some speed, I mean real speed just upgrade the RAM and the storage. I used crucial. That's the brand name for the SATA and the RAM..... READ ABOUT THE UPGRADES..... You don't want to perform Overkill. The processor wasn't made for it. I'm no techie so I did a lot of reading before I did this.

review_title: Great Performance with Slight Screen Glare
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2023
review_text: Title: Acer Aspire 5 A515-56-36UT: Great Performance with Slight Screen GlareI recently got my hands on the Acer Aspire 5 A515-56-36UT, and overall, I've been quite satisfied with its performance. Here's my detailed review:The laptop boasts a 15.6" Full HD display, providing sharp and clear visuals that make multimedia content and work tasks enjoyable. Powered by the 11th Gen Intel Core i3-1115G4 processor, it handles everyday tasks with ease, ensuring smooth multitasking and responsive performance. The 4GB DDR4 RAM and 128GB NVMe SSD provide adequate storage space and quick data access.One notable feature is the inclusion of WiFi 6, which guarantees a fast and reliable internet connection. This is especially beneficial for those who heavily rely on online activities like streaming, video conferences, and browsing.However, it's worth mentioning that I did notice some screen glare on the laptop. In well-lit environments, particularly areas with bright overhead lighting or sunlight, there can be a slight reflection on the screen. While it didn't significantly hinder my overall experience, it's something to consider, especially if you frequently work in brightly lit spaces or are sensitive to screen glare.In terms of build quality, the Acer Aspire 5 is sturdy and well-constructed. The keyboard is comfortable to type on, and the trackpad is responsive and accurate. The laptop's slim design and lightweight nature make it easily portable, adding to its convenience.Regarding software, the Acer Aspire 5 comes with Windows 11 Home (S Mode) pre-installed, providing a streamlined and secure user experience.To summarize, the Acer Aspire 5 A515-56-36UT offers great performance and features. While there is a slight issue with screen glare in bright environments, it doesn't overshadow its overall capabilities. If you're in need of a reliable and efficient laptop for your daily tasks, this model is definitely worth considering.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2022
review_text: I've own 3 Dell laptops and would never have thought to buy another brand, however the day that I was due to purchase a new Dell, this Acer flashed up on my 'Amazon Treasure Truck' deals and I believed it was a sign. I'm so happy I bought it! A great deal! A great laptop! and boy am I happy! The only 'con' is it's not touchscreen but the 'pros' out balance this and are also too numerous to mention!!

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2022
review_text: Wanted to get a relatively cheap laptop with a 1080p screen that could do mainly basic functions like watching videos from various streaming services (Youtube/Twitch/Netflix) in Chrome. This POS can't even do that properly. RAM runs at 100% while idle because 4gb is barely enough for just the operating system to function, and just having chrome open is enough to push the CPU to 100% as well, so doing nearly anything is extremely slow. Screen is 1080p but the quality is not great. I don't know what super geniuses thought to put the cooling fan in front of the keyboard instead of on the side, but it makes it sound like a tornado whenever it is doing anything at all, even idling. Oh and also if this thing is anywhere near you while you are sleeping, be ready for the fans to rev up to max randomly, out of nowhere, while it's in sleep mode and wake you up, for no reason. Sound is also very quiet, you need to crank it up to 50/60 to hear pretty much anything.I haven't bought a laptop in a few years and I thought even cheap laptops would be able to deliver on basic functionality, but boy was I wrong. I still think the Acer Aspire 5 is a decent laptop line, just not this model. Learn from my mistake, save up and buy something that's at least $500+

review_title: Fine laptop, suits my needs perfectly but I did add memory to it.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2021
review_text: I did quite a bit of research before purchasing this laptop. It seemed like a good computer for the price. Many if the reviews said it was short on memory. It has a SSD drive but it is a bit on the small side, and the built in ram was lacking at only 4 gb. There is an open slot for ram and a space for a second hard drive already there. The company included a pack of hard drive screws with a web site to instruct you on how to install a second drive. Since I had a like new 1tb laptop drive and a 8gb memory card laying around, I waisted no time. The upgrade was simple.Honestly, I have no complaints with this laptop. Some people complained about the screen. I don't know why, it's very clear to me. Battery life is fine, but I am just a home user so I am not on it for hours at a time. The speakers point down from under the computer, but I can still hear what I need to so no big deal to me. I even don't mind the touch pad on this one (hated the one on my last computer).If you are a gamer or someone who needs a super powerful computer for intense graphics, this probably isn't your best choice. But for home use, I am very happy with this laptop and would certainly recommend it.

review_title: Dislike this machine more and more
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2022
review_text: I get it, it's cheap. So, I'll put up with having to adjust the screen so I won't get a picture that looks like a negative, and the way that the opening screen when I use my Chrome browser is sometimes really small and has to be stretched out before I can use it. I'll use earphones to hear dialog on some movies because it doesn't do well picking up very low-volume sounds, like whispers.What drives me crazy is clicking on something, and then having things go screwy because sometimes my cursor is just a cursor-image and the actual cursor has moved elsewhere, like the upper left corner of the screen, or gets hung up some where until I release it for a few seconds, or like just now, playing a game, I click on a certain area, and I get sent to the exit page, even though I didn't want the exit page, and the area I clicked is nowhere near the area you click to exit. I tried re-starting the game, but it didn't help, I tried moving to another part of the touchpad, didn't work. I can't play the game if I can't access what I'm clicking on. WTF?

review_title: Refund issues after twice returning same product
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2022
review_text: Purchased Acer laptop after a treasure truck alert for @ $300. The first one bluescreened after about a week of use. Restored to factory settings then updated and it blue screened a second time. I contacted Amazon and requested a replacement which was done very quickly. Received a replacement laptop and it again just after 2 days of use bluescreened again. I again per its instructions reset to factory specs, updated again and again... it blue screened. So that normally means there's a flaw with the equipment. This time I requested a refund for that laptop and just chose a much better laptop which costed much more. I promptly return the laptop, got the confirmation it had been returned in the system per Amazon. Unfortunately Acer has not yet updated the refund request after at least 2-3 weeks that it had been received back in and checked. I also have not received any correspondence from Acer of the status of this issue. So be veeerry careful about that particular Acer laptop and the customer service issues with Acer. I've purchased Acer products previously without any issues and the replacement equipment I again purchased an Acer which I've had no issues with. But this isnt a very comforting response I'm getting from Acer's customer service.**Updated 05/09/22** After I reached out to an Amazon representative they immediately offered a full refund. The representative was very helpful and within minutes the refund was processing.

review_text: Good buy and meets my needs. There was a small problem with the charging system but they resolved the issue in a timely matter. review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2023
review_text: I love what you get for the price! However when I plugged in my Logitech c920 webcam and installed the latest Windows updates the next time I rebooted I had no audio and no webcam video. Windows said there were no audio devices installed. Whether I plugged in my external USB speaker, USB headphones, or just used the laptop speaker it told me the same thing. I reinstalled and tried different drivers but nothing fixed it... until I installed Windows 10. Now everything works great. Hopefully the next Windows 11 update will fix the problem.UPDATE: I decided that being stuck on Windows 10 with no more updates wasn't a good idea. After contacting Acer tech support they had me send them the laptop for repairs. I just got it back and all they did was reinstall Windows 11. That worked until I ran Windows Update and downloaded the latest Windows updates. Now I'm back to the same problem!! Is the solution to not get updates? Doesn't sound right to me.
