review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2024
review_text: Wow, wow and wow! I am so very elated with my purchase or a renewed Acer Chromebook 315-15 inch screen. I was so very skeptical about purchasing a renewed Chromebook. My previous Acer 315 (exact same) died after almost 3 years. I was not going to get another of the same, but by comparison it still seemed the best value. I grew so used to the large screen and even the funny keyboard layout (with the ten-key numbers on the right which I don't really use) where everything is shifted more to the left, that it feels weird to type on anything else.This Chromebook looks brand new and I would swear it must be. Perfect condition. No scratches, dents, dirt, etc. The keys are not faded. Even the intel and Acer stickers look brand new. I truly cannot believe this is renewed!  It came with a case and charger. Be forewarned though, when you first turn it on and plug in the charger it will be at 0%. But that is enough to get you going. You will not see the battery icon on the lower right panel until it begins charging, so be patient! I also get the warning that it may charge slow because it's not the correct adapter, but again that went away once it began to charge. It said it would take 9 hours from 1% but again, it went superfast to 100% in under 2 hours. I ran the diagnostics and it shows the battery life is new, never before fully recharged or recycled. Wow, just wow....that is truly awesome as Amazons description said it would be maybe 80%.Set up was super easy, about 4 steps that you just click through. One thing I love about Google is that it stores your credentials so you just need your email and it's done. All my tabs, extensions and bookmarks came right back. I tested the sound and Bluetooth both are perfect! WiFi is super-fast and I honestly cannot say enough good things about this Chromebook. Kudos to the company and techs that refurbished it. They did an outstanding job. My other Chromebook was the exact same except it was 2000. This one is 2023 and I saved over $100 getting a refurb. Also my old one listed the screen at 15.6, but I measure both and each is exactly 15 inches. This Chromebook is also a little lighter but still made with metal and not plastic.In conclusion, I know some people have had bad experiences with refurb items especially computers, but I have to say this was the best first time experience for me. It all felt brand new like when I bought my previous one-- and in fact even better with some not so obvious upgrades in three years time, but definitely a faster more efficient processor and comparable but lighter weight parts/materials. I think it depends a lot on the company. If they have good integrity, morals and ethics they will not sell or ship faulty products. Again, hats off to the company and employees. Thank you! I highly recommend this Chromebook from you.

review_text: I bought this laptop for basic work. I used it for three days before I started having network connection issues. I would be connected to the internet, then randomly unable to connect to the network for about 15 seconds. This would occur randomly but inconveniently during zoom calls. (I have 2 gig internet speeds and was only using my phone at the time so it wasn't because of other devices bogging down the connection speed.After five days of having the laptop, it started to randomly freeze. I would be forced to reboot manually after using the laptop for an hour. My point of decision for returning the laptop was when at startup, I would get a message saying windows failed to restart. The computer was telling me to reinstall windows since it was unable to boot windows up.I had hope for this computer, but sadly it was not a good computer in many ways. I bought software that I'm now stuck with and unable to use unless I buy a new laptop. I would have given it a chance if it hadn't been having major issues within the first week of owning this laptop.

review_title: I love my chromebook! Just a couple caveats
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2023
review_text: I've owned chromebook for 10 months now and I just love it! Here's some updates after using if for awhile:1) Screen flickering: this is a problem but not long term. Also, if you just close the computer and reopen it, the screen will stop flickering.2) Battery life: very long, and it only takes me about 35 minutes to get a full recharge. This hasn't been a problem for me!What I don't like:-Keyboard lighting: the keyboard is so easy to use and works well. But the blacklisting is not bright and the silver keys with white letters makes it difficult to see the letters...unless yours in a dark place 🤔The keyboard is my biggest pet peeve but if yourve memorized your keys/placements you'll be fine. I just wish they had done black ink on the letters of thr keyboard so they were really clear and seen well.Another pet peeve:Chrome books are difficult to connect to printers. Most home printers are compatible with Apple or PC computers. My printer had a hard time connecting via wifi. It never quite worked. I'm going to get a different printer.Everything else I love...Including the compatibility with Goole products, but even non Google apps or products connect well with it. It's such a user friendly operating system and runs so smoothly!

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2021
review_text: Having always used "Windows", and therefore completely new to Chromebook, it is a definate learning curve.  I feel hampered as I've only ever used Microsoft type computers and being elderly may have slowed my learning speed.I will try to update this review as time goes by.My old laptop was extremely slow and I was looking for something different and speedy.First impressions after having a Chromebook for 1 week:-It is FAST.  Pages load really fast!-It was easy to transfer all my data & settings from my old computer, thanks to using Chrome in past years.All my photos are there.  The Chromebook shows you how and guides the process.-The keyboard lighting CAN be brightened to improve key visibility.  This was one of my big concerns as many reviews mention it.  The key were hard to see due to the low lighting at first.  I didn't find a reference to it on the Chromebook at first and needed a quick fix.  A search on Google showed me how.  I followed the instructions and now I can see the keys very well in normal household lighting.-It is a learning curve to learn the keyboard shortcuts.  I am jotting down notes in a notebook.-There is a Chromebook simulator for learning.-It has a easy, sensitive touchscreen.-Screen brightness is easy to adjust.-No detectable heat output.-Battery lasts a long time.-Tablet mode:  Open it completely until the two outside surfaces touch and it is completely flat.  The touchscreen is quite responsive.- Any questions I have regarding how to use this Chromebook can be easily answered by a quick Google search.- The screen comes on instantly when opening, if I don't turn the Chromebook off.  Navigation icons are at the bottom of the screen.Still learning; will update.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2023
review_text: It’s beneficial while I’m off of work due to a work injury, but the speakers seem to have lost their loudness. Seems like after each use the speakers get lower and lower on sound. I’ve never gone past half on how loud I have it because the speakers were good; now I have to connect to a speaker via Bluetooth, to get sound to come through. Other than that the system works great! It isn’t slow or anything can work with my systems from work. Love it!

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2021
review_text: If you want a laptop with a nice-sized screen, 360 rotation, and touchscreen it's a great laptop at a great price. I've had mine for 3 months now with no issues. I use it for college and a charge lasts me all day until I get back to my dorm. If I don't use it much over the weekend say an hour a day then a full charge will last all weekend. The only downside is that the touch screen is capacitive and not active. If you want to write a lot of notes on your laptop and you can spare another hundred or so get the C436 it has an active screen. My notes are really sloppy and it's not the easiest but it works fine and I only use it in lectures to make annotations on pdfs and then take notes on paper when I get back to my dorm. I wouldn't use it for notes all the time because of that. But for the price it's the best all around for what it offers.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2022
review_text: I got this for use at work as we got new ePCR software and were handed iPADS without physical keyboards and I just couldn't do it. That being said.. I use it at home also! This machine has turned out to be a great overall device. The display is nice and bright. It's fast.. and the battery life will last well into 2 days in a single charge! The fact that it starts up in seconds is a plus as I can do what I need to do and shut it completely down and be back up in a moment's notice. The keyboard took some getting used to.I have seen folks mentioning that the keyboard being backlit being useless especially during the day as the contrast makes the markers on the keys nonexistent. I've seen that there are lots of folks who haven't been able to turn the brightness down or even off. I have your solution.. using the alt key plus the up or down brightness key will turn it up or all the way off. I have found this to be quite useful as the only complaint that I have had thus far is this problem. But no more! Alt key plus the brightness key (up or down depending on what you're after) and you're good! I'm using it all the way off right now with only the screen brightness being just fine. The screen is halfway up. Give that a try before you seek to write it off as useless. I hope this has helped!

review_title: STOPPED WORKING- HAVEN'T HAD IT 2 MONTHS
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2023
review_text: I received this laptop on January 4,2023, and by February 18,2023 it stopped working. It doesn't come on and it doesn't charge. Right before it went I out, I had just looked at the battery percentage which was at 57%. I tried contacting the seller, and got no response. But before contacting the seller, I contacted ASUS and the warranty on the laptop expired last year, so there was nothing that they could do about it. This was labeled as being new and I really think that it was refurbished. I contacted Amazon and they informed me that it was unable to be returned because it was past the return window. I waited 2 days for the seller to respond. Because I don't want a refund, I would just like for the laptop to be exchanged for one that actually works. I ended up contacting Amazon again, and they were able to provide me with a full refund, but will be charged a restocking fee, which they promised will be refunded once the item is received. If I knew that this laptop would come with no warranty/expired warranty and that the seller would do NOTHING to help, I would've never purchased this laptop. I was able to have this resolved due to Amazon-NOT THE SELLER! I'm now back to shopping around for another laptop, but Thank God that I was able to get this resolved, and will definitely will be purchasing something better this time.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
review_text: This chromebook is fantastic and was such a bargain too.  I love it!! It is perfect for all my needs.  The keys are a little hard to see unless you dim your light source and then it's perfect!!  Also, very fast delivery!

review_title: Tried Chromebook instead of Laptop--BIG Mistake!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2022
review_text: I'm a senior lady who is 71 years old.  I have used computers my whole adult life.  When I ordered this Chromebook instead of my usual purchases in the past of Laptops, I did so by reading what the differences were between the two, then I spoke with my son-in-law about the differences and got the impression that there was not that much difference.  I just received my Chromebook four days ago.  I was surprised at how nice it was.  Very heavy to me at first, compared to all other Laptops I've used, but as I'm using it, it does not fall off my lap when I move a little!  I am going to keep this in mind when I find the right Laptop for me. This Chromebook in my opinion, is one of great quality!  Quite solid and sturdy!  I have two favorite things on this Chromebook.  One is the screen!  It is so clear, very colorful, easy to read. It is the BEST SCREEN I have ever used!  The Touch Screen is more precise when using it as a laptop.  For example, ones I have used in the past, have always been difficult to select the exact spot where you want the cursor to be!  I would need to select, go back, select again, go back, the line, the letter, the number.  I don't know if it's due to the clarity of the screen or if it's programming, but not having to constantly select and re-select over and over again, is a blessing!  The fact in which you can fold this  screen over and work on it as a tablet is great!  What I don't necessarily like is how "touchy" it is.  When I folded it over and started using it as a tablet, My hands, in holding it to use as tablet, kept touching the on/off button on the side.I would touch the enter keys and shift keys and kept ending up somewhere that I didn't want to be!  This Chromebook said one of the features was a "backlit keyboard".  If it is, it is a very poor one! I could see somelighting underneath the keys, but the letters and numbers on the keys do not light up with this!  What good is some lighting underneath if it doesn't light up the actual letters/numbers?  I'm also frustrated with this Chromebook that the keyboard is too simple!  With a Laptop, I could switch between screens I had opened by using the Alt Key with the Tab key. Not on Chromebook!  If I wanted to type a word fully in caps, I just had to touch the Shift Key. Not on Chromebook!For those who learned and worked on a Chromebook in the past, I believe this would be a good one to try,really feels very solid and sturdy.  For me, I'm going to be returning this one and keep researching for the best inexpensive Laptop I can get. I will be sending it back for a refund and keep looking for the Laptop I'm use to.

review_title: Stylus WORTHLESS, Chrome Operating System flawed - keyboard backlight weak
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2022
review_text: Ok, I realized going in that Chrome was oftentimes complained about and that this is a Chrome machine.  I am not saying that Chrome is a crummy system, in fact, I find this computer runs Chrome fast and with very few hiccups.  The problem is Chrome will not do many things I have come to expect from Windows or MS DOS [or whatever it’s now called].  It is fast and every halfway normal operation can be accomplished.  But problems do arise. For example, I can put my own photo in as wallpaper for the opening menu but I can’t manipulate it.  My photo was too large for the screen and that couldn’t be adjusted.  I had to use their supplied pictures.  Not a big deal, but that ability was something I expected and was stunned when the program refused to do it.  There are several other “what’s going on “ moments, but I think you get the idea.This machine is fast.  I surfed the web with no problems, looked all over Amazon, read books with numerous graphs and complex pictures, and looked over a few of my own photos without difficulty.  The ASUS did load Google Documents and Documents then loaded my document files from the iCloud in nothing flat.  To augment the internal memory I added a 256 gb microchip which was instantly recognized; however, I had to jump through some hoops when I realized nothing was being saved or moved to the chip.  I found the needed adjustment in settings and I was moving ahead again.  I really enjoy being able to add memory to the computer with a chip.  I think this is a major advantage over machines that don’t have this capability.The machine does have a few problems that might be considered deal killers to other people. First, the keyboard is not good. It is difficult to type on and this resulted in numerous corrections having to be made. I have actually purchased another keyboard from logitech that hooks up to this computer by Bluetooth. Once this keyboard was successfully paired I was able to begin typing on what I consider to be a standard keyboard and many of my errors disappeared. I think the keyboard is a big problem with this computer. The backlight on the keyboard is almost useless. I will note that when the back light is at a low setting it is extremely difficult to see the keys.  You can increase the brightness by pressing the alt key and then pressing the increase brightness key on the function keys across the top. The keyboard will increase substantially in brightness; however, I find that even at the brightest setting the keyboard is difficult to see. It may work well in low light conditions, but in a room with regular light it is still difficult to ascertain which key is which.  An experience typist will not find this a problem, but to people like me I think it is a substantial problem.On the keyboard there is no caps lock. Why this was omitted is confusing. I find that using the caps lock is a constant undertaking. To achieve capitals the operator must press down the alt key and the little magnifying glass key then the machine will lock on cabs.The weight of the computer is nothing to sneeze at. While the number of pounds seems small, try holding it out at arms length for more than 10 seconds and you will quickly see the weight is a necessary consideration.In my opinion, the screen is sharp and easy to read.  For more demanding screen details you will have to go up in price.  Viewing movies isn’t a problem, in fact it looks quite nice.I have saved the worst for last.  This particular computer from ASUS does not, stress not, have a good stylus associated with it. I bought a stylus from Amazon and had to be especially careful to use the exact number for this computer because there are other models very near in number to this model and styluses that work with other models will not work with this computer. The stylus I bought does not allow one to draw on this computer. The stylus badly lags when used for drawing, and the stylus is not accurate in placing the line. This may be the computer itself and not the stylus; however, this lack of ability to accurately use a stylus is nearly a deal killer for me. I am very used to using the Apple iPad Pro 12.5 inch. Not being able to use a stylus is almost incomprehensible to me at this stage of computer development.  Having this  ASUS computer only work with a very few highly specific styluses is most disappointing.  It took me over a week to start looking for a stylus to pair with this machine. Had I known the limited availability of styluses, and the nearly usable nature of a stylus with this particular machine, I would not have purchased this laptop computer. I really enjoy drawing, and drawing on the iPad is one of my favorite hobbies. I was looking forward to being able to sketch on this ASUS computer, but I find this is impossible with this particular machine. It is unfortunate the previous reviews I read did not mention the difficulty in pairing a stylus with this computer and the horrible nature of the resulting stylus lines if a person attempted to draw.  Amazon’s return policy on computers prevents me from returning this machine. I suppose I could trade this in somewhere and try again, but that would be quite expensive. The next machine will avoid Chrome and will definitely either come with a stylus or have a good stylus readily available. A machine that I cannot draw on is an anathema to me.AD2

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
review_text: There are a number of things I don't like. 1. It does not sit flat on a flat surface. The hinges lift the device.2. It is difficult to open. review_title: Nice laptop - Crashes Modems/Routers with no fix
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2021
review_text: Pros: Nice build and feel, great speakers, simple setup, great valueCons: Within a few minutes of connecting to my wifi, it killed the internet connections to all other devices including its own connection. We have a rather common modem/router, the Arris panoramic models you get on rental from Comcast or Cox, in the west.After working with Amazon and then HP support, it became evident the issue is a modem driver within the computer needing to be updated. HP support claimed it was a known issue with my router/modem -- yet they didn't troubleshoot it and didn't ask which manufacturer/model device I had. In theory, the problem (a driver) is fixable..... if you can get the driver downloaded and added to the computer. In this case, this chromebook does not have an ethernet port -- so there's no actual way to install the driver and address the problem without loading it on a USB drive, downloaded from another computer, or sending in the computer for repair.Summary: You may have a modem or router that doesn't conflict or have a driver issue and be perfectly fine. I wasn't able to experience much beyond the handful of minutes it would be connected. However, there's no way to know in advance if you will encounter this problem or not. If you're willing to risk it and have the time to a) work with support or find/load the driver yourself, and/or b) return the device (stick to the 30 day window), then proceed with caution. Otherwise, I recommend passing on this and going with something else.For reference, in our situation we ended up going with a Lenovo C340 Chromebook for just a little bit more money with a better processor, more RAM, bigger screen (a flipable touchscreen). My router/model and internet connection have been fine with the Lenovo.

review_title: A good alternative to a laptop
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2023
review_text: ChromebookOS is not as elegant and versatile as Windows 10/11 and overall when I need to do serious work I still go back to Windows and Microsoft Office 365.I'm not a great fan of Google.  GMAIL is messy and Google Drive is inferior to OneDrive and I don't like that Google made me have a Gmail account, etc.Until I learn more, I still prefer Microsoft OS and products.  But I do like the Chromebook for it quick boot up, size etc.  The ACER 311 with touch screen, etc is nice.  The ability to fold it backwards into a tablet is a worthy feature although I don't use it that way often.  But I don't like the fact that as a tablet it rests on the keyboard.The battery life is good - at least all day or more - and it recharges quickly.  When I take it to work I have a power cable in my bag, but have never had to use it.I wish it had a second USB-A port and an SD card port, but I bought a multi-port expansion hub that, although a bit inconvenient, meets my needs.A good device for the price.  I have two of them: one stays at home and the other one travels.  One convenient feature of ChromebookOS is that when both are logged in to the same Google account, they both nearly replicate each other and "look" and function nearly the same.

review_title: Better than my previous Asus Chromebook
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2023
review_text: Though it looks exactly like my previous Asus Chromebook (model C101P) which reached its AUE, there's one major difference with this Acer model. And that's the battery's life which is pretty amazing. After being fully charged, this item keeps working for days which I consider a real plus. Other than that, I haven't encountered any problems with it yet. The touchscreen feature also works well. Highly recommended.UPDATE: I've had the Chromebook for almost three weeks now and today the screen suddenly froze leaving all keys and the pointer inoperable. Turning the power on and off had no effect. I'm sure others know the fix for this dilemma but I learned that simply pushing the ESC key (top row, fourth in from the left) and the power key simultaneously instantly solves the problem. Hopefully, it won't happen again but at least I know how to deal with it.

review_title: Very pleased with this purchase.  Worthy successor to Spectre
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2023
review_text: Bought this machine to succeed my beloved Spectre with a 6th gen i7.  As a renewed item, it is nearly perfect, with only the tiniest nick where you don't see it.  The machine specs exceed it's predecessor by a healthy margin, the screen is bigger in a very similar body size, and the performance is great!Being a business machine, it lacks a micro-SD slot, but it does come with a fingerprint sensor which works nicely to log in with. The keyboard is fabulous, the touchscreen is beautiful, and the touchpad perfect.  And the sound is WOW for volume and clarity.  And they put the power key on the left edge where it belongs, and NOT on the keyboard where the delete key belongs.The charger is just weird - a black box with a 4 foot long fat wire attached to the middle of one edge and another slightly less fat 4 foot wire coming out at the middle of the opposite side.  Not sleek or easy to pack up.  Wouldn't have been a design I'd be really proud to create,  but it works and charges quickly.  Charging is USB PD -I think 65 watts.This machine was a great value, coming in at 1/3 the cost of my last machine.  The company that supplied it packaged it well and got it to me 2 days ahead of estimate arrival date (hooray!)No complaints or regrets!  I'd get another one if I had a reason.

review_title: Two nonfunctional ones  in a row
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2023
review_text: I was excited about this computer because of the low price and the good specs. It didn't bother me that it was refurbished because I have had descent success with refurbished in the past.The FIRST ONE I had a NON-FUNCTIONING CAMERA. When we were setting up the computer for face recognition, all it showed was snow where the picture was supposed to be. We confirmed it by going into the camera program and it also showed snow and no picture. The computer also had a large dent on the front corner where it had obviously been dropped hard. Not exactly what I would call "excellent condition". We contacted Amazon (5 stars for Amazon for their customer service) for a replacement and they gave us a pre-paid return shipping label and shipped a new one. Really painless.The SECOND ONE that we received had a column of KEYS THAT DIDN'T WORK (8ik,). This is a common way that laptop keyboards fail. At that point, it seemed obvious to me that the company selling these computers has some QUALITY CONTROL ISSUES. These are not hard to find issues if they had actually checked the computers. I don't mind testing computers (I've done all things computers for many years), but I shouldn't be somebody else's free tester.I decided to get a refund and go elsewhere. But the seller sent me a POSTAGE REQUIRED shipping label. I had two bad computers sold to me. I should not have to pay the shipping for the company's mistake! I tried multiple times for two days to call the company to try to resolve this, but the PHONE WAS ALWAYS BUSY. That doesn't give me a lot of confidence in this company. They are either overwhelmed with customer complaints or don't have good customer service. In the end, I ended up paying to send it back.I'M NOT BUYING AGAIN from this company. In my opinion, you are better off doing what I did and paying $100 more to buy it from Best Buy where the quality control is better.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2024
review_text: I've purchased at least five (5) of these, they work great and give you impressive value for money.one of them arrived with a non textured version (I personally like it better, but looks more dated) but with the same specs.One of them arrived with an internal problem where it shuts down when I move it, and i have to restart it. (It's extremely sensitive, even small vibrations shut it down). however reddit and HP support suggested it might be a loose internal component.I've Filed the claim with Amazon and received a full refund, and I intend to re-purchase the same laptop as soon as the Refund gets filed. they are nice, small, compact and very lightweight.Great Refurbished product, but remember, you are buying Refurbished, there is always an added risk.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2023
review_text: I couldn't be happier with this purchase. Everything works as described. Honestly, if this is a truly renewed product, it wasn't used for very long before being traded in. I would dare say that this machine is new. The battery life is exceptional. The screen is a force to be reckoned with.. I haven't had to turn it up past the lowest setting unless using it during the day at work. This machine handles tasks well.. even multitasking. Very fast and efficient laptop. If anything changes I will update this review.Update, 01/21/2023:  I must say that after a few days of this little guy being a daily driver I am nothing short of amazed. Perhaps I could feel this way because I've used a chromebook for the past two years and a Dell Latitude 7404 before that with an old intel core i5 w/8gb of ram running windows 10 pro? All I really do is Media/music/simple web browsing, occasional shopping and cloud based EMS software/apps for work and am the polar opposite of a "power user" who plays games and does host of other high demand things.. but nevertheless, for those activities that I engage in with my trust sidekick here, it has been a world of difference from what I am used to. I'm still learning the layout of Windows 11 (it upgraded for free the day after I purchased this laptop) but have not had a bad experience or any trouble yet. Very much worth it at this point. As far as I'm concerned, for my little world, worth its weight in gold! As always.. I will update with any more good news and/or mishaps. God bless..  :)

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2023
review_text: I do QA testing for K-12 student use of testing and assessment applications used across my state.  I try to duplicate what students have on hand so I can best replicate their usage environment.  The Samsung CB actually worked too well.  It performed better than some of the devices I was seeking to replicate.  Response to the applications prompts was quick and screen resolution was sharp and displayed the assessment content clearly.  The accommodations components, visual enhancements and the text to speech reader were excellent and performed very well.  Outside of the QA work, this device streamed Internet content very well and the audio was clear.  Access to and performance of Google Apps and O365 Apps did very well and I found no issues.  The audio jack can handle headphones/mic combo. Battery life was good as well, lasting over 6 hours of continual pounding and high end development use.  This is my 2nd Samsung CB.  The first lasted 5+ years and held up to a lot of development use.  I see this new unit doing the same.

review_title: Minor issues, but clean and working
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2023
review_text: These rugged Latitude 5414s are in good working order.  I bought two of them for field employees.  ONE out of two had some minor scratches and blemishes, but barely noticeable.  They came preloaded with Windows 10, but the software used to load and parititon were not recognizable to me.  Also, it was the 1903 version so outdated and unsupported.  So I opted to reload everything with a base copy of Win10 22H2.  Everything loaded fine.  Had to change the BIOS to load from external USB in EUFI mode.  No big deal there.  Screens were clean and scratch free.  All keyboard keys and touch pads were very clean and in working order.  Touch screen works great.The only other thing is that I am guessing one of these motherboards must have been replaced during the "renewing" process.  Upon reload, one of the laptops automatically activated its Windows digital license, whereas the other did not have one.  So I had to purchase an OEM Win10 key to activate the second one (not a big expense).  Othe than the issues mentioned above, everything works great.All is as described in the description.  I would buy from them again.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2024
review_text: Update - Been a few weeks since I first used the laptop but today I wanted to install some additional software.  It's a BUST, B and N keys no longer work.  So, this laptop worked for approximately four hours and now, unless I can figure how to get the B and N keys to work, it's a door stop.Up front I wanted to say it's my fault.  I was looking for a small rugged Windows computer to use with a few mechanic programs - mainly ForScan.  Since I would take it while traveling it had to be tough, resistant to dust, not too heavy, and a screen I could see in sunlight.  This Dell has almost all of my needs - it is definitely tough.  It has dust ports covering everything.  It appears the battery and perhaps HHD are also accessible from each side.  I'm guessing it's the battery and HHD but with no manual, I could be wrong.  I used the Dell for the first time yesterday and after an long setup time; not blaming the Dell but trying to get through Windows caused me to reboot the laptop three times when Microsoft froze.  After setup and some personal software installed, I used the Dell on battery for about 90-mins without issue.  Sitting in my truck with the sun beating in, I was able to read the screen and that was a good thing.  My only issue and it's my fault, is the Dell is larger than I was expecting.  Of course it is heavy - given it's design and construction that wasn't a surprise and since it's in my truck 90% of the time or on my work bench, I don't think the weight will be a problem.  So, after just 48-hrs of use, we are happy.  Getting ready for a four month overlanding adventure and the Dell is going along, so we'll see if I need to update my review.

review_title: Fully compatible with Linux, serves as Pi-hole DNS server and backup PC
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2023
review_text: Besides my new, bold red laptop, there were a few items inside the box. I found a small, black wired USB mouse, a white charging adapter, a clear, washable keyboard protector and a short user manual.The laptop is thin and weighs below 4 pounds. It has four rubberized feet in each corner at the bottom side that slightly elevate it, so air can circulate beneath. The keyboard is red as well with white characters, has a keypad and many functions have to be called with the Fn button. However, it does have its own Volume control buttons. What I miss is lights for the keys. Yet, it has three indicator lights right above the keyboard on the left for Power On, Caps Lock and Num Lock.The touchpad is large and has a different tone of red. It makes a click sound when I press on it. It supports multThe 16 inch display has a resolution of 1920×1200. Its aspect ratio is 16:10, which is slightly wider than 16:9 but it’s a difference I can notice, especially when I’m working with office apps. I can tilt the screen up to 180 degrees. I find the colors are displayed accurately and lively. I can set the brightness with my keyboard or through the operating system.There are seven ports in total. On the right side are three ports: one USB 3.0, one headphone jack, on SD card slot. What I find curious is that there’s a small rectangular opening. I thought that would be another port but I couldn’t find any reference in the user manual. Yet, in the listing itself I could find a picture that labels it as lock but I could not find any more information on how to use that lock and what it actually locks. Maybe somebody can tell. Anyway, on the left side, there are four ports: again one USB 3.0, DC power, HDMI, and a type C USB port.On the bottom, I have quick access to the 512 GB SSD and HDD bay. With quick access I mean I don’t have to open up the whole laptop. I just have to unscrew to screws to remove the cover of the SSD; the same goes for the HDD bay.That said, I added a 2.5 inch 320 GB Seagate Hard Drive to the laptop and installed Debian 12 Bookworm. The installation of the second operating system went through without errors and I could boot into my new Linux OS in seconds. I encountered no hardware compatibility issues.By the way, secure boot was off by default and I haven’t changed anything in the BIOS which has been released by AMI on March 29, 2023.I also booted into the pre-installed OS, which is Windows 11. The first boot took long because I had to go through the first time setup and in the beginning, browsing wasn’t fast because Windows downloaded tons of updates. Yet, after the update, web browsing got back to normal.When I opened the task manager, I checked the performance tab and indeed, the laptop has 12 GB installed. However, what baffled me was that task manager listed open RAM slots. So, I opened up the command prompt and issued the following command: wmic memphysical get MaxCapacity. That told me the maximum RAM capacity the laptop can handle. I don’t remember the exact number but it was over 12 GB. So, I decided to open up the laptop to just find out there were no empty memory slots and the pre-installed memory is soldered together. In short, no way to add more RAM. Still, the RAM is decent enough for daily work. It’s 12 GB DDR4 SDRAM at 2400 Mhz.When I opened up the laptop, I could also see that it has a 38 watts battery. Fully charged, the battery lasts me slightly over six hours with a few applications open and viewing a few videos.The processor is an Intel Celeron Processor N5095 that was released in the first quarter of 2021 according to Intel’s website. I can do basic tasks like web browsing, email, office like powerpoint with it. It has four cores and can boost up to 2.9 GHz, which is enough power for most everyday tasks.When it comes to sound, the audio is ok as there are two speakers for stereo. However, I prefer to use my headset as I like to listen to songs at high volume. The built-in microphone captures sound clearly but I often end up using my headset’s mic but in either case, I can’t tell much difference. Recordings from both sound almost identical.The webcam’s resolution is ok but my face appears paler than in real life and movements show up slightly delayed. It’s also not compatible with Windows Hello’s face unlock feature. However, I don’t care as I will primarily use the laptop with Debian and rarely, if ever, use Windows.The laptop also has Bluetooth 4.2. I could pair it to my soundbar that I mainly use for my smart TV. I didn’t encounter any delays.I was able to connect my laptop to my home network using both 5G and 2.4G Wi-Fi. Even though it does not have an Ethernet port built-in, it instantly detected my USB-C hub with Ethernet. This is important to me because I use the laptop as a private Pi-hole DNS server. A Pi-hole is a network-wide ad blocker that blocks ads on all devices on my home network.A wired connection is important for a Pi-hole DNS server because it provides a more reliable and faster connection than Wi-Fi. Wi-Fi connections can be unreliable, especially in a crowded area or if there is interference from other devices. A wired connection is less likely to be interrupted, which means that my Pi-hole DNS server will be able to block ads more consistently. In addition, a wired connection can provide a faster connection, which is important for a Pi-hole DNS server because it needs to be able to quickly respond to DNS requests. If my Pi-hole DNS server is not able to respond quickly, then I may experience delays when loading websites.In addition to being more reliable and faster, a wired connection also uses less power than Wi-Fi. This is important because my laptop is now running a Pi-hole DNS server, which requires more resources than a normal laptop. By using a wired connection, I can save power and extend the battery life of my laptop.I have configured my Debian OS so that my laptop never turns off automatically. If it runs on battery due to a power outage, I have it set to turn off when the battery level reaches 5%. Furthermore, my laptop now boots directly into shell, no GUI at all. This saves even more resources.However, in case I need to use my laptop for work, I can quickly switch back to Debian's graphical interface. The Pi-hole DNS server can keep working while I'm using the laptop as with 12 GB RAM, it's more than enough to prevent it from running out of memory.

review_title: Great Laptop for The Price w/only two real flaws
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2023
review_text: This laptop is great. Great value for the cost! The size is good, not too heavy, bright screen and great picture. Good battery life. Fast internet browsing with multiple tabs and has never crashed. Track pad works great! Fast program downloads. I wish the keyboard lit up, but it's only an issue in certain lighting. One issue I have is that the sound is terrible. It hurt my ears because it's so metallic. I don't even use it without headphones. May just be an issue with my individual laptop, but due to school, I can't send it back in to get fixed or replaced. Secondly, the laptop charger is an issue. It takes a universal charger and the wiring gets loose very easily and stops charging. I have dogs who bump into me and I'm already on my 3rd charger in 5-6 months.  I'd blame the dogs, but I've had other chargers last years despite the pups.  Overall, if the sound issue was resolved I'd absolutely love this laptop and just deal with the charger issue.

review_title: A Great PC Laptop for the Money. Very Fast.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2023
review_text: I bought the AOCWEI laptop at the beginning of last week and it arrived promptly the next day. I was very pleased at the price being so reasonable but was very interested in seeing if it would live up to the specifications that were listed for it.So far, it has been performing very well. As I already mentioned it is very fast. I know that solid state hard drives are much faster than their mechanical predecessors but this exceeded my expectations. It boots up into Windows 11 in about 14-16 seconds from being totally turned off. Various items load and folders open very quickly. It is a joy to operate from that perspective alone.The screen resolution is very good and more than adequate for my needs. For the average person that needs a solid PC that performs very well and is well built, this is an amazing fit for a modest budget. It is nice and thin, and feels very solid to hold. It is more than adequate with standard USB and USB-C ports as well as an SD card slot to expand your storage. There is also a headphone jack that is compatible with commonly available ear buds and all of these various ports are well-identified on the bottom of the laptop.This is my first experience with Windows 11 and I was pleased that it came already installed on this laptop. It was easy to set up and I am finding it to be interesting but not difficult to use after having been used to Windows 10 for so long.The warranty on this machine is probably the best I have seen for a PC laptop. I hope that I never have to use it but it is nice to know that it has a lifetime warranty available. I had to look twice when I saw that, just to be sure my eyes were not deceiving me.All in all, if you have only a modest budget, I think that you would be hard-pressed to find any other laptop that is this solid, with the memory and storage that this one has, and that performs as well as this one does for the same or less money.

review_title: Great laptop for my everyday tasks.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2023
review_text: I like this laptop because it came with the Celeron Intel N5095 processor with its 4-core configuration, it delivers seamless and smooth performance for my everyday tasks.Whether I am browsing the web, working on documents, or even watching some videos, this laptop handles it all effortlessly. Its processor can reach speeds up to 2.9GHz ensuring that I can finish my tasks quickly and efficiently.Additionally, this laptop has a 1920 x 1200 2K screen and although it isn’t 4K, it still delivers clear and well-defined images, which is good enough for me since I am mainly using this laptop for basic tasks and to watch videos.In addition, this laptop can support dual Wi-Fi, so I can be connected to two different networks simultaneously which I appreciate.Furthermore, this laptop came with 12GB RAM and 512GB SSD of storage, and it can be expanded up to 1TB SSD or 2.5” HDD.However, since I am not a gamer and neither am I using this laptop for heavy-duty work, I currently don’t need a laptop with an extremely powerful processor and way more RAM.Because I am using this laptop mainly to browse the internet, check on my social media accounts, and watching videos so this laptop fits my needs.I like that this laptop has a cooling fan, which keeps my device running smoothly even after I have been using it for many hours.Although the laptop has built-in 12GB RAM and 512GB SSD storage space, it can support up to 1TB SSD expansion, making this laptop more than capable of handling multi-application and multimedia workflows efficiently and quickly.And if in the future I need even more storage, I can expand its storage capacity to reach a 2.5” HDD or 1TB SSD. Nevertheless, the storage capacity that this laptop has now is more than enough to store my files, documents, media, and even some large applications.Therefore, I am quite pleased with my laptop because it came with a Celeron Intel N5095 processor, it works at a speed of 2.0 GHz, but it can reach speeds up to 2.9GHz, this laptop has a 4-core configuration, it is currently running on the latest Windows 11 operating system, it has a cooling fan to prevent overheating, and I can always add more SSD or HDD storage to increase its storage capacity in the future if I need to.

There are a few other settings that deal with latency as well that matters. This laptop is more than powerful enough to deal with it all from what I've seen so far.Overall, it still looks new, it's fairly light and thin, and I haven't found anything that doesn't work. As of now, I'm happy with the purchase. It's a good product at a decent price.

review_title: Nice laptop - Crashes Modems/Routers with no fix
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2021
review_text: Pros: Nice build and feel, great speakers, simple setup, great valueCons: Within a few minutes of connecting to my wifi, it killed the internet connections to all other devices including its own connection. We have a rather common modem/router, the Arris panoramic models you get on rental from Comcast or Cox, in the west.After working with Amazon and then HP support, it became evident the issue is a modem driver within the computer needing to be updated. HP support claimed it was a known issue with my router/modem -- yet they didn't troubleshoot it and didn't ask which manufacturer/model device I had. In theory, the problem (a driver) is fixable..... if you can get the driver downloaded and added to the computer. In this case, this chromebook does not have an ethernet port -- so there's no actual way to install the driver and address the problem without loading it on a USB drive, downloaded from another computer, or sending in the computer for repair.Summary: You may have a modem or router that doesn't conflict or have a driver issue and be perfectly fine. I wasn't able to experience much beyond the handful of minutes it would be connected. However, there's no way to know in advance if you will encounter this problem or not. If you're willing to risk it and have the time to a) work with support or find/load the driver yourself, and/or b) return the device (stick to the 30 day window), then proceed with caution. Otherwise, I recommend passing on this and going with something else.For reference, in our situation we ended up going with a Lenovo C340 Chromebook for just a little bit more money with a better processor, more RAM, bigger screen (a flipable touchscreen). My router/model and internet connection have been fine with the Lenovo.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2022
review_text: I'm on my second go around with this product. I had serious problems with the first one - the computer would crash a couple of times each day when it went to sleep. I returned it and purchased another. Same problem!I later found out the reason. The monitor I have it connected to is set to DisplayPort version 1.4 which these 2018 Macbooks don't support. I found an article about this but links aren't allowed here. I'm using a Samsung 49 inch ultrawide. In the monitor's menu I was able to change the DP setting to 1.2 and since having done that everything works fine.Aside from the rebooting issue, the power adapter that came with the first one was crap and didn't work after the initial charge so I went ahead and ordered a different one which cost around $30.All in all I would say the cost to value benefit of this product is pretty good. A new model with 16gb of ram, and 512gb hard drive (albeit with an M2) is around double this price. This laptop runs everything I need it to well including the latest MacOS.Physically, both laptops looked great very little noticeable wear & tear. The first one was perfect, the second one has a little mark on the bottom.

review_title: A good alternative to a laptop
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2023
review_text: ChromebookOS is not as elegant and versatile as Windows 10/11 and overall when I need to do serious work I still go back to Windows and Microsoft Office 365.I'm not a great fan of Google.  GMAIL is messy and Google Drive is inferior to OneDrive and I don't like that Google made me have a Gmail account, etc.Until I learn more, I still prefer Microsoft OS and products.  But I do like the Chromebook for it quick boot up, size etc.  The ACER 311 with touch screen, etc is nice.  The ability to fold it backwards into a tablet is a worthy feature although I don't use it that way often.  But I don't like the fact that as a tablet it rests on the keyboard.The battery life is good - at least all day or more - and it recharges quickly.  When I take it to work I have a power cable in my bag, but have never had to use it.I wish it had a second USB-A port and an SD card port, but I bought a multi-port expansion hub that, although a bit inconvenient, meets my needs.A good device for the price.  I have two of them: one stays at home and the other one travels.  One convenient feature of ChromebookOS is that when both are logged in to the same Google account, they both nearly replicate each other and "look" and function nearly the same.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2024
review_text: This is my 3rd chromebook, although it is made by Acer. My last 2 were made by Chromebook. Everything has imported very easily and set up was a snap. Much clearer screen than my previous units and I love the touchscreen. Great product for the money

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2024
review_text: Unlike my previous Acer Chromebook, this one does not open up some of my important apps right away.  When they do finally open, I get a message saying app is not responding, when it is clearly seen behind the notice.  Also, I tried to connect my wireless earbuds, but kept getting a message that there is no available device when the device is practically sitting on the keyboard. So even though Bluetooth is turned on, it's not working. The one main feature that I like is its long battery life, and it doesn't take long to charge.

review_title: Better than my previous Asus Chromebook
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2023
review_text: Though it looks exactly like my previous Asus Chromebook (model C101P) which reached its AUE, there's one major difference with this Acer model. And that's the battery's life which is pretty amazing. After being fully charged, this item keeps working for days which I consider a real plus. Other than that, I haven't encountered any problems with it yet. The touchscreen feature also works well. Highly recommended.UPDATE: I've had the Chromebook for almost three weeks now and today the screen suddenly froze leaving all keys and the pointer inoperable. Turning the power on and off had no effect. I'm sure others know the fix for this dilemma but I learned that simply pushing the ESC key (top row, fourth in from the left) and the power key simultaneously instantly solves the problem. Hopefully, it won't happen again but at least I know how to deal with it.

review_title: Very pleased with this purchase.  Worthy successor to Spectre
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2023
review_text: Bought this machine to succeed my beloved Spectre with a 6th gen i7.  As a renewed item, it is nearly perfect, with only the tiniest nick where you don't see it.  The machine specs exceed it's predecessor by a healthy margin, the screen is bigger in a very similar body size, and the performance is great!Being a business machine, it lacks a micro-SD slot, but it does come with a fingerprint sensor which works nicely to log in with. The keyboard is fabulous, the touchscreen is beautiful, and the touchpad perfect.  And the sound is WOW for volume and clarity.  And they put the power key on the left edge where it belongs, and NOT on the keyboard where the delete key belongs.The charger is just weird - a black box with a 4 foot long fat wire attached to the middle of one edge and another slightly less fat 4 foot wire coming out at the middle of the opposite side.  Not sleek or easy to pack up.  Wouldn't have been a design I'd be really proud to create,  but it works and charges quickly.  Charging is USB PD -I think 65 watts.This machine was a great value, coming in at 1/3 the cost of my last machine.  The company that supplied it packaged it well and got it to me 2 days ahead of estimate arrival date (hooray!)No complaints or regrets!  I'd get another one if I had a reason.

review_title: Two nonfunctional ones  in a row
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2023
review_text: I was excited about this computer because of the low price and the good specs. It didn't bother me that it was refurbished because I have had descent success with refurbished in the past.The FIRST ONE I had a NON-FUNCTIONING CAMERA. When we were setting up the computer for face recognition, all it showed was snow where the picture was supposed to be. We confirmed it by going into the camera program and it also showed snow and no picture. The computer also had a large dent on the front corner where it had obviously been dropped hard. Not exactly what I would call "excellent condition". We contacted Amazon (5 stars for Amazon for their customer service) for a replacement and they gave us a pre-paid return shipping label and shipped a new one. Really painless.The SECOND ONE that we received had a column of KEYS THAT DIDN'T WORK (8ik,). This is a common way that laptop keyboards fail. At that point, it seemed obvious to me that the company selling these computers has some QUALITY CONTROL ISSUES. These are not hard to find issues if they had actually checked the computers. I don't mind testing computers (I've done all things computers for many years), but I shouldn't be somebody else's free tester.I decided to get a refund and go elsewhere. But the seller sent me a POSTAGE REQUIRED shipping label. I had two bad computers sold to me. I should not have to pay the shipping for the company's mistake! I tried multiple times for two days to call the company to try to resolve this, but the PHONE WAS ALWAYS BUSY. That doesn't give me a lot of confidence in this company. They are either overwhelmed with customer complaints or don't have good customer service. In the end, I ended up paying to send it back.I'M NOT BUYING AGAIN from this company. In my opinion, you are better off doing what I did and paying $100 more to buy it from Best Buy where the quality control is better.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2024
review_text: I've purchased at least five (5) of these, they work great and give you impressive value for money.one of them arrived with a non textured version (I personally like it better, but looks more dated) but with the same specs.One of them arrived with an internal problem where it shuts down when I move it, and i have to restart it. (It's extremely sensitive, even small vibrations shut it down). however reddit and HP support suggested it might be a loose internal component.I've Filed the claim with Amazon and received a full refund, and I intend to re-purchase the same laptop as soon as the Refund gets filed. they are nice, small, compact and very lightweight.Great Refurbished product, but remember, you are buying Refurbished, there is always an added risk.

review_title: 4stars for the price and quality of a used laptop
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2023

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2023
review_text: I couldn't be happier with this purchase. Everything works as described. Honestly, if this is a truly renewed product, it wasn't used for very long before being traded in. I would dare say that this machine is new. The battery life is exceptional. The screen is a force to be reckoned with.. I haven't had to turn it up past the lowest setting unless using it during the day at work. This machine handles tasks well.. even multitasking. Very fast and efficient laptop. If anything changes I will update this review.Update, 01/21/2023:  I must say that after a few days of this little guy being a daily driver I am nothing short of amazed. Perhaps I could feel this way because I've used a chromebook for the past two years and a Dell Latitude 7404 before that with an old intel core i5 w/8gb of ram running windows 10 pro? All I really do is Media/music/simple web browsing, occasional shopping and cloud based EMS software/apps for work and am the polar opposite of a "power user" who plays games and does host of other high demand things.. but nevertheless, for those activities that I engage in with my trust sidekick here, it has been a world of difference from what I am used to. I'm still learning the layout of Windows 11 (it upgraded for free the day after I purchased this laptop) but have not had a bad experience or any trouble yet. Very much worth it at this point. As far as I'm concerned, for my little world, worth its weight in gold! As always.. I will update with any more good news and/or mishaps. God bless..  :)

review_text: I just got this MacBook today. The battery is good. It doesn’t die too quickly and it charges pretty fast. review_title: Needs work on pretty much every component.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2023
review_text: Initially this looked nearly brand new.  It had a couple tiny dings on the edges but nothing noticeable.  It worked great for a few weeks, and then the keyboard started having issues.  The keys would stick and make multiple of each letter being typed.  That issue makes writing reports a lengthy process.  We used compressed air and went through the usual trouble shooting suggestions recommendations from Apple.  The problem was not resolved.  Then the battery started dying unusually fast.  We messaged the seller, only to be told we missed our return/repair date by 1 day.  They didn't offer any suggestions or support.  We pointed out that it was one day after the return/repair deadline and that we had already taken it to the Apple store for maintenance at our own expense, and had hoped the issues would be resolved.  Unfortunately, we have to take it in to the Apple store and have the battery and the top case replaced.  Frustrating experience and definitely don't feel confident in buying from them again.

review_title: Minor issues, but clean and working
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2023
review_text: These rugged Latitude 5414s are in good working order.  I bought two of them for field employees.  ONE out of two had some minor scratches and blemishes, but barely noticeable.  They came preloaded with Windows 10, but the software used to load and parititon were not recognizable to me.  Also, it was the 1903 version so outdated and unsupported.  So I opted to reload everything with a base copy of Win10 22H2.  Everything loaded fine.  Had to change the BIOS to load from external USB in EUFI mode.  No big deal there.  Screens were clean and scratch free.  All keyboard keys and touch pads were very clean and in working order.  Touch screen works great.The only other thing is that I am guessing one of these motherboards must have been replaced during the "renewing" process.  Upon reload, one of the laptops automatically activated its Windows digital license, whereas the other did not have one.  So I had to purchase an OEM Win10 key to activate the second one (not a big expense).  Othe than the issues mentioned above, everything works great.All is as described in the description.  I would buy from them again.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2024
review_text: Update - Been a few weeks since I first used the laptop but today I wanted to install some additional software.  It's a BUST, B and N keys no longer work.  So, this laptop worked for approximately four hours and now, unless I can figure how to get the B and N keys to work, it's a door stop.Up front I wanted to say it's my fault.  I was looking for a small rugged Windows computer to use with a few mechanic programs - mainly ForScan.  Since I would take it while traveling it had to be tough, resistant to dust, not too heavy, and a screen I could see in sunlight.  This Dell has almost all of my needs - it is definitely tough.  It has dust ports covering everything.  It appears the battery and perhaps HHD are also accessible from each side.  I'm guessing it's the battery and HHD but with no manual, I could be wrong.  I used the Dell for the first time yesterday and after an long setup time; not blaming the Dell but trying to get through Windows caused me to reboot the laptop three times when Microsoft froze.  After setup and some personal software installed, I used the Dell on battery for about 90-mins without issue.  Sitting in my truck with the sun beating in, I was able to read the screen and that was a good thing.  My only issue and it's my fault, is the Dell is larger than I was expecting.  Of course it is heavy - given it's design and construction that wasn't a surprise and since it's in my truck 90% of the time or on my work bench, I don't think the weight will be a problem.  So, after just 48-hrs of use, we are happy.  Getting ready for a four month overlanding adventure and the Dell is going along, so we'll see if I need to update my review.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2020
review_text: I tend to prattle exhaustively so I tried to divvy up my numerous opinions into sections you might find relevant.Now/Future = I've been very pleased with this laptop, and I do consider it a great deal for the six hundy spent (on the 9th Gen Intel Core i5-9300H). Not only does it perform splendidly as it comes "right out the box", but it's also upgradeable in the near future as tech advances and my finances allow. I've been using it for hours on end everyday for almost one month.Multitasking = I can run WoW (weeeeee!!) while simultaneously streaming music on Spotify in my web browser. Beyond that, I can also minimize my game and music to do a quick Google on whatever boss I'm trying to squelch as I solo dungeons with my Night Elf Demon Hunter. No lag or stuttering while multitasking whatsoever. Nice. B-)Graphics quality = It comes with 2 graphics cards, so be sure to check your in-game settings to make sure the best card is selected. Streaming Netflix and running WoW are lovely in a way I wasn't able to appreciate on my previous HP laptop. My only concern is that once in a while I've seen a rolling screen dim from top to bottom for a split second before it returns to normal. It has only happened a couple of times in the past month I've owned this, so?Pre-installed software = I had to find workarounds to disable Bing and Microsoft Edge, but in the end I can now use the search box on the start bar and it opens Google results in Chrome. Those being my preferred search engine and web browser. It wasn't terribly difficult as an amateur tinkerer.Heat = Sometimes I use the laptop on my actual lap (go figure), and when I've been immersed in my addiction for 4-5 hours, it gets rather warm. Almost hot. The pre-installed Nitrosense app allows you to manage the fan settings in order to allay this. Also of note is that the heat escape is on the right side, which means south paws keep their leading hand cool and us orthodox boxers get a warm periodic reminder to move our hand away from the keyboard. In plain words: the heat from the fans blows directly where one would naturally rest one's hand on a mouse (if you use one, however, a mouse is not included).Keyboard = The keys are comfortably spaced, appropriately sensitive to touch, and all are in working condition. The value of the number pad on a laptop cannot be understated!! The red backlight on the keyboard by default times out after 30 seconds. Finding the right key to strike first on an all-black keyboard after the backlight turns off was obnoxious to me. After some searching, I found that this too is changeable in the Nitrosense app. Weird place to put it, but ok. Hit the "(N)" key in the top left of the number pad, then click the Settings gear inside Nitrosense, and click to toggle off the "backlight off after 30 seconds" option. This might not be available on every model, but take a gander.Battery life = The battery lasts for a decent amount of time when simply browsing and streaming music: several hours, give or take. But I prefer/recommend plugging in the power cord when I know I'm about to sit down for a long session of questing. ("Just one more quest!!")Port/Cable management = Speaking of the power cable... It must have been a desperate decision to seat it on the righthand side of the laptop in the middle. The configuration of the internal hardware almost certainly has to be to blame for this. It seems like they tried to offset this inconvenience by making the power cable with a immediate 90 degree bend so you can swivel it (hopelessly) out of the way.Final summation = I listed things things that I believe could be improved which were mostly cosmetic in nature and were either adjustable or could be lived with. But on the whole, this laptop has been a game-changer for my usual activities and has truly been a "best bang for your buck" experience. I recommend it for anyone who is maybe moderately into gaming but mostly wants a very reliable and delightful experience.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2020
review_text: I bought this laptop both for school and casual gaming and I’m very pleased! I’ve always built my own desktops to spend less for better parts but needed a laptop for school. After looking at some in the $500-$700 range I found this one and after a look over and reading some reviews I decided to buy it. I managed to purchase the Nitro 5 9th gen for $600 + tax. (Sale) decided to get another 8gb of DDR4 and a 500gb M.2 for all my games. The storage that comes with the laptop is more than enough for school work especially with most files being in the cloud. I got a crucial 8GB DDR4 2666 SODIMM for ram and a WD Blue 3D Nano 500GB SSD (which I have installed but have yet to set up)With both of these upgrades the laptop runs great! Now that you know a little about what’s been done to the laptop and it’s intended use (in my case) let’s jump into some pros and cons after 3 weeks of use.Pros:•Good specs for the price•Easily upgraded•PLENTY of ports•Runs great•Full keyboard (takes some getting used to)•Not too heavy•Easy to use temperature/fan software•Good battery life when on power save•Good quality on the webcamCons:•The bottom of the screen is a little flimsy•While gaming the CPU runs 74°C-80°C which is a little hotter than I’d like but to be expected in a laptop•Does need to be plugged in for peak performance but the same goes for all/most laptops•Charge port is on the right side of laptop towards the middle which can be minor inconvenience when using a mouse•Not a huge fan of the red but beggars can’t be choosers and at least it was done well.•Took about a week to come in IIRC but no biggieAs you can see the cons are mostly just nitpicking little things I don’t particularly care for. That’s because overall I’m very happy with this device! There are just some minor things but not at deal breakers. I usually don’t bother with writing reviews this long but I know there are people in the position I was in a month ago. Love the laptop so far and don’t think you will regret your purchase! Unless you get a bad unit, which I can’t speak on because I got a good one. I’m sure ACER is more than willing to replace faulty units. Hope I was able to help with your decision! Best of luck in your laptop search! Will update with any issues or new findings.
