review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2021
review_text: No one feature is exceptional, but the amount of features/quality at the sub-400 price is impressive.❧ Solid construction, aluminum lid❧ Modern (at time of purchase) and moderately-well-equipped Ryzen APU❧ IPS screen with good max and min brightness, even backlight, and acceptable color rendition❧ Backlit Keyboard with a great layout and good key quality❧ Large, responsive trackpad with a turn-off option in the function keys❧ Good cooling solution for the size❧ User accessible / upgradable parts❧ Acceptable I/O (USB, HDMI, LAN, headphone jack, kensington)Corners that were cut:❧ Storage size - 128gb DRAM-less SSD as configured❧ Win 10 in S mode (I believe Microsoft charges less for the "s" license)❧ Speakers are truly terrible. I cannot overemphasize how bad they are.❧ Ram Size - 4gb DDR4 2400❧ No card reader❧ 1 year warranty (remember when things actually had 2 or 3???)❧ No Mic jackThe storage is upgradeable. The included SSD is user-replaceable, and there is also an included space /  hardware to add a 2.5" drive. The 4gb RAM is built in to the board, but there is one slot open for RAM. Having filled mine, CPU-Z reports that it is successfully running in dual channel mode (important for APU memory bandwidth).It strikes me that the corners cut are ALL user-addressable. Windows 10 can leave S mode. Ram/storage is upgradeable. Card readers and external speakers/headphones/audio interfaces can be used.The 3350u processor has a manufacturer-configurable TDP, which affects its boost clock behavior. This one seems to be configured to a relatively medium-low power. I have never seen it boost past 3.1ghz (the AMD spec sheet lists a 3.5 ghz max). Fine by me, but worth noting. The cooling solution seems like it could handle more, but it does dump heat primarily beneath it (i.e. into your lap if you are using it as a laptop literally). I don't really blame them for dialing it back for this reason or to hit battery life targets.After adding RAM and storage, I have successfully done some medium gaming at low settings. Civ 6, Life is Strange 2, and the infamously-processor-bound-poorly-optimized Guild Wars 2. All fine, but I would have gotten something more powerful if I didn't have a gaming desktop.My last laptop was from 2009 and lasted me 'til 2021. The hardware on this one should meet my needs for equally long -- all that's left to be seen is if anything randomly breaks between now and then. If any random breakage occurs between now and 2023 I will update this review.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2021
review_text: Fast and simple setup, wifi connection strong and fast.  Not overloading with shovelware, has a decent variety of utilities and software, most of which looks reasonable for the typical pc user.Havent tested for gaming, and don't plan to on anything modern/4k, mostly emulation which shouldn't burden it too much.  Intergrated graphics has enough power to run background apps for any upscaled emulation to 1080p, but I wouldnt try and run anything like twitch simultaneously.  I plan on using it lightly, some work, some low key gaming, and for the price it makes sense.  A great laptop for students, its a good size with enough umph for your educational needs, or if you're bored.Design is great, feels very solid, keyboard is great, fingerprint sensor actually works (i do construction and my hands get wrecked all the time, this a big deal for me).Sync'd with my phone super easy in under 5 minutes, porting my google account and contacts no problem!I'd highly recommend for someone that wants a great machine for an awesome price.  I'm not saying it has all the power in the world, or storage, or biggest battery, but for the price you'll be greatly impressed with how the specs shine on this laptop.  Also impressively thin, and hasn't really gotten above a warm temp.  Solid state usually helps greatly with this, as all laptops use these now.Overall I highly recommend, and this would also be the perfect backup laptop for travel or to carry daily and not worry about something happening to it and cost you a grand.  Mac users could find this as a viable pc option to meet their non-Mac needs.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2021
review_text: I'm not an acer fan, as acer was like the hyundai's of the pc tech world in my book, but I needed a laptop for my daughter and this one fit the bill.So far so good, I'd say build quality is fairly decent, it's slimmer than I expected. Performance wise, obviously it's no beast, but it gets the job done. What's really great about this is the fact that the ram is upgradeable to 64GB, but I'll just purchase an 8GB stick to add to it.There is room for a 2.5" SSD. The NVME is also removeable, so while there's no sd card slot, storage is fully expandable in a better way.Having a backlit keyboard with #pad is excellent.Webcam quality is ok, nothing to talk about there, 720p 30fps max, but as mentioned before, gets the job done.Even with only 4Gb Ram, it still ran smoothly despite having several Chrome windows open with multiple tabs. Installed minecraft java edition for her, it was able to play set at 7 chunks render distance, and not very many settings dialed down and still get 60fps (not that she cared about fps), so I still think you may be able to play some titles at 720p maybe medium settings, but i haven't checked it yet.Screen is not bad, viewing angles are quite good and bright enough.The speaker are not loud but audio quality is fairly decent, especially given how slim the laptop is. Your phone may go louder, but it won't scrape your ear canal.Battery life is average I'd say.All in all, this is a laptop that is more expensive than it should be, AS ARE ALL THAT FALL IN THIS PRICE POINT, but definitely compared against all the others I've sifted through, it's the best. In summary, it is because:1. Ability to upgrade internal nvme storage + add 2.5" ssd2. As with internal storage, ram isn't soldered on like the other brand laptops and can be upgraded3. Latest WiFi and Bluetooth technology4. Backlit keyboard with number pad and fingerprint scanner on touchpad5. Inclusion of an ethernet port. Especially helpful if you need a stable internet connection.6. Windows 11 ready7. Decent display with good viewing angles8. Decent quad core apu9. USB-C also available on chassis and overall, decent I/OIt's a solid buy if you're looking for a laptop within it's price range at the time of this review. It offers the most features and flexibility vs the competition.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2024
review_text: Easy to use and set up, durable, portable, nice looking, brightness is adjustable and good, performs well.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2021
review_text: For $350, I expect a laptop that's basically a piece of junk, and this completely exceeded my expectations. I'm just a college student and don't need anything fancy, and obviously also don't have a ton of money to spend on electronics. I'm more than happy with this computer. I saw some people complain about the screen quality, as well as the speakers and the touchpad, but honestly I haven't noticed an issue with any of them at all. The screen quality is a little less than my old laptop but I don't notice it really, if you're into gaming and stuff it might be annoying but for daily use and movie watching I think it's good, once again you are getting more than what you're paying for in the first place. It's relatively light, has lots of outlets which I always appreciate. The speakers are just fine for me, the loudest I've ever put them is at 50% volume, so in my opinion they're plenty loud enough. The trackpad has never given me any issue so far. The S Mode thing is annoying, but easy to disable, even though I haven't done that yet and honestly might not because I'm just a casual user and it isn't a huge deal to me. All in all, I'm very impressed at the quality, considering how low the price is. This is absolutely the best thing you're gonna find for this price range. I'm really glad that I went with my gut and picked this laptop over the Lenovo one that I was considering. My last Chromebook that I loved and lasted me four years was Acer, and I decided to go ahead and stick with Acer since I trust the brand and they're known for making great durable products for cheap, which is what I wanted. If you're looking for something high end and fancy, this isn't for you, but if you want the cheapest laptop possible with the most capabilities possible, then this is what you want to get.

review_title: After a year and a half with my daughter at college
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2022
review_text: I am looking for a new “pay the bills, turbotax, light excel, occasional stream” laptop. Remembered I had bought this exact one for my daughter when she began college fall semester of 2021.I am definitely going to buy this same laptop for the above noted uses. It has survived the abuse of my somewhat klutzy  (also beautiful, confident, talented and intelligent) daughter’s device abuse habits for almost two years now and still functions and looks like new with a “forever” battery life.Helpful tip passed to me by a savvy friend of mine…Acer’s are simple to upgrade. He convinced me to buy this model along with an extra Solid State hard-drive and stick of RAM. All in it cost less than $500. The resulting specs, with the exception of processor speed, could not be found for less than $1,100 on any laptop I saw at the time we purchased this one. The processor along with the memory is absolutely fast enough for anything other than intense, gaming, CAD, etc.Go for it!Was able to get the hard-drive and RAM at the local Best Buy…these are readily available components at Amazon and most likely a local electronics store, if there is one, near you. With the above noted upgrades and anticipated uses- this is a terrific laptop and I recommend it highly for value and performance - it is sturdy, easy to use, and has a long battery life…not sure what else you could need.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2021
review_text: My Gateway laptop has been getting slower and slooowwwwer for a while to the point where it took me (no exaggeration) 15 minutes to boot...and it was getting glitchy besides.  I've had Acers before and they've been good machines so I thought I'd give this one a shot.  I'm not in the least disappointed.  The pros:+The backlit keyboard.  I absolutely love it.  Yes, the backlighting goes off after a few seconds of non use - but any key will immediately turn it back on.  So I just press the Shift key and the backlighting returns.  A really neat feature on such an inexpensive computer.+The matte finish screen.  I remember when I was searching for my last laptop that I had a terribly hard time finding a matte (non-glare) screen.  It seemed that at that time for some inexplicable reason every manufacturer out there had gone to a glossy screen which, to me, creates thoroughly unacceptable reflections.  The Gateway I wound up with was one of the very few on the market with a matte screen.  So glad this one has it as well.+Flexibility.  Apparently it is quite easy to upgrade both the memory and the hard drive.  For my uses I don't think I'll need to do either one - but it's nice to know I can if I want to.  I've been using a 1TB external drive as my primary storage for some time now, so I just plugged it in and kept on chugging.+Speed.  I know I was transitioning from a computer that had become outrageously slow, but I was not prepared for boot times under ten seconds - wow!  It's about time that these things finally are operating at speeds they should have been all along.  And everything is much faster.  It is a true pleasure.+Design.  Sleek, clean, not all gimmicked up.  And although I read a review or two that said the fan was noisy I think those reviewers got a clunker because mine is super quiet - you can barely hear the fan at all.  Certainly not anywhere near as noisy as my previous laptop.The cons:- I do wish it had a DVD drive built in.  I know it would have made it thicker, but I hate that I won't be able to access some of my antique stuff until I add one.  Oh, well.And that's it for the cons.  I find this to be an outstanding computer for the price and would highly recommend it to anyone who doesn't need eyeball-searing speed and massive memory capacities necessary for some genres.  For me, I'm certain it's going to be my workhorse for some time to come.

review_title: First Chromebook and it's a winner
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2022
review_text: First off, the touchscreen works fine.  I'm on version 100.0.4896.133 and had absolutely no issues.  So whatever plagued this model previously has been resolved.  Now then, lets focus on the laptop.The first thing I noticed was the screen.  In an age of almost no bezels....  Holy bezel Batman!  Is this a bad thing?  Eh, maybe to some.  For me I'm OK with it.  Realize the laptop itself is about the size of a 13.3" laptop.  I haven't looked into it but I suspect there's a laptop in this chassis with a 12" or 13" screen.  But in day-to-day use, it's fine for me.  The smaller screen gives a good pixel density and colors look fine.  Very good viewing angles too.  So all in all, I like it.  Touchscreen seems very responsive as well.  No issues at all there.  Oh, and in the bezel there's a webcam.  720p, does OK in low light, no physical shutter so get your stickers ready :PGoing down the laptop we have the hinge.  While I'm not a fan of tablet modes that leave the keyboard exposed, it does what it sets out to do just fine.  The pivoting action feels very smooth with a fair bit of resistance.  Folding over into tablet mode, everything works as expected with good orientation control.  So while something I won't use much, it's a nice feature.Down further, we get to the keyboard.  Keys have a nice feel to them though travel is a bit short.  Not Lenovo's best but certain better than other keyboard I've used.  I'm a little disappointed it doesn't include the usual "F" keys given I use Linux on here but so far it's not caused any issues...Finally we come to the touchpad.  I must be honest, I despise most any touchpad without physical buttons.  However, I must confess this one is actually very good.  It's proven to be very responsive with almost no hiccups.  At times I will have a small lag if I try and use two fingers (resting one finger on the "button" and moving with the other) but it handles this better than other cheap machines I've dealt with.  The physical action is rather mushy but taps work just as well.Finally, we come to the speakers.  This is probably the weakest part of the whole machine.  I find underside speakers become obstructed way too often.  Of course this depends on how it's used, but I'd much prefer top-mounted speakers.  But judging what we have, they actually works pretty well.  If you're on a hard surface, they have decent sound.  Nothing phenomenal, but about what you'd expect from a machine at this price point.  And then if they are covered, you can still get OK sound from them.I guess the last point will be I/O.  Charging is via USB-C, and yes, this port can be used for other USB devices too.  You also have full-sized HDMI, a USB 3.0 and full-sized SD card slot.  SD cards aren't flush when inserted so that's a bit disappointing, but I'm glad Lenovo at least opted for full sized ports and such.  Now on the adjacent side we have power, volume and a headphone jack...not much to say there.Finally the guts of the beast.  At the heart of this machine is an ARM based processor.  I was very curious how performance would be using ChromeOS and more importantly the Linux dev environment.  Results have been mixed but generally very good.  As a Chromebook for surfing the web and watching videos, it works fine.  Pages load quickly, videos play without issue, etc.  The only hiccup I've found is playing a video in the background.  The video remains frozen for a bit when returning to it, but this is only a minor quibble.  I've not had many issues with Android apps either.  My library is really only productivity software, but it's all worked as expected.  Over on the Linux side, the processor is a bit labored.  Chromium under Linux is obviously slower than the baked in Chrome, but I'm sure Linux running as a VM doesn't help.Lets end on usage, or more specifically heat and battery life.  I've not done any specific testing, but I'd say 10 hours out of this machine wouldn't be difficult at all.  And then even while under a load and charging, there's almost no noticeable heat generated by this laptop.If you're looking for a good all around Chromebook and can overlook the oddly sized screen, I highly recomend this machine!

review_title: Great quality! Built to last! Excellent Computer!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2023
review_text: I bought this computer when it was first released in 2021. So I've had it just about 3 years now. It's works just as great as the day it arrived. It's an excellent computer, built to last, and works perfect for everything and anything I've ever needed it for over the years from online school to running a business and everything in between.I really enjoy the touch screen feature. It's not something I use very often, but it's pretty handy. The transition from laptop to tablet is very smooth especially if you are working on a program that can use both. (I mostly use it for cricut and Netflix). I've never had any problems or noticed any lag in the screen when swapping over.I play a few online game and it keeps up no problem. I have never had a lagging or loading issue. Also nice that I can download the apps I have on my phone onto the computer. When I'm on the road working everything stays connected and it's no hassle to pull up work files and programs when I get back to the computer.Its a pretty touch little machine and can handle just about anything you throw at it. I'm a general contractor and sometimes my computer has to go onto jobs sights with me. Often not a place you would want to bring a computer for risk of damaging it. But this computer can take a beating. It has fallen several times while it was open and had several things land on it while it was closed. This computer is a beast! It was definitely built tough and built to last!The battery is amazing! It says 10 hours, however that's not true. I'm on my computer every day usually all day with multiple programs open and running. It stays charged the entire day and often has battery the next morning when I forget to plug it in over night. I'd say you can easily get close 14-18 hours of battery life on a single charger. That's pretty impressive especially since mine is a few years old now.The sound quality and volume is plenty for me. I don't think I've ever had it on max volume. It's nice that is has the volume buttons in 2 locations: on the keyboard and on the side of the device. It's has an AUX/headphone port, but in this day and age I've never needed to use it. I mostly connect external speakers via the Bluetooth capability. Very easy to do!The only downside is the lack of ports. 1 USB drive isnt always enough. I use a wireless mouse when I'm on the computer so that takes care of the 1 USB drive. No biggie normally the mouse is the only thing I have connect to it but in the off chance I need to plug something else in, I ordered a cheap USB splitter and that works just fine.Overall this computer is a really great buy! I do not think you would be disappointed in your choice if you decided to go this route. I know I definitely have not been. This computer should be able to meet all of your needs for many many years!

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2024
review_text: This little thing is exactly what I needed. Lightweight and versatile. I'm often doing presentations for small and large groups. This chromebook had good graphics and the screen folds into every position I need with no issues. It's often left in my work bag, in the back of my car under groceries or other bags and it keeps on ticking. I got my 2021 and have since brought another newer laptop with bells and whistles but it's big and heavier and not nearly as versatile as my chromebook.

review_title: Great Chromebook, but not what I had ordered.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2022
review_text: This Chromebook is a really good laptop.  The price point was excellent, and it is a lightweight, solidly built Chromebook that sips on the battery instead of drinking or gulping it.  An individual can expect to get a full day's use on a single battery charge.I love the touch screen, 2-in-1 feature (tablet/tent or laptop, the sound is adequate, the keyboard size is good, and the weight is great particularly for adding minimal weight in a backpack.  There is a mechanical slide built in to physically block the camera, which is a particularly nice feature.  It uses a USB-C adapter, which is helpful for possibly being able to carry/manage multiple cords.  It is compact enough to be carried in nearly any size backpack, messenger bag, or medium to large handbag.On the right side of the computer, there is a power button, rocker volume button, and Kensington lock input.  On the left side, there is a micro-SD slot, a 3.5 mm headphone/microphone input, a USB-A input, and a USB-C power input.  I wish there were either one more USB-C input or a second USB-A input; however, a USB-C mini hub (probably one with a power pass through) will provide additional inputs for any USB accessories needed.  This is a minor complaint, but not enough to deduct a star.I did, however, deduct one star because I specifically wanted AND ordered a laptop in white.  That is not what I received.  (I received one that is dark navy.)  I didn't return it because I didn't want to pay a restocking fee, and ultimately it meets every other expectation I had for a new Chromebook.If you don't mind the random act of receiving a Chromebook in a different color than what was expected, this Chromebook is a good, solid item with a beast of a battery in a compact, lightweight footprint.  it will provide hours and hours of surfing and streaming.  It will be good for using the Google suite of items.  It is a great laptop for a student, and it is a great laptop for a work if one's work is largely web-based.This is what this computer is not:  it is not a Windows PC system; it is a Chromebook.  It is not a large computer.  If you want a screen larger than 11.6 inches, this laptop is not for you.  I am not a gamer, so I can't speak to its ability to run games.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2024
review_text: This is a great Chromebook and came at a wonderful budget price. Definitely love it has the HDMI port! Blizzard White is an excellent color for the laptop that we love. Wish to see these little power machines come back out and or give us longer user life. Will be sad when we have to retire this one.

THIS IS CRAZY - FOR A CRAPPY PRODUCT LIKE THIS I SHOULD HAVE GOT 100% REFUND. THIS PRODUCT SIMPLY DOES NOT WORK. NOT SURE IF AMAZON OR LENOVO EVER READ THROUGH THE FEEDBACKS. review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
review_text: I purchased this for relatives child and I have not heard anything negative about it, yet

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2021
review_text: I purchased this Chromebook to have a portable laptop for work.The positives:-I love the size & color-It's lightweight-The keyboard is comfortable to type with-The battery life is outstanding.-The 2 in 1 feature is very neat.-Ability to personalize some of the settings similar to a Mac-It starts right up-The OS speed is fast-Google Play works just fine-It's a great overall Chromebook if you are looking for an affordable option!The downsides:-To me are the display screen is small for the size of the screen. Lenovo could have made the display screen at least an inch wider and an inch higher without making the dimensions of the laptop larger and that would have helped the overall display significantly. It will probably be an improvement on a future model.-I didn't do a video call, only took a picture and the camera quality doesn't seem to be the best, so if you are relying on this for lots of work zoom calls, you may want to find something with a clearer camera, though it will certainly work.-The speakers are very low quality. It's not horrible, but compared to most technology right now it's on the lower end, for sure. If you mostly use a bluetooth speaker or earbuds to listen to music or watch movies this is no problem.-The mouse pad feels a little cheap to me. This is a $250 laptop, so it's expected to feel cheap somewhere, but just something to note.-If you prefer to use Brave as your browser for privacy & security like I do, it is glitchy. This could perhaps be fixed with an update to that app.I am used to Macbooks, so this definitely feels like a downgrade to me, but for the price it's a good deal in my opinion!Unfortunately the touchscreen on my Chromebook did not work. It could be the recent Chrome OS update that other reviews have suggested, so I will be returning mine because that was a feature I was most excited about at this price point. Amazon customer service took great care of me with this, supplying an option for a refund or exchange, even when Lenovo didn't answer and eventually dropped my call to get product support for this issue.In the end, I personally will not buy this product for work again. I would buy it if I was looking for an inexpensive option for school, wanting a laptop/tablet for my child, doing a lot of traveling and not wanting to put an expensive laptop at risk of being damaged, or just wanted something cheaper to watch movies on. For a primary work laptop I personally need something with a slightly bigger/clearer screen and a better camera for video calls.

review_title: Little on the heavy side but good otherwise
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2023
review_text: Purchased the Ideapad Flex 5 16" R7-512GB laptop version while it was on sale on Prime Day for $699. So far I am overall happy with this unit. The screen quality is very good for a lower to mid budget laptop and colors are vibrant enough. Touchscreen works great as well. I like the idea of the flexibility of changing between laptop mode and tablet mode. The 16" screen size in tablet mode is great for watching movies and other random entertaining things, but if your goal is to use it for note taking or similar, it is a little on the larger side and would recommend the 14" instead.  My main purpose is to use it for travels and remote work via remote desktop, so the additional real estate on the screen was important for me for my engineering work (CAD and programming).Since I also have a need for multiple monitors when stationary, I went ahead and also purchased a cheap off-brand USB-C docking station from Falwedi on Amazon. I was able to expand to at least 2 additional monitors, resulting in a triple monitor setup, one 24" Dell 1080 and another 27" Dell 2K. I did however get some issues where the external monitors would blank for a second or two occasionally, but not yet sure if this was due to the current drivers on the Ideapad or the off-brand docking station. Something I will need to investigate further at a later time.Sound quality from the speakers is just ok. There is no base, which I wouldn't expect from a lower budget laptop anyways. The camera worked decently and clear, which is sufficient for most video conferences anyways.The fingerprint reader works flawlessly and makes login into Windows and other biometric supporting apps super easy.I am however surprised on how heavy this unit is for being a new modern 16" model. Reminds me of my 10+ year old Toshiba brick. Another drawback is that the pen or stylus was not included with it and is sold separately.There is no ethernet port and for those that want to utilize wired connections, will need to purchase an additional dongle.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2022
review_text: This is a Great laptop. I first order another Lenovo, which was defective or something. Because it was so new there were no reviews.  I returned it with no problem.  I thought I didn't need such a high grade laptop. So I decided to get this one, and it's almost half the cost. Im not a gamer on PC, but this also comes with entice gamer pluses, including Xbox promotion time. I periodically watch movies mostly pay bills, read and writing docs. For personal use, I am please with laptop. It is fast, smooth has sufficient memory.  Graphics are great, touch screen works great, and so does touch point, even has backlit. It comes with with windows 11 home, Great for me. I transfer all my docs and pdf, photos, music, and some apps. with Lenovo migration assist, so easily through my wifi. I did buy from Microsoft site, and pdf app, so I can edit and sign forms that only cost me 49.00 one time fee for up to "I think" it was 5 different devices. I would difinately recommend this laptop.  I bought it on the lighting deal last week. Loved the price even more. Thumbs up for this laptop.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2024
review_text: This is a piece of garbage.  When I first bought it it started to overheat soooo much that it actually hurt to touch it.  The fan would run constantly and I couldn't turn the laptop off.  I had to wait for it to die. I literally couldnt leave it alone because I was afraid it was going to start a fire.  I had a friend look at it and it seemed like we fixed the problem.  A few months after that it stopped holding a charge.  I homeschool my child and it sometimes feels like we spend more time trying to get this pos to work than actual homeschooling.  I have now had this laptop for about 8 months and it has started to get EXTREMELY hot again.  It barely holds a charge now.  We might get one hour worth of charge at a time.  The only way my child can really use it is when it is plugged in and when we're done with school we HAVE to unplug it right away. We have also had problems with the touch pad and touch screen intermittently.  This laptop was a huge mistake and waste of money.  I wish I never bought it.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2024
review_text: I'm a techie, professionally and hobby wise, and I've had so many flavors of laptops and desktops. This right here though, is one awesome piece of equipment. Specs are very nice. I dual boot between Fedora and Windows 11, I run applications for different projects at the same time and there is no freezing or memory clogs. Even when practicing pen testing, the Ryzen has more threads than the Intels I'm used to using, so it works on more processes, much faster than it's Intel equivalent (Ryzen 5 vs i5, etc) Pretty lightweight, light up keyboard is perfect. I could go on and on. Well worth the purchase.

review_title: Truly this is a great laptop for the price.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2022
review_text: To clarify, I have the 16GB RAM/512GB SSD/ Ryzen 5 5500U model.  The battery life, camera quality, touch screen, and the power of this laptop are exactly what they should be for this price range. The speed and power of the laptop is what has impressed me the most. I am a music producer and I need at least 16GB of Ram and the 512GB of storage is pretty good as well. I also like to game a little. I was able to download and install over 60GB of musical software, which would usually take me a whole day or two to fully set up, in about 30 minutes. I am able to play Fortnite at around 30-40 fps, Valorant at around 60-80 fps, and Minecraft at around 60+ fps, which is plenty for my own needs right now, as I mostly use it for music production. So far it runs everything I bought it for smoothly and has at least met, if not exceeded my expectations. After reading many of the worse reviews, I tried to prepare myself for some flaws, but I honestly like everything about it. The brightness isn’t as bad as some people say either, 250 nits on this display is honestly plenty for probably 90% of the situations I use it in. Even if there is sunlight, I can still see the screen enough. It’s not like I’ll be gaming in the sunlight, if anything doing a musical performance outside during the day would potentially be a challenge but not impossible. Overall if you are someone who needs a good laptop for a good price, this really is a good choice. It’s my first time using Lenovo as I have used HP for 8+ years. I’m very impressed

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2024
review_text: I’ve owned this laptop for two months so far. Here’s what I love: It’s light weight. And it does what we all pray our laptop will do. Work. Every time we open it. It doesn’t get overheated unless I’m working on bed right on my comforter. Yeah I know: don’t do that. And most often I don’t. But I will say even when I do, it’s doesn’t get screaming hot. And of course I move it best I can to keep the vents free.And the battery is amazing. I work for hours on end before it poops out. It boots up fairly quickly and operates without hardly a drag and I’m creating graphic elements and so forth inside of Canva. So, she’s quick. Not lightning, but this is under $500 soooo since that is the case, I’d say, wow, nice on speed!The two bummers are: no lighted keyboard. But, I’m surviving. And then there’s the screen. Don’t get me wrong. It’s got a beautiful picture. The drag is that the angle of preciousness is tricky to land on. When you tilt it exactly where it needs to be you see a clear and amazing picture of what ever you’re looking at. But have it off a bit and well, the colors and so forth are not accurate. The screen has what I’ve taken to call a shadow across it. I don’t know what it’s called when a screen does this and I don’t even care to look the term up. But, when it happens I must mess with the angle so I can see it without it being dark.I’m thankful I could get into a laptop at all because money was not there to get one any better. I just wish that screen wouldn’t be such a bugger bear to get right. I work with graphics/color a ton so to me it matters.However, all said, I’d buy it again and resolve to just deal with the screen. And if you were to ask me, and it would seem you are since you’re reading this review, if you need a laptop and don’t have much to spend this baby will deliver everything you need it to do. Which is to work. And end of day, we all need our laptops to work.

review_title: No response from seller regarding faulty laptop
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2021
review_text: I bought the following laptop in April of 2021: "2021 Newest Lenovo IdeaPad 3 15.6" FHD Non-Touch Laptop, Intel Dual-Core i3-1005G1 Up to 3.4GHz (Beats i5-7200u), 12GB DDR4 RAM, 256GB PCI-e SSD, Webc"Initially I loved how lightweight and streamlined it was, compared to my last Lenovo laptop.  It was also very quick to respond as I surfed the net.  However, things went downhill pretty quickly.  I began to get blue screens when I tried to boot up the laptop.  It would say that there was some kind of error and it would go into repair mode.  Over and over and over again. It is now September of 2021 (a mere 5 months after the purchase date) and I have already had to pay for a visit to our local PC repair shop where they had to re-install Windows.  That fixed things for about a month but then the same problems started up again.  The laptop currently goes into loops of blue screens and doesn't even open Windows.  I sit here writing this review on my old dinosaur of a Lenovo laptop which, sadly, now works better than my brand new laptop (which actually doesn't work at all since it goes straight to blue screens whenever I try to boot it up).  I sent an email to Oydisen Electronics, the sellers that I bought from, about 7 days ago and have received no response.  Oydisen Electronics, if you are reading this review, please contact me and I will consider adjusting the review accordingly.  Otherwise, I would advise others to stay away from this seller if they aren't willing to back the products they sell.

review_title: The hardware is from year 2019 and the RAM memory is soldered.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2022
review_text: I purchased the IdeaPad (IP) laptop because it had two interesting hardware parts:a) A solid disk NVMe characterized by working at high speed.b) An Intel Quad Core processor.It came with the latest Windows OS installed.If you check the product in the Amazon advertisement, you will note the following details:— There is no information about model.— The seller says it has 4 GB RAM but doesn’t tell you it is on board soldered hardware.— There is no information about an Ethernet port.The laptop arrived on time and in good conditions.  After charging the battery, I proceeded with the setup.The first surprise was the IP did not have an Ethernet port, which come standard in almost every computer.  It was very difficult to use my Wi-Fi, located about 3 feet from the laptop.  In the middle of the process, it got frozen and there was not a way to start from the beginning.  After some time trying to find out a solution, it came to my mind to do a hard reset.  Then I pushed the power button for some seconds and that was the method to start the process (Not a word from Lenovo, Microsoft or the seller how to do that).After finishing the setup, I wanted to register the product. I looked for the Command Prompt. At this point, I have a second surprise.  W11 did not permit to install anything because it was a Windows S laptop.  This is a very important information the seller did not show in his ad. I was lucky that there was a button to get rid of the S mode and install the CMD. With CMD, I was able to find the product serial number.The laptop comes with Lenovo Vantage software preinstalled where you can find information about the hardware, warranty and many other things.  Lenovo showed that warranty for the IP started in September 2021 and will last until November 2022.  Therefore, I would have only 4 months of warranty!  That made me suspect the laptop was used and registered many months before, but I don’t have proof.After searching information of the hardware installed, I found the Intel N5030, and the SSD were versions from year 2019.  However, the advertising said it was a “new” Lenovo Idea Pad.While working with some applications, I noticed the system did not respond and took me a long time to do simple things with very elemental applications like Paint.This is a low power laptop good for text editors, sending emails and browsing. One good thing is that it is fan-less and very compact.SummaryI am returning this laptop because:a) There is no possibility to increase the memory.b) The hardware is about 2 years old.c) The system works slowly in most of the applicationsd) It has no Ethernet port

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2021
review_text: My last laptop had a much higher price tag.  I didn't have that kind of cash to replace it when the motherboard had issues.  This one was reasonably priced and will meet my current needs. I couldn't run my Silhouette machine without a laptop so this is the one I chose.  It's taking a bit to get used to but I'm liking it now after 2 days.  First day was a bit frustrating as I am a very low tech person and had to figure out what I had to do to get rid of windows S and be able to use the programs I needed.  Looking back it wasn't that hard but it was stressful! The Lenovo my son bought lasted all through his college years and is now being used by his sister.  My last laptop lasted close to 9 years so looking forward to  a long term relationship with this  new addition to our family.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2024
review_text: We previously owned this model and wanted another.  Bought this refurb off of Amazon and it was perfect in every aspect.  Visible wear was barely noticeable.  Performance has been amazing.  Outstanding value.  Would buy again.  4/19/2024:  We had a minor issue.  I replaced the OEM battery (purchased off of Amazon) thinking the new battery was better than the OEM one supplied with the laptop.  I was wrong.  The new battery (copycat, not HP OEM) failed after less than 90 days.  TekFurbs support was extremely helpful in diagnosing the reason the laptop failed (check the battery they said) and that was it.  I am now buying a genuine HP replacement battery.  Shout out to TekFurb for outstanding customer service!

review_title: Defective Product and Bad Customer Service
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2024
review_text: I recently had the displeasure of dealing with Olive Computers and my experience was far from satisfactory.I purchased an HP ProBook 650 G2 laptop from Olive Computers through Amazon. Upon receiving the item, it became evident that the charging port was defective. The device would charge intermittently. I returned the item to the vendor only to realize that the vendor claimed that nothing was wrong with the machine and only refunded $18.55 charging me $209 as a restocking fee for the item.I reached out to Amazon Customer Service on the matter and they in turn reached out to Olive Computers. I then received communication from Olive Computers that the item I returned was severely damaged and that it was an incorrect item returned, this is after charging me a restocking fee for the item, which didn’t make sense to me. Why charge a restocking fee if you realize that the item was not yours? I then realized that this vendor did not want to refund me for the item as they were now trying to stall the process and shifting blame. First, they said nothing was wrong with the item and charged a restocking fee, then they said it was a damaged item returned and then also claimed that the item was different from what they sold.What we see here is that they repeatedly shifted blame and refused to acknowledge their responsibility for the defective product. Instead of resolving the issue professionally, Olive Computers resorted to threatening language, implying that I was attempting fraud by seeking a refund for a damaged item. This behavior is unacceptable and reflects poorly on their business ethics.Despite my repeated attempts to reach a fair resolution, Olive Computers continues to evade accountability and fails to provide a satisfactory explanation for its actions.I also have an issue with how Amazon handled the incident. My first call to Amazon was on January 26th and I spent 30 minutes and 54 seconds on a call with them outlining the issue. They then reached out to Olive Computers to resolve the issue. Olive Computers continued to evade, so I reached out to Amazon again on Feb 4th and spent 10 minutes and 11 seconds on the phone again. They then sent an email to Olive Computers who again claimed that the item was damaged and that it wasn’t theirs and offered to return the item to me at my cost which I refused as since they were being dishonest in saying the item was not theirs, I didn’t trust them to return the item to me and I also didn’t believe that this was a proper resolution to the issue. I reached out to Amazon again on Feb 6th and spent 24 minutes and 12 seconds on the phone and the customer service representative advised that Amazon was going to file an A to Z claim on my behalf and I would hear back in 7 days, I also received an email to that effect. 7 days came and went and still no resolution, so I reached out to Amazon again on Feb 14th and spent 1 hour and 43 seconds on the phone as I asked to speak with a supervisor. He said there was no A to Z filed and since I had responded to the vendor's latest message it couldn’t be filed no but I would have to wait 24 hours. So after 24 hours, I reached out to Amazon again on Feb 16th and spent 27 minutes and 30 seconds on the phone with them. The customer service representative had issues putting in the A to Z claim and tried to walk me through the process of doing it myself which didn’t work because the item was already showing refunded. Amazon then told me they would escalate the matter to another team trained to handle these issues and I would hear from them within 7 days. I insisted that they put that in writing and an email was sent to me. After 7 days passed and no follow up I reached out to Amazon again on Feb 25th and spent 1 hour 4 minutes and 34 seconds on the phone with a supervisor who empathized with me but tried again to make a claim and then decided to again refer it to another Amazon team. To date, there is still no resolution of the issue with Amazon or Olive computers and I am now contemplating further actions.In conclusion, my experience with Olive Computers was marred by defective products, unprofessional conduct, baseless accusations, and a lack of accountability. In addition, Amazon has filed to be helpful in resolving this issue with the vendor. I strongly advise potential customers to refrain from purchasing from this vendor, as their business practices and customer service leave much to be desired.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2023
review_text: After my 9 year-old HP laptop finally lost its mind and a few keys I was persuaded to buy a new laptop. I liked the brand a lot, and got tremendous mileage out of the old one, so I went for a comparable but much newer refurbished ProBook The first one had a number of issues, and in the end it quit charging, so I returned it and the return process was as close to flawless as could be imagined. The replacement ProBook, an HP 650G, is absolutely fabulous. The keyboard lights (the other one didn't), the DisplayPort works (the other one didn't), it charges fast, it boots fast, the keyboard is smooth and sure, and in general it is everything I've always wanted in a laptop. I am a writer so it matters a lot, and this thing is dynamite -- for a very reasonable price. I can't recommend it highly enough. Thanks, Amazon!

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2023
review_text: The hard hard failed two hours after setup.  No big deal, HD’s fail all the time.  My years of IT Experience told me, things happen.  I contacted the company.  Was sent several emails on what they wanted me to do, thankfully I have 15 years experience.  First, the company set bit locker in the bios.  There is no need to activate the TPM chip in the bios to send out for public sale.  So, I tried to disable BitLocker, but the drive was dead, no matter what I told to tech support they just sent another email with something new to do.  I finally tired of them, opened the machine and removed the HD.  The HD was a Chinese knock off device that cost 12 dollars retail.  So I installed a Kingston device, formatted the drive and installed Windows 10.  The machine now works like new.  My complaint is the level of knowledge they expect of the customer, when the customer knows what they are doing, they ignored me.  In the end I got a great bargain, just days of roundabout BS.

This was a must for my use case, but you really don't need to for general business use.The sound from these speakers is the best I have ever heard on a laptop.I bought a battery when I ordered the laptop based on the AI generated comment feedback, but it appears that this was replaced prior to shipping.If you were in the market for a laptop and budget was $300.00 - 350.00 you cannot go wrong purchasing this device. A new device in this price range will barely get you 1/4 of this functionality.

I know a lot of folks analyze every aspect of a laptop when they review them but, he is just a college student that needs a fast, reliable laptop.  This one is that.  He is a chemistry major and loves the 2-in-1 feature and often uses a stylus to draw out chemical equations, etc.  In short, it works, and he is happy.

review_title: Good enough for the price, I guess…
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2023
review_text: I probably should have put this laptop thru its paces before now, and I might have actually returned it if I realized how poor the battery life was, and noticed the peculiar issue where the screen just sometimes goes black. I don’t necessarily blame the refurbishing QC, as the screen issue is intermittent - but the battery lasting barely an hour is something they should have noticed. Also; charge it all the way up, unplug it, and within a couple days you can’t even turn it on without plugging it back in - let alone try to use it on that charge. Now, it looks as good as new, physically, and has everything that it was advertised as including… but there is obviously still something wrong with it as evidenced from the screen blackouts (not power related or screen saver or anything like that) and poor, poor battery life. But since 99% of the time I’ll be using this at home; I’m okay with just leaving it plugged up all the time. So I dunno… I guess I just understand that refurbs will rarely be perfect, and I’m able to tolerate the issues mentioned due to the reduced price. Just temper your expectations - you very well could get a perfect one, but just know that both me and and friend that bought the same model on the same day both experienced some issues… his were big enough to return his, as he needed to rely on it on the road away from power.

review_text: I needed something cheap with a good keyboard and a decent screen for basic web browsing and office tasks, something that gets a few hours of battery life.  This checks all of those boxes, for internet, office, and some light photo editing etc. this thing is awesome.  Can't beat it for the price, it's cheaper than most Chrome books and about a thousand times more useful.  The seller did a good job refurbishing the unit, it came clean and packed well.

review_text: The first night I received it, everything looked great, seemed new pretty much.  I got it all working, was into the browser, etc.  I put it to sleep.  The next day I could not get into the computer past the sign in screen, no matter what I did.  I emailed with the company who works with these, but the language barrier was a bit apparent, plus slow going and misunderstandings. Amazon help tried, but it was just as slow and the answers were confusing and incomplete.  I have worked with computers a long time and I'm not dumb, not an expert, but the answers were just not very straightforward, and you can tell they're dealing with lots of people at the same time. I felt it was going to be too much of a challenge going forward and returned it as soon as I could.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2021
review_text: I purchased this as a replacement for a Acer Chromebook 15 I used for 3 years. The old Acer Chromebook powers off now whenever you insert a micro sd card. Then it needs to stay off for like 6 hours before you can use it again without it turning off after 15 seconds. I was hesitant about purchasing another Acer however after looking at many other manufacturers offerings those displays were small and blurry by comparison. I did get three years use out  of the old one without all of the update hassle and the old one had really great battery life.The new Acer 315 has a better keyboard ( with the DELETE key that was missing on the Acer 15) with a nice tactile feel.  The IPS display is great with a really wide viewing angle. The only thing I really miss using the the new Acer is I no longer have a back illuminated keyboard. That it turns out was a bigger deal than I thought. Videos play without problem. My Ethernet adapter is supported natively by the Acer and the Acer is one of the few models available with a display port out over USB C. Great for Nasa imagery that my Smart TV (that is no longer updated) refuses to display. So the Acer Chromebook is sort of pricey but has better portability, battery life, and a display that none of my Windows Laptops can compete with.  It does make for a great internet PC.

review_title: What else can you need for this price?
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2021
review_text: I had heard good things about Chromebooks, and they were all confirmed when I bought this laptop. Before buying, I compared about 15 chromebooks from different manufacturers, and this was the one that had it all: touchscreen, lightweight, large screen, and separate keypad!Pros: In addition to the above, the sound is very clear, and the battery life is amazing. I barely have to charge it, and it boots up in literally a few seconds.Cons: If you are used to using MS Office Excel, you're going to have to pay for it separately, or use the Google alternative, which is frustrating for even the smallest tasks.Overall, very, very happy with the unexpectedly high quality that comes for the low price.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2022
review_text: This is my second Acer Chromebook. Was very happy with my first Chromebook but wanted to upgrade to a larger screen. The 15.6" screen is perfect. Super easy setup.  When you log into your Google account it automatically transfers most of the settings from a previous Chromebook to the new one. The battery life is an impressive 9-10 hours. My wife and I have a Google Chromecast dongle on our TV so it is very easy to cast videos from Youtube and Amazon Prime Video.My only complaint is that it is heavier than my previous Chromebook. We travel quite a bit so I will probably take my older Chromebook simply for its smaller size and weight. I guess that is the price you pay for a larger screen and battery. Overall an excellent laptop.

review_title: Overall Good Laptop. But Mediocre Battery Life for Multitaskers, Not Compatible with Most Powerbanks
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2024
review_text: Bought since it looked less flimsy than a skinny HP laptop that'd break after dropping, spent half its price repairing the monitor and it still broke a 2nd time after dropping again.It works pretty well, fast enough. The alternate trackpad and mouse buttons aren't that useful and I get them confused with the spacebar. The fingerprint sensor get inconsistent over time, but works generally.The battery life is not that impressive for what is advertised, at least when I use quite a few apps. I can get maybe 4 hours, even less when I was running looping python scripts in the background.Not for long-term outside use, like on roadtrips, and power banks won't work either because the higher voltage needed for the charger port. If you use it inside buildings near power outlets it'll be acceptable.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2023
review_text: Been using this laptop for a couple of months now and I really like it. Came in great condition, a few light scratches on the laptop but that is to be expected when you buy renewed.10th gen i7 still holds up really well. 16GB RAM is solid too. I am able to do everything I need to do for work and personal tasks. Very light and easy to walk around with. Touchscreen is a nice addition as well.My only complaint is that the Function and Ctrl keys are swapped compared to most other laptops/keyboards. I don't know why Lenovo does this. You can switch it in the BIOS but it's still weird.Overall this is a great work computer, I have not experienced any slowdown running my apps which are not too resource-intensive but not lightweight either. I definitely wouldn't recommend this for gaming or anything graphic intensive, but I do recommend it for basically anything else.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2023
review_text: This is the second Dell E7470 I've bought from this Microsoft Authorized refurbisher. The quality is superb and the delivery prompt. The laptop arrived in excellent (!) condition and looks brand new. In fact, I have not been able to find ANY sign of use or normal wear. 16G of memory (which I immediately bumped to 32) and a 512G M2 HD with Win10Pro installed. I removed that and installed a 1T M2 HD and copied an image from my older 7470 onto it and I am good to go. Running Linux Mint 21.3 with 5 virtual machines and it is blazingly fast, and stable. Plus it mates to the same docking station (Dell E-Port Plus II) I already have. The picture shows the laptop plugged into the dock and being used with a Corsair gaming keyboard and pair of Dell monitors. Plus I only paid $209 for it! This is an incredible deal on a highly capable machine for general office/home /student use. Again, practically new, inexpensive, and very, very capable. Very highly recommended.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2020
review_text: I really like this Surface Pro 7. It is exactly as advertised with one exception. The battery life is nowhere near what is advertised. On battery saving mode, using only Onenote for taking class notes, it lasts about 4 hours. Fortunately it charges up very quickly though. I can't see any way that I would get a full days use out of a full battery charge in any circumstance. In my case that is not very important because I am always around an outlet but if you need a tablet that will last all day away from a power source you will have a problem. The camera is good enough, not as good as the Apple camera, but I don't really use it as a camera anyway. I use mostly the 365 programs and find that it integrates these programs seamlessly. Onenote comes with the tablet and has been an amazing app for my vet school classes.  It saves my many hours of study time. My only issues are with the instability of Onenote. It closes itself down every few minutes and is very frustrating. I'm sure there is a fix for this but I'm also sure that I won't get it from Microsorft as they have a technical support team that is on par with the customer service team at the cable company. I've contacted them 3 times now and my issue is never addressed. I was actually told to contact Amazon since they sold it to me. It seems like after spending a thousand dollars on Microsoft products they would at least provide a bit of tech support.  I'll just have to scour the web for a fix to this I guess. Overall I would recommend this tablet to every student. It seems to be a fantastic and fast machine.

review_title: It is even better than you expected it to be...
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2020
review_text: My previous laptop was a godzilla, 15 inch monitor, weighs like 3 pounds or something (2014 model). I was looking for something that had the horsepower for what I needed, but also the lightness to carry it around. Although battery life isnt, the best, I DON'T MIND!This thing is a beast! Im very happy running programs like tableau, zoom, excel, powerpoint, all at the same time and with various files and this thing doesn't even flinch. The first few hours setting up and downloading all the programs it felt a big sluggish and I was starting to get worried. Once that was done, it started to fly.Yes, the rotating screen isnt as flawless as apple's iPad. That said, I bought this not to look pretty, i bought it to be my tool in battle. Being able to run all the programs that a regular PC can run is the main decision I went for Microsoft Surface.  The only downside is that Microsoft is a bit costly on the accessories front.I recommend this piece of tech to anyone who needs to travel or is on the move.  I'm a relatively big guy and i've had no major problem with the size of the keyboard. I do put it FLAT on tables because my keystrokes tend to be pretty hard and the keyboard is the most (in my opinion) fragile of the accessories.Lastly, the Pen interface is not perfect YET but oh man, as a first timer working with it, it kicks total ass and makes note taking in OneNote a complete positive trip.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2023
review_text: I bought the Surface Pro 7 at a very good price because it should be not long after the Surface Pro 8 was to be announced.  And because I liked it so much, I bought the Surface Pro 8 months later. I prefer the Surface Pro 7, because of the USB A port. That truly for me is convenient. And the keyboard has a better feel for me.

review_title: Don’t buy the surface pro 7 from amazon
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2020
review_text: Well where do i start..... i ended up getting my item and everything was good for about 20mins of use... however after 20mins my screen would freeze for 10-30 secs. I blew it off at first but then it happen 10mins after then it became a often issue. So i ended up going for an exchange. (The worst idea I’ve ever had). I called up amazon and told them my issue and they were quick to get me a replacement so as first i was satisfied until the surface pro 7 came in the next day. I open the box to find out the box it comes in is not only damage but in a renewed box didn’t even come in the same box it should have come in, then i open that to see the surface pro and the screen film wrapped around it was really dirty as if they dropped it in dirt or so and fingerprints all over the machine. So at this point I’m just hoping it works. This one was not charged at all at 15% like it usually is if you were to buy from Microsoft or an apple device would normally be. So i put it on the charger to find out that it not only has screen tear straight down the middle of the screen but a big red dot half the size of the screen was on there as if they drop the surface pro. So at this point i immediately call amazon and i talked to a representative that ended up giving me a hard time about another replacement even though this one was obviously there fault. So i ended up talking to a supervisor that ended up giving me a hard time as well and in the she said to me that they only do a exchange once but as a one time exception they’ll do the exchange to which i responded with i only want to do the exchange if it’s a brand new product that they are giving me not a renewed one and undamaged. To which she agreed that she would make sure it would be done and put in her notes so the wear house  knows. Well the next day came and guess what.... the man that drops it off throws my package at the wall of my house from a big distance he didn’t see me at all so when i raced over the man jumped in his car and quickly drove away knowing what he did. Not only this but when i open the box the surface pro again was in a dirty renewed box, at this point I’m just hoping it still even worked again no power so i plug it in and guess what it works surprisingly after all that. However i Notice something was different with the boot up process so i knew something was wrong i go to the setting of the computer and the version i bought was 8gb of ram i5 model with 128gb of memory the one i receive as a replacement this time was a 4gb version i5 model with 128gb of memory and GUESS WHAT A DIFFERENT GRAPHICS CARD AS WELL. The surface pro 7 i got not only had 4gb of ram which was wrong but a different graphics card as well that comes in a surface pro 5 are you serious.... so i called up customer service again asking for a supervisor yet again..... just wanting a refund the man told me well i see here that you have a couple of exchange for this device already so i told him this story i am telling now and ask him i wonder why i have “a couple of exchanges” to which he said well instead of a refund i can get you a brand new one and told me how he had to make a couple of phone calls to do this for me so i told him this is the last exchange I’ll be getting ill be asking for a refund next like i previously wanted..if the next one comes in the renewed box which that would mean it’s used.. if it’s broken or the wrong model I’m done with trying and I’m done with the surface pro 7. not only was this the worst experience with amazon that I’ve ever had and worst costumer Service but now I’m going to hate the surface pro 7 because of this. I’ll see what i receive next as of 02/23/2020Sorry for the long review but i felt my experience should be shared for others to see.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2021
review_text: I use this as my go to school/work laptop, as well as a drawing display. For both the surface works well, switching between modes is flawless and the pen is very responsive. I got the matte black one, and while i like the color it does chip easily, with light usage there is some chips in the paint but that is to be a expected with matte colors, they just don't hold up as well. I would not recommend getting matte black for a child or if you are a heavy user. Another thing is that the batter doesn’t last long when using the surface continuously even when on battery saver, I'm a student so there are times where i could be using it for hours at a time, pretty much after 4 hours I’ll have to plug it in. Which leads me to the charger itself, the connector is magnet based and not a real port so to speak, so its very weak. If you’re like me and you like to use laptops on the couch or in bed its going to constantly come unplugged from shifting and movement. Its very annoying i wish it was just a normal charging port. The battery and charging port are the main reasons i rate this 4/5 stars, the decision to get matte black was on me so ill take that L, but over all i do like this laptop/tablet. I don’t use this for gaming so I don’t know how it holds up there, but i cant imagine having steam, discord, and whatever other apps open and having it run just as well as a dedicated desktop, this is more of a light work laptop. As i said before i do use this for drawing and for that it does hold up well. I typically have a few chrome tabs open and a large canvas while drawing (5600x6000px 600dpi) and even when i get up to 40 layers i don't experience lag. And unless you’ve got eagle eyes, you wont notice any delay from the pen, unless you’ve got some high stabilization settings. If you’re looking to upgrade your laptop or looking to consolidate your tech, this is a great product. This totally killed my need for my ipad and runs way better than my old 2017 laptop, so much so that i ended up selling both of them.Some notes:- the pen is sold separately but i do recommend getting it if you plan on drawing or using the surface to write notes.- if you plan on getting a keyboard with it I recommend the brydge surface wireless keyboard, the hinges are strong and really make the surface feel like a laptop

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2019
review_text: I initially bought a Surface Go(8gb) for a gift and when I had it in my hands I fell in love with the Surface. I had to get one for myself. Since I didn't find another 8gb surface go model, I went w/ the Pro 7 i5/8gb model myself. I am in love with this device. Watching netflix is great,  Illustrator and other drawing software works great w/ the surface pen. Keyboard took a few minutes to get the hang of it and I quite enjoy it, it works well. It is a bit heavy when holding it w/ one hand (this is why I loved the Surface GO version for normal tablet use) but it is quite light overall.Also tested a few games and it actually surprised me a bit tacking into account this is the i5 model. I am able to play Halo Reach just fine, (note that I had to lower the resolution down to 1080p) and it plays good. Minecraft plays really well. I didnt actually get this for gaming ( lol ) but it plays light games just great (of course it gets warm w/ Reach). StardewValley FTW! Currently this is my primary device and it performs extremely well. If you have the extra cash, do go for the i7 model mainly for the 16gb of RAM. OS consumes around 2.5-3GB of ram, so that doesnt leave much left on the 8GB model. I personally did not have an extra 500$ just to get the i7 model.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2020
review_text: I waited a couple of years to move to a Surface.  Wasn't sure if it was more a tablet than a computer or computer than a tablet.  Got a couple of bucks and dove in.  So far, it is just what I wanted, a computer that works like a tablet.  The speeds are great. The screen fantastic. It takes my Office 365 with ease. The keyboard works great when I am not using the docking port. And the ease of the docking port allows me to use a 32" screen with my Surface. I use online for most documents so the 128 SSD is plenty for what I need to store at home. Plus it coupled perfectly with my WD backup system.  I haven't  been disappointed yet and I don't expect to be.  Recommend this to anyone.  Unless you have to have high levels of storage or demand faster processing time this Surface at this price should meet all your needs.

review_title: Bad battery life, touch screen not very responsive
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2024
review_text: Never frozen but every time I turn this thing on from full shut-down, I lose about 35% battery life. Extremely weak battery life. It doesn’t last as long as it’s advertised. The touch screen is nowhere as responsive as iPad or iPhone. Very frustrating so I have to use a mouse all the time.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2020
review_text: I love this thing! I'm primarily using it as a writing tablet and e-reader for part-time grad school, and I'd like to start using it for work (engineer). It's improved my workflow a ton. The Surface Pen is great and the magnet makes for a very secure attachment. I considered the Surface Pro X, because it has an option for stowing the slim pen in its keyboard but opted for the regular surface pen after trying them out in a retail store.I've deducted one star because:The large bezel. Doesn't bother me much at all, but it really doesn't stack up to competitor designs in 2019/2020. Still looks very sleek overall.Windows 10 works surprisingly well in tablet mode, but Microsoft is really missing an opportunity by not having a good built-in or Office e-reader (epub, pdf, mobi support) with pen support for document/ebook markup. Edge doesn't cut it feature-wise. Luckily there's a popular app in the Microsoft Store called Drawboard PDF that works really well. The lack of Microsoft application support for critical Surface features is another reason for deducting a star! OneNote and other apps were great on here. I'd love to try an MS designed e-reader with pen support.

review_title: Nice Chromebook at a Great Price
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2024
review_text: I strongly support the recycling and refurbishment of computers.  When my old Chromebook would no longer update I purchased this one.  I wanted one with a lighted keyboard as I often use it in a room without adequate lighting.  This is my second HP Chromebook and it is a nice one.  It performs very well and I have had no issues.  Buy refurbished when you can.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2023
review_text: This is my 4th HP Chromebook since I believe 2013.  It is almost exactly like the one I purchased two years ago on Amazon that is still fully functional.  It's a great little device.  I like the backlit keyboard because it allows me to use the laptop late at night without any additional lighting source.  The sound system is great.  I can store everything I need to store.  No complaints.  I hope this one lasts as long as all the others.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2023
review_text: I've had this laptop since April 2022 & never had a problem. This is the first time that I've used a Chromebook & absolutely love it!! Before this one I had bought one that had Micrsoft OS & hated it. Sent it back & bought the HP. The screen is excellent, very clear. The speakers could be a little better. It seems that the sound comes out of one side even though it has dual speakers beside the keyboard, so, thus not giving a true stereo sound. However, the sound is very clear which I appreciate. Now for the battery. I have NEVER had electronics like this one as far as battery life & the lightning fast charge. I am so impressed with this. I use this everyday from the time I get up until I go to bed which is more than 16 hours. When this one eventually wears out, I will definitely buy another HP.Update: Oct 15, 2023I just wanted to give an update to this. I am still so very pleased with this laptop. I'm still in awe of the speed in the charging time. However, the sound is barely noticeable, with certain shows, which has been a big disappointment for me. Therefore, I did take a star away. But I still highly recommend this as a good purchase.

review_title: Get it for under $100.00, yes, over, you can do better !
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2023
review_text: After around 24 hours it has begun to wake up, especially after the long hours of seemingly endless UPDATES !Now that it is done with that, the touch screen is the first issue, it works fine but is NOT an IPS screen so getting situated to see properly does take some effort but in the end it's not too bad.The specs on site said it would have the Celeron N 4020 but this one came with the 4120 which has 4 cores rather than 2 so it can handle more and is a bit quicker.Everyday tasks are easy once you dive around inside and rattle around to see what all you can modify and for me being an Android user for 20 plus years, Windows is like taking a big step back in time.....5 moves to do one thing where Android and Chrome OS are one maybe two moves to one.The interesting thing with Windows 11 is how they have blended Google Chrome features with Windows, I guess if you can't beat them BLEND them and that is a very good thing!The laptop case itself is super nice if you hate wiping fingerprints off of everything, H.P. textured the surfaces and no fingerprints and easy to hang onto!Sound is good, picture eh so so, touch is...touch, it performs well, does very well with video's and once it gets on its feet it does quite good and this is coming from someone who swore off Windows over 20 years ago!

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2023

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2022
review_text: I bought this to replace a 12 year old Compaq laptop that was used for basic-general stuff like receiving and sending emails, Facebook, and general Internet searches.  We have a couple of other computers, laptops in the house for more serious-intense stuff so I wasn't looking for a powerful, heavy duty laptop.  When I'm typing (even as I type this review), periodically the letters will jump to a previous portion that I already typed and I'll have to delete and place the cursor back to end of the text and retype it in.  This happens fairly frequently.  Also, as I type, out of the blue a whole section of what I've typed will become highlighted for no reason and then it will delete itself and force me to start over.  If the older Compaq's E key and 3 weren't malfunctioning, I would have kept it.  As old as it was, it was a better, more reliable laptop.  The highlight issue I referred to above just happened and I had to stop, take my hands off the laptop and wait for it to go away.  Knowing what I know now, I would not purchase this laptop.  I would definitely have been better served by spending a little more money for a better quality product.  I'm not expecting it to last long.  I got rid of the packaging but I will contact AMAZON TO SEE IF I CAN RETURN IT>  SUDDENLY< OUT OF NO WHERE IT"S TYPING CAPITAL LETTERS AND THE CAPS LOCK ISN"T  ON.

review_title: Went back and forth with amazon trying to get this sent back, and gave up.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2023
review_text: Laptop started shutting down automatically, unannounced, (same problem I had started having with old laptop of many years) tried all fixes- and yes the power cord was plugged in-battery was in, checked settings, tried every fix, and tech support-refurbisher immediately understand and  wanted to rectify this,  however I went back and forth with amazon trying to ask for  a return label sticker and pickup.They just didnt seem to understand what I was requesting and It was like being caught in a  loop where I had to start multiple return processes in vain.  I do not have a smart phone, for many reasons, and I was told  I would need a QR code, and ,was asked If I could use someone elses phone, (which is no)Thats when I gave up, and said "forget" it  I  had  extremely inconviencing ups store/amazon returns having to travel to multiple ups stores  (after verifying the needed info by phone before departing) because I was reassured one thing,(by ups staff) and only to get there to  find that wasnt true and they wouldnt work with me on anything.  Kudos for the supplier of this computer for wanting to rectify a strange anomaly, so quickly. I will consider them in the future- it actually is an awesome computer that loads faster than any laptop i've had-ever, and not a single blemish scratch or mar. and not a single problem beyond that. It's now something I've chosen to live with as my work isn't  strictly computer intensive. I shudder when I see those  google based laptops(  this one is not ) with all the permission nightmares and bloatware- its no different than a big phone with keyboard.
